text: Super bomb!!! Only all you can eat Korean BBQ & Sushi place in town. Derek was awesome hooked up all the grilling and gave all sorts of recommendations.. Brand new reopened under new management... Can't wait to come back!
First time here and we had excellent food and service.  Our waiter explained how things work here.  Marinated meat is welll marinated they always change our grill basket when we burn our meat..lol

The best kalbi and bulgogi in Vegas! The succulent ribeye cut bulgogi strips are addicting. The kimchi was defiantly fresh and had beautiful, curious citrus notes. Worthy of mention are jalape√±o poppers! Holy God! If you just paid the amazing $21.95 for the all-you-can-eat dinner price, just for those, you'd walk out out of there feeling like you've invested in something regarding the afterlife... just heavenly! Service was solid. We'll be back soon!

very good food and a great staff
very nice resteraunt 
i like it
gr8 b8 m8 i r8 8/8 ayyylmao seriously though good stuff

Awesome! In town for EDC and was looking for a cool place to relax after the festival that is close by and has great food. Came by, wait was fast, and the food was great. I highly recommend this place. And it's all you can eat! Definitely a great place to come by if you're visiting. Joan was very helpful and he gave great customer service!
Very Good , Service and Excellent Food , On time No longer than 10 minutes for food & Our Waiter Rj has Excellent Service Very , Respectful, An I Would Recommend this To anyone To Everybody !!

First review on Yelp and I decided to write this while still in the restaurant. Came here for lunch and did the AYCE bbq and sushi like everyone else here, and we were really let down because basically nothing was fresh. In fact, the best thing we had the entire time was the starter salad, which is pretty sad. The banchan (side dishes) were all not quite up to par. The bbq was passable but meats were quite old. Sushi was the biggest shock because we couldn't keep eating after taking a few bites. All the rolls just tasted OFF and they were trying to disguise it by using a lot of sauces. Still can't cover that smell...! Service was good and attentive though, I guess that was the only positive aspect of this dining experience.
Good bang for your buck. Food was good and service was great, thanks Kim. Can't get this good food in the Midwest
The service here was great! Everyone was friendly and the food came out extremely fast. The food was just ok. We did AYCE Sushi and BBQ but the quality of the food was just ok.

Not bad. We came here for the first time as new LV visitors. You have 90 minutes to eat all you can before you have to pay and leave. For an "all you can eat", we expected more, but their meat was thinly sliced and only came out 2 at a time. Oddly, you feel fuller faster. Side dishes were my favorite.

First time trying out this hidden gem! Came here for my sister's birthday and I love that they have a variety of appetizers like cheese corn, shrimp poppers and tempura that you can order that other kbbq spots don't offer. Our server Ratana was very nice and attentive. He always checked in on us and made sure we were taken care of. For dessert, I tried the melon bar. Very subtle and sweet! Definitely will be back again!

Seems like Biwon is finally getting the recognition it deserved! Not bad for an establishment just open its door last year in a not so popular part of town. But if good food r prepared, word of mouth from satisfy customers will get U more business. My latest meal here with relatives from out of town was quite enjoyable except the menu has been cut back quite a bit from my previous experience. But we were full n satisfy with the current choices offer. Biwon is still one of the few favorite Korean BBQ spot in LV. But I think LV is still in infancy of trying to catch with SoCal, the capital of KBBQ!

We went for lunch, got the AYCE BBQ and the additional sushi option it was all delicious. The staff was very prompt and helpful. He took the time to explain our options as we were first timers. I recommend the beef belly!!

Wish I could give a lower rating. The food was very average and the service was AWFUL. The waitress avoided looking at us so that she wouldn't have to come over. The didn't say a word when she took our order. 
I was willing to wait the half hour to be seated (even though they weren't even busy), but then it took over an hour to even get our drinks. The staff doesn't care that you're even there. 
All the good rating on here are only because they offer a free drink if you rate them.. 
AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL.
Meat quality is bad. Also, their advertising is misleading for all you can eat. The big beef rib is not included. Very disappointed!
Great experience! First time here and can't wait to come back! Waiters and servers were very attentive and did everything with a smile!
The price is unbeatable, all you can eat sushi and k bbq for only 30 dollars. The k bbq is good, sushi is alright. Service is kind of slow but overall good experience. I would come back again
The first time we were here, everything tasted really good. But Ive been her couple of times. Love the idea of Sushi and KBBQ! Price is pretty reasonable.

Our all time favorite go to korean bbq place. Very delicious and tasty bbq! Place is clean and very pleasant presentation of dishes. Friendly manager and waiters. We love biwon! so yummmmmyyyy!!! and our server sue was really kind, friendly and helpful...

everything is good here! The sushi and the meat are fresh! We ordered unagi nigiri , ebi, salmon, inari, and so on. The fish is fresh, size is good, and the flavor is awesome. Make sure you know 1 order of sushi is 2 pcs.
For the BBQ, the meat is great, per order is good for 2 person. The service is good.

You gonna get what you pay for. Cheap price but cheap quality for both meat and sushi. We should have picked one either sushi only place or bbq place. They got great staffs thats why I am giving 3 star not 2.

You get a free scoop of ice cream if you put a good review, don't believe the hype or the yelp on this restaurant, was not happy with the quality of the food or taste, sushi was warm and not fresh at all, Korean BBQ was regretful. If you leave any food and don't eat there crap, they charge a la carte, in addition to your bill...

I went in here around 11 pm. I was ignored for probably 15-25 min upon arriving. The employees all saw me and my bf and no one came. Not even a greeting or information on the wait (if there even was one). I was stubborn because we were originally supposed to go somewhere else but things had gone wrong (car problems) and we ended up coming to this place, so I wasn't leaving. Finally got sat down and from there on out it went well. The server gave good service, but the food was a bit bland but obviously they give you so many side dishes that's hardly a problem. The sushi roll was almost warm, but it was a fresh roll so I was a bit uneasy eating that as well. Probably would've given more stars if they had bothered to acknowledge us when we got there and not avoid eye contact.

Yummy Kbbq for a cheap price after 10pm, good meat and great customer service with often grill changes and always asking if we wanted anything else. They have a Kbbq and a sushi side, and they can bring sushi to the Kbbq side. Joan was very friendly!

If I could've given zero stars I would've. I came on a weekday at 1:15pm and the restaurant is half empty. We were a group of 4, no one greeted us when we came in. After waiting for 5 minutes I walked up to the waitress and she told us to continue waiting. We sat there for half an hour before we were given one of the many empty tables. Then we continued to sit there for another 10 minutes without any service until we gave up and left. Their excuse was that they were short staffed. It's a weekday with a half empty restaurant! They weren't even busy! We ended up walking a block to the chick-fail-a and are now happily eating!

Great place to eat!!!   Great service as well. The food kept coming and coming. We never had to wait for anything. Derek was a great server and a cool guy to talk with.  Definitely will be back. Bulgogi and Kalbi were my favorites.
Food was great and service on point. Our server Derreck was super nice and accomodating. Been wanting to go here for awhile already and glad we did it today.

Awesome combo of ayce BBQ and sushi. We had great/fast service too!

The pork jowl, beef tongue and marinated short rib and chuck were great. The nigiri also came in nice bite sizes with not too much rice. Appetizer options were also great as well, got the corn cheese and soy bean paste soup. Would definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.

Worst kbbq experience ever! Yelp has five stars to give so I'll deduct one by one by listing these points why this place is absolutely horrible.
1. Customer service is lacks that it's basically non-existent. We were told we'd have to wait half an hour but this was understandable IF this place was busy. However, I only saw five parties. Two parties we're already sitting down, and three parties were in line. There were SO many empty tables and after waiting for so long with no chairs to sit I decided to ask the waiter why is there such a long wait when there are so many empty tables. Want to hear the reason? "Eh..we don't have enough staff and the other room is busy so we wouldn't be able to serve you if you sat down" what the bogus reason is this? Clearly they DO NOT know how to run a business. 

2. Food wait times - knowing we wouldn't be served because of their lack of employees (no idea why you would even open a business with like 3-4 employees for a supposedly a busy place) we ordered a couple of items on our first round but the proceeding rounds got worse as the time went by. We were neglected, orders were wrong or take forever to come. For example, I ordered THREE steamed eggs and received one, I ordered edamame and received it when I'm almost done eating my food. The waiter passed by and failed to deliver

3. Change of grill - we changed our grill twice. First time we waited about 5minutes, second time we probably waited like 15-20minutes. It feels like I was done with my food since nobody came around to ask if we're okay or even ask if we needed a grill change. How do you keep a business if you

4. Paying for the food - gave our card and they took forever to even give us the check to sign. We had to seriously walk up to the cashier to ask for the card back. The only Asian girl greeted us thank you (the same person who put us on the waitlist) looks like she was so lethargic. She said thank you but ignored our receipt that we signed. Do you even want our business????!!!

5. Yelp doesn't even allow zero stars otherwise that's what I'd give. Since they get one star I'll conclude with a few last pointers - Their selection is very small. Prices are overpriced for their selection and after this day, I definitely will NOT be returning back. We were FORCED to pay the 20% gratuity because we had 7 people but this was pretty steep of a percentage. I've been to other places and their food was much better, more selection and cheaper. Their sushi is also a lot of rice and when they delivered our sushi it didn't look so appetizing. Their fried calamari was not even crunchy/crispy. Water was refilled ONCE during our long wait periods
All in all - I don't know how this place is even alive or has 4 stars. I don't even know if this place even knows how to run a business. If you're short staffed why would the owner even allow so many employees off or if they didn't have enough people to begin with..wouldn't you think hiring people would be a good idea? It isn't rocket science biwon! It's more like bilost now.

Oh man, what can I say? The server we had was fantastic, and for our group of 11 treated us so well. Our drinks were always full, and our grills were always sizzling. The sushi was amazing and the meats were great as well. I could go on and on but I wanted to say that it's worth the trip off the strip.

Excellent customer service & great variety for the all you can eat. We ate like kings. 
They have a long list of meat to bbq & a long list of sides to eat with it.
Me and my friend ate there twice now and got food poisoning. That's $40 for 2 2√ó ($80 in all) for 4 days of hell. . NOT again. Just left for the last time
This is hands-down my favorite Korean restaurant in Vegas. Food is delicious, service is fantastic, and the prices are very reasonable. Love it!

I and my family wanted to try out KBBQ and sushi together so we went to this lovely restaurant. We went around 2:30 P.M so there was no wait time at all. We got seated and our server was very polite on how the whole AYCE system works and explained it very well. We ordered the Marinated sliced Ribeye, Spicy pork and the Beef Brisket. We also ordered the Ocean roll, Mushroom poppers and Shrimp poppers. The food came by very quickly (5 mins top) and let me tell you the Mushroom/Shrimp poppers are the bomb! It's a deep fried sort of sushi roll but on one side, it has a deep fried cap of sorts to contain the crab and mushroom together. It contains a lot of flavours such as a crab mix and sweet sauces. I would def recommend it if you are feeling for deep fried items. The Ocean roll was also very good being very crunchy while having other flavours go with it. Marinated sliced Ribeye is a must to order if you are getting KBBQ.  The beef brisket was also nice as it was already Marinated a bit and tasted quite good. Although the spicy pork was not one of my favorites, I made sure to order the Ribeye 3 more times because it tasted real good. Also to mention that the servers made sure that we were doing fine and changed the grill often. They also helped us to cook our food and were always very happily to take our order. On our second order, we got more mushroom poppers and 3 different sushi rolls. All of it arrived very quickly and boy did we eat it fast. Although the sushi wasn't anything special it was well worth the 5 dollars we spent. To finish all off we had some Green tea ice cream. Let me tell you, this is so damn good ice cream. All of our family got at least 3 more big scoops of it 'cause it was def better than most ice cream you can find here in LV. To sum it up, they have a lot of options to choose from just for the Lunch option. It all tasted very nice (Except for the spicy pork) and I would def come here again.
Food comes out within a timely manner l, the brisket sauce is to die for. Very pleased with the service. Also the side dishes are an amazing compliment to the food.

This place was really good. The food was very good, and the customer service was on point. The waiters had a very good sense of humor and showed that they care about how we are doing. They even cook the food for you at times! I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves Korean BBQ/sushi.

Sooo freakin good! We got the all you can eat Korean BBQ, mostly ate the short ribs, pork belly and marinated beef. All were delicious and extremely flavorful. The waiters were nice and attentive which was also a plus. It was pretty deng good, just a little pricey compared to SoCal.

Came in as a group of 4 on a Wednesday afternoon. We couldn't decide on sushi or Korean BBQ so came here since they had both. But it was a bad choice because they weren't that good with either. Sushi was poorly made with small pieces of fish and not too fresh either. Meat quality for Korean BBQ wasn't great, but not terribly bad. I wish they had more dipping sauces that are usually available at other Korean BBQ places. There was an abundance of banchan dishes though. Service wasn't so hot either. I know we came in at an odd time - around 4pm - so it was really slow. They would disappear for a long time and we had to wait a while to put in orders and even to pay. With so many choices that Vegas has to offer, I probably wouldn't be returning here.

Went there with 5 friends on the recommendation that the food and service was good. Tried some new dishes,  very tasty.  If you get there try the steamed eggs.  They cook it all up right there in front of you.  Prices are reasonable and service was great.
The best place to eat Korean BBQ, The food taste so good and fresh. The service is always on top of it
Great food! I love how this place has Korean BBQ AND sushi! They're also open late. I love it! I love their lobster roll!

We came here as a party of 3 on Super Bowl Sunday. It wasn't busy due to the event, so the speed of the service caught us off guard.

The idea of AYCE Korean BBQ and Sushi was exciting. I personally enjoyed the meat; how it was seasoned and the dipping sauce. Sushi was decent; it wasn't bad but I've had better at other AYCE Sushi restaurants. 

There were 3 servers that assisted us, and I don't recall any of them smiling or looking like they wanted to be there. We ordered a fairly good amount in the beginning hoping it would help speed up the process. They brought out the meats quick but we didn't receive some items until towards ending of our meal, which at that point we were ready for our check.

Ribeye was so tender and juicy! The meat quality was so good that it was definitely comparable to one of those non-AYCE KBBQ place! I loved the dressing of the lettuce salad and marinated meat was also on point  unlike other KBBQ joints that tends to be a little bland. Service was great too! :)

What I can say about Biwon is that it's AMAZING!! The service was on point ( thank you Jayden S), server came to check up on us consistently. Very friendly atmosphere. The food is spectacular, with a large variety of meats and sides! Highly recommend Jalape√±o poppers they're bomb! Also great prices not over priced and, great quality food. Been here multiple times and they never disappoint. Definitely will continue to come every time I come to Vegas! Best kbbq with the best flavor in town!
Went here's for the 1st time on Christmas Day with my sister who was visiting from Sante Fe. Had an awesome experience with all can eat sushi and our sushi chefs Danny and Joseph were so AMAZING!!!

Very cheap poor quality meat. We also did all you can eat sushi and we were served rotted yellowtail! The service was pretty bad as well. Definitely would not recommend this place or will never go back. We were told if we didn't eat the 2 pieces of sushi we had left they would charge us a lot ! So many other good Korean BBQ places to eat in town and sushi spots!

The waitress was awesome!!! 
Food was ok but they no longer serve the kalbi. 
And it is not as good as my first time.
Still think it is the best AYCE Korean bbq in town.

This is probably my favorite Korean BBQ place, the food is so good! The servers are so nice and helpful and were more than willing to explain things when we told them it was our first time here. They also periodically came and aske us if we wanted more food or drink. The all you can eat bbq is great, and although we didnt get the sushi portion, it also look good. I will definatly be returning here!!
The meat is good, and I love their Icecream Sandwich. the beef large intestine is very good
This is my favorite korean bbq in town. I come here for their fresh kalbi and beef brisket. Give it a shot, their AYCE is only $19.99/person. You won't regret it!

We did the BBQ and sushi. For the price, food was acceptable. Remind you that don't expect the same quality and service as the ones in L.A.  Appetizers were good but that's about it.  One disappointing though is they ran out of kimchi and is not even a busy night.  kimchi is a stable of Korean cuisine and they ran out. My DH was not happy he didn't get his kimchi with his bbq meat.

First time here and this place is amazing! Love the building and the food smells amazing! When we got the food, the lady put it on the grill for us. It is really good and the environment is really nice. I am glad to eat the all you can eat BBQ while my friends have both BBQ and sushi.
Bomb! Korean BBQ good, sushi was even better! Recommend to get the Vegas roll! Deep fried goodness!

This is very close from strip.
All you can eat bbq is bery good. Mlre than average. Server is very friendly. Seating wss sup ere fast. Interior is little outdated. But compared to other ayce bbq, I. Strongly recommend to try this restailurant.

I've been to all of the korean bbq restaurants in town but this is the BEST one of all. The quality of meat is not comparable to any other all you can eat korean bbq places. I can proudly say this is one of our family's favorite restaurants. Thank you Biwon! for the great services and the delicious foods. You should definitely try this place if you are a meat lover :)
Soooooo yummmy ! Enjoyed my birthday here !!!!!!! Good was grate ! Server was really friendly ! Thank you biwon !
The meat are very good and the fried chicken is a must try, my son ate the whole fried chicken plate and asking for more. Also love all dipping sources. Highly recommend!

My wife and I didn't know what to expect when we came into Biwon, but we were seriously impressed. Not only was our server Jayden friendly and attentive but the staff seemed to work in unison and met our every need. However the best part by far was the food. All you can eat for a great price and Biwon didn't slack on the quality of their food. I highly recommend Biwon and my wife and I will be returning again soon.
Great service!! And the price for both sushi and kbbq is very reasonable. Great food as well and great choices!

Had lunch here yesterday (a Sunday afternoon)
Amazing amazing amazing
I have been to Korean bbq in la ,San Diego,San Fran and you guys did it right!! 
Great service all the staff pitches in making everything fast and feel like your the only person there.:: good job guys.... sushi was fresh and great and the meats just awesome... and kuddos to changing the grill between meats with out asking.. you guys rock!!!!!
My new second home with Danny and Joseph I really love this place the food is amazing and the hospitality is even better

*This review only reflects the customer service*

My girlfriend and I we're admittedly pretty stoked at the prospect of AYCE Sushi AND Korean bbq when we drove past Biwon a few weeks back. 
We checked on-line to make sure it was going to be open late after I got off work. It said 3am closing time. 

We showed up at 1:20 am on a Friday night and sure enough there's a sign on the door saying that its open until 3am. When we walk in a small, tatted-up asian dude "greets" us. He doesn't say "Hi" or "Welcome to Biwon", he says "Last call 20 minutes" with a shitty look on his face. We asked if that was for sushi and bbq and he said yes, and quickly returned to his reciepts. Not wanting to feel rushed, we verbally elected to return at an earlier time the next night. The guy heard us say it. 

Now we usually would have just said screw this place and never went back, however the promise of Sushi and BBQ was enough to lure us back. So we go back the next night (a Saturday) about 12:30am when we walk in the same tatted-up asian dude is at the hostess/host stand going over his nights reciepts again. He asks us " Two for BBQ?". We reply "Oh,both sushi and bbq". He then tells us that sushi is only until 10:30...every night. And with an "I couldn't care less look" he put his head down once agian, more interested in his cloing work than taking care of the customer.

WTF! Why would you not tell us that the night before when you knew we were coming back?!

The food may be the bomb,but, I'll never know...because I won't be back a third time.
Quality meats and side dishes. The service was good, could have checked on us more frequently. Overall a good experience. Will be back.

Definitely one of the best kbbq I've had. There were a good selection of meats to choose from and a wide selection of appetizers as well! I was mostly surprised by the wide selection of appetizers because many Korean barbecue places don't offer options for appetizers. 

The restaurant was very clean and spacious. We didn't reek of kbbq when we left the restaurant, which is definitely a huge plus! Also, our waitress was very attentive of us and even helped cooked our meats!
Never thought there would be a Korean Barbecue/ Sushi combination place out here in Vegas. Would come back again.

"Can I do half rolls?" Waitress goes "I don't know, I have to ask" ... "Can I get a green tea ice cream and a popsicle at the same time?" Waitress goes " I think so"...
Girl ll do u work here??? 
Food was meh... Service is bad. I came with a friend. And for so many so orders she only brought one. Like r we supposed to share???

Very quick service and constantly checking up on us despite us being in the sushi bar and everyone else in the BBQ tables. At one point they forgot to refill my bf's water but it's no biggie. Sushi was good, out of three rolls we liked Panic the most. Would definitely come back.
This is so goooood. Possibly the best place I've ever been. Like the sushi . And the cooking . Also the servers have a fast reaction. Good Job guys.
First time eating Korean bbq and I'm very impressed. Our waitress Daisy was very attentive and it was her first day! She was still getting trained, but great service and great food.
Best Korean bbq outside of Korea. Get the intestine, well worth it! Came here for my birthday and I'm extremely satisfied.

We have been searching for a good ayce korean bbq. Have tried gen and wasnt impressed. Also frequented tofu hut and although the price is good, quality is something thats lacking. So i searched up on both yelp and google and decided on biwon. 

Had no clue what to expect, but once we got there we did have to wait and parking was difficult. This is definitely casual dining and you might want to dress in clothes that you dont mind getting oil splashes on. We ended up waiting around half an hour to 40 minutes but considering it was fathers day, that is acceptable. 

We ordered a wide variety of appetizers and entrees. Ill list them according to my favorites; entrees then appetizers;
1. Garlic beef belly
2. Ribeye
3. Beef brisket
4. Beef tongue
5. Spicy pork
6. Pork belly

1. Tempura calamari
2. Garlic calamari

The quality of the meats were very good. It was also the first time i have tried beef belly and let me just say that it was frickin amazing! Soft, juicy, packed full of flavor as you cook it with the farlic sauce. It is a bit fatty but thats expected from a belly cut. This is definitely the highlight of my food adventure here and if you do visit this place, make sure to order at least 2 servings. The ribeye also had good marble and was tender. Make sure to not overcook or unevenly cook it. The beef brisket and tongue were of good quality as well. The rest were standard at any korean bbq place. Oh i alost forgot. The ban chan was delicious as well, from the fish cake to a variety of kime chee and pickled vegetables.

As for service, everyone was nice and welcoming. Our server was awesome and didnt shy away from engaging with us and answering questions or cracking jokes. It is a busy restaurant so do expect some delays but its nothing to complain about. 

I highly recommend this place, but do go early and expect to hover around the area trying to snag a parking stall. Dont worry its all so very worth it!

Food was on par with other korean restaurants. 
Sushi was also on par except for nigiri which didnt taste fresh. The rolls were good however. 
Unfortunately for this visit and despite all the great reviews i would have to end with a 3 star. The service could use improvement.

Our kbbq orders were delivered but a lot of our sushi orders were taking a long time. Somewhere in the process the orders for the second round of sushi was lost and it took our family multiple reminders to the wait staff to get our orders filled. This was an hour long process. 

My father started getting heated up, and whomever seemed to be the manager came up and clarified the order professionally and fixed the issue which is why i am up to three stars. We arent a very needy family but we felt we were left on our own a lot and for long durations. Often left  flagging down wait staff for many many things, but it did not seem like they were understaffed at the time in relation to the amount of tables and customers.

They take reservations which was a pleasant suprise and we were immediately seated. At 7pm on a sunday there was about a 30 min wait for kbbq section if one  had no reservations, which is about where the competition is at during sunday dinner.

All in all kbbq was great, nigiri dept could use a boost and customer service could be warmer and more frequent. Maybe just maybe will return but not for a while.
Just flew in from Oahu and after checking in hotel straight to Biwon,friendly service,and for AYCE big pieces of meats,huge variety and mist important taste awesome,"broke da mouth" kine grindz!!!

By far this is my favorite Korean BBQ. If i had the chance i would come here just to eat cause i live in California, near the beach. But although, calamari was good. The bulgogi was good and the pork belly.

Walked in here about 1215 am and was told it was about a 20 min, well 45 min later and still no table and then the hostess gives my table away to the couple after us. So finally an hour later we get our table and we walk into the dining room and there are about 10 tables that are empty. I was like wth??? We waited that long and it wasn't even packed in there. You can tell they just didn't wanna work and make money that night. So my hubby and I went for the ayce Korean bbq and added the ayce sushi as well since it was such a good deal. Well you get what you pay for coz it wasn't the best I've had. The meat was ok. We ordered the brisket and beef belly.....stay away from the pork skirt steak it was the worst tasting piece of meat we ever tasted. Very gamey  so gross. The sushi was meh, they put too much rice. Oh and what kind of Asian restaurant runs out of rice???? Yup and they offered rice paper and extra veggies but there would be an extra charge. Anyway don't waste ur money here. There are way better kbbq out there. Service sucks and food is cheap. I'll stick with Hwaro...they meats are delish and the workers r super nice.
The best Korean BBQ and sushi restaurant in Vegas with the best quality of meats and sushi. This is a must go to.

This is a new business. It used to be the Shilla restaurant.

I've been really excited to try this place. AYCE sushi AND AYCE Korean BBQ at the same time is unheard of. It's two of my favorite food options together!

Anyways, place is very clean. The staff was attentive, but one seemed like she was having the worst day ever. You have the option of doing only one versus two. The price also changes for lunch menu versus all day menu. The have a lot of different appetizer options. We went with shrimp tempura, gyoza, and bacon wrapped asparagus. We wished we had room for the mussels. My only complaint was the tempura and gyoza didn't come with separate sauces. They have a "no rice" section with 3 or 4 choices. I tried the "something special". It includes deep fried eels, spicy tuna, and Cajun sauce wrapped in spy paper. If you like a little kick I recommend trying it. Its texture is different. Their "Tuna Poki" is yummy as well. They use the spicy sesame seed oil, so watch out for the creeping small fire. From the nigiri, I gave the garlic tuna a try. I didn't really care for the dried garlic as the garnish. They used a little more rice than I like, but honestly better than other places. I was sad that they didn't have the super white tuna as a choice, only the albacore tuna. They have the traditional  specialty rolls, but a lot of different takes of their own. For instance a bacon roll or the even more intriguing lobster roll. They really should look into doing half rolls.

The Korean BBQ side was delicious. They had a lot more varieties of what meats or seafood to BBQ. The dipping sauce was a way too salty though. I was sad they didn't bring out kim chi, only oi muchim. I was happy to find there was no limit for how many short ribs you're able to get. They grilled it for us this time. Sadly we didn't have room for dessert and it was too early for alcohol. I definitely recommend giving them a try.

Finally an ayce sushi AND korean bbq place in vegas! We paid about $27 per person for dinner. Which is quite affordable for ayce sushi and kbbq. This place is The only one of its kind right now to serve both types of food for ayce. The place had only been opened for two months so far.

Its up the street from umc hospital. The service was really great. The staff was very attentive. I swear at one point there were five workers attending to us at one time to deliver our food, take away dishes, and order some more. They kept asking us if we needed anything else. The server even cooked and cut our meats for us. 

Theres three sections of the restaurant. One is the sushi bar, another is the sake room, and the kbbq room. Kbbq was delicious. The sushi was on the mediocre side when it came to taste. I really like the dessert options. They give u actual korean ice cream bars or ice cream sandwiches still wrapped in their individual packages. I imagine this place to get hot and new soon. I wish the best success for this business. I am definitely coming back and telling my friends about this place.

Pros:
Large selection of meats 
Meats are tender and flavorful 
Large selection of appetizers and all delicious (particular favorites were the cheese corn and seasoned edamame)
Great service and accommodating staff (came here for a birthday, and they helped present the cake to the birthday boy)

Cons:
Can't be seated until most of the party is present
Hard to find parking! But definitely worth it

Waiter was 1st class and service was 5 star.  Food came promptly and everything was pretty tasty.  Only minor quib is that chicken wings were okay not great like everything else.  Seating literally took 5 minutes.  Try the pork marinated, its delicious.
This place is yummy and it's all you can eat. The marinade is great and the servers are so attentive.

This place has become a ritual for us.  My wife and I come to  Vegas once a month usually for a week and this is the first place we come once we check into the room. 

Our favorite has become the Brisket and Kalbi.  Service is fantastic. They know how to make their customers feel welcome. 

Not to mention our 3 year old LOVES helping us cook the food.  

Its an awesome place that I HIGHLY recommend coming to!
This is actually a really dope spot. Parking sucks, but the food and service was great. We Yaya ally have a hard time picking kbb or sushi this was the best of both worlds.
LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Clean & friendly. Everything is fresh & full of flavor. Just a hidden gem!!!

Had herd good things about this place so I wanted to check it out. Turns out it was super delicious. Fish was fresh and mouth watering, all the meat was very well marinated and full of flavor. Derek ended up helping out with the grill and all the meat was spot on and perfectly cooked. Nothing under cooked and nothing over cooked. Was very helpful with all questions and explained things thoroughly. Side dishes tasted delicious. Friends got beer and they enjoyed it. Everyone got different things they like and we were able to all enjoy what we like together. Great experience. Really good times. Ambience is nice, good music on low volume so when room is full people are not screaming over eachother. Clean and inviting when you enter the doors. Very welcoming staff too! Ask for Derek and make sure you get a Melon popsicle.

The place is delicious!!! My family wanted all you can eat sushi so we went to biwon...id go back everyday!!! The food was fresh, creative and just delicious! The wine. The sake. The food. It all makes for a great experience!
Had the AYCE kbbq and was disappointed ...not as good as other AYCE places and was too salty on all their marinates..and pan chan (little side dishes) too.. Will not return.

Finally a place to fulfill my korean bbq and Sushi cravings in one place!  You can actually order AYCE sushi while you're eating AYCE BBQ at your grilling table! They also have soju and Korean style rice wine to make your meal even tastier! They also make authentic korean side dishes with the freshest ingredients they shop for that week. Everyone is super nice and the service is fast. Ryan the owner is amazing and can walk you through menu if you have any questions.

I normally stop here solo for a casual lunch but this time I took a friend here for dinner and he loved it. 

Never disappoints and the energy around dinner was such a good vibe. 

If you're looking for a cool, discreet and inexpensive little nook with up to par food then this is for you.
Fantastic service! The people were fast and efficient in delivering our meals on time.
The price is awesome! Staff is friendly and the service isn't bad. They offer a good amount of meat for ayce. They have an all day and a lunch and night special.

This restaurant is an interesting concept. Sushi and Korean BBQ! Must Try. Wanted Sushi, someone wanted BBQ. Best of both. 

It's near the end of the Las Vegas Strip. The cost was $23 AYCE!

This is by far my favorite KBBQ AYCE!!!! and i'm from San Jose, so we have a ton back where i live. The meat here is marinated so well, and the beef are very juicy! Also a plus they have add on AYCE Sushi as well!!!! Such a good price for what you're getting. I love their calamari, corn, and fish cake appetizers! And as for beef, i LOVE their bulgogi, unlike other places where they slap a shit ton of meat onto a plate, this place slices them so they're so much easier to cook and eat. My other favorites are the Beef tongue, brisket, and sirloin!!! 10/10 would recommend to a friend

I love Korean BBQ and I love sushi.... so what's better than combining the two... all you can eat sushi and BBQ!! 

I was excited to try a new Korean place but I'm always wary because I'm from LA... and I'm also Korean. I'm picky when It comes to Korean food and it can never really compare to LA food. 

So, why the three stars? 

Mainly the service. The younger waitress was helpful and did a great job of accommodating me, but the older Korean waitress was rude and couldn't get us out soon enough. We were in there a while but we certainly didn't have our fill.

The meat was... ok. It was nothing amazing but it was good enough. The sushi, I wasn't really too fond of because it didn't really suit my taste buds. But not that it was good. 

There was ample selection and frankly a little overwhelming. I couldn't decide what I wanted because I wanted everything. They were quick about changing the grill and came by to cook the meat fairly frequently. 

What I did like is that they did have the different sauces available, but you need to ask. For true Korean BBQ people, you always ask for ssamjang. They also had my chili garlic sauce, but all of it was given only by request. Just FYI. 

I would probably return again and give it another shot. It wasn't the greatest food I've had but it wasn't the worst. And besides, it's a great place if you have friends who don't like sushi but like BBQ and vice versa.

i thought sushi at a korean joint would be subpar but it, and everything else, is far from that. extremely hospital service, delicious food, and the price was unbelievably affordable. coming from california, i'm seriously considering making it a point to come back to vegas just to eat here again.

Boof ass restaurant, so yea me n my bomies came here to eat because our class was cancelled. Obviously we gna smoke a bit, get faded and eat ya know.Real nigga activities. 
There's only a total of 6 people eating in the restaurant and the waitress was dummy slow. Didnt even refill my homie's cup once
Waiter didn't even come once within 30mins of our first order*
Takes them 15mins to make a half roll
Playlist trash, im trynna turnup and eat when it's only 12:34pm, not simp,cry, and eat
#BSNGANG 
If you a crip and you stop at a red light, you a bitch

Wow. Fantastic service and food. All you can eat sushi & Korean BBQ. So impressed. I expected poor quality but the food was top notch. The service could not be better. Super kind, friendly & accommodating.  Not very crowded on a Monday, but full on the weekend per staff. The kimchi is fantastic & hot. The banchan was plentiful. So many options!!! Even dessert is included. Definitely recommend.

For an AYCE sushi and bbq place, for $20-$25..this is not bad. Actually pretty good for what they want to do here. A bbq/sushi combo, that's pretty rare too. You do have to wave down the servers, I wish they had those table buttons. That being said, we just don't like AYCE places in general, so even though it's down the street, we probably won't come here that often. But if you want to get your eat on, this is the place!

Wish I took pictures of how amazing the food looked!! Such a nice selection!! An you can't find sushi and Korean BBQ anywhere else!! The staff was so friendly and attentive. Cannot wait to come back and bring more friends!

Last dinner on our trip from Hawaii and decided to give this place a try which was recommended by others who tried this place out while on vacation. Being from Hawaii usually AYCE are a bit pricey so the price was pretty cheap. Love that there were a variety of appetizers to choose from and meats. In my opinion food tasted delicious and would definitely come back if I'm back in Vegas

Service is bad. Manager didn't smile or even greet us, she just nodded her head whenever we asked for something. Meat quality is good though. Waiters didn't come by the table enough so we had to keep calling for them. That's the most annoying thing to have to deal with at a Kbbq. 
Don't come here. The sushi sucks too.
I love this place ! The sushi is really good and the people who works there really affable. I have gone to other sushi restaurants but never like this one . Excellent food and service !
Highly recommended to locals that are looking for quality KBBQ experience. Dolores, our server was really friendly and attentive. Overall, Food and service was great.

So good!! We usually go to gen and went here for a bday party I love that they offer sushi as well as bbq they don't skimp of food let me tell you! Everything was clean and good the parking sucked that is the only negative thing I could say!

Use to love this place , hadn't been here in about a month. Came today food is different , staff is different, disappointing won't be back now . They are not even attentive with the service and they had like 6 waiters.

I enjoyed the BBQ portion of Biwon's menu today for lunch. The quality of this restaurant is definitely above average. The portions are generous and the flavor is authentic and robust. The food is absolutely outstanding. 

I thought their pricing was very fair and was impressed by their selection. My only suggestion is that they either turn on or fix their air conditioning. I spent my entire lunch sweating so much that I almost did not enjoy my meal. The wait staff was polite and came to check on us regularly. 

This was my second time coming to Biwon's. I'll be back around for more once Summer is over and the heat subsides.
First time here we really enjoyed the food special at 1:40am and it's open till 3am you can't beat that

This hidden gem, is hard to spot because it seems like it is located in like an alley way. When entering it has a very spacious waiting area. Sushi & Kbbq! The best of both worlds :) didn't get to try the sushi but id definitely love to someday & i know this wont be my last time! 

Pros: Great service; they made sure to check on us, re-fill our waters, clear our plates. Food is great! Really enjoyed the cheese-corn, mushroom poppers & no complaints about the meats. Liked the dessert, especially the Korean ice cream sandwich. No other restaurant has this kind of variety.

Cons: No rice paper; that's just my personal preference& i wish dessert wasn't an additional charge.

I wish I could give 5 stars but it kills me that our service was not good. Our waitress didn't fill our drinks. Our sushi order wasn't complete (it took so long I didn't bother asking her again.) She turned off our grill and didn't bother to ask if we wanted to order any more meat to cook (which we did). The waiting for the food is ridiculous we were there for almost 3 hours. The food is good but this may be a first and a last for me. Service is a deal breaker.
It was ok. Not great on the sushi have yet to try their bbq. The sushi was kinda bland wasnt super tasty and the "specialty" rolls were a bit pricey for the flavor amd the size

From the beginning it was all bad. The waiter dropped soy sauce on one of us and never apologized. Uni was super brown and not okay to eat. It was very difficult to get our servers attention to make more orders. 

And I've came before with a big party of 50 for our work party. And they did well. 
But this time it was just weird service the moment we got there. 
At the end our bill came out 300. With gratuity already added "20%" which should be standard of 18%. 
We gave them 180 in cash and the rest in card which is 120 right ?! But they charged our card 220. We spoke to our server and he said we only gave him 80. That we short him 100. We distinctively counted that money many times. We asked him to check again. He gives us attitude and checked again. He came back saying you guys only gave 80 and saying that we were wrong. We were trying to be understanding but he gave us Attitude making it our fault. We asked to talk to the manager he said he's busy. So we asked to count the register. He said I will check our cameras. (This took over 40 mins by the way) 

He came back the 3rd time saying alright do you want to void the cc charge. We said so were you wrong? Didn't bother to apologize right away. And it took him a couple mins to admit it. The whole time he could've handled it better by not arguing with us. Which is rude and unacceptable in this industry. All of us work in hospitality and understand to not make the customer accused. 

The owner came out and apologized but didn't offer a discount or anything but said, "come back next time, I will take care of you" 

Who would want to come back to that ?

My friend and I came around 10ish on a Saturday night and for not being busy, they were a little on the slow side when it came to helping us. Also. When we did get our orders, for about 20 minutes, no one checked on us and our fire was out. Overall, we loved the food and choices. For 2 people, we paid about $49.98 and left a $10tip because our waiter was FABULOUSSSS.
Wow...just wow.  The food was great, but what put it over the top was the staff. I will definitely come back here again as often as possible.

Absolutely mush come here!! great food, awesome people!!!
I'm very sketching when comes to trying new sushi places, but I'm so happy I tried this place!
The food was great and on point AND scrumptious!
However, the best part was the environment and service!!
Huge shout out to Jesse at the Sushi bar for by far the best sushi I've ever had and customer service!! We talk about life,music and culture #reallife#. He deserves a raise or promotion (wink wink). HAHA!! #butnolie#
The waitresses we super attentive and kind.

All around great environment!

Definitely recommend this place!!!

We need one of these spots in Cali!
The food was amazing! The service was superb.  Our waiter even stayed and cooked our food for us. When you come to eat here as for Jayden aka The Asian Superman!

Hello yelp people!
You have landed on the perfect AYCE sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. I am a regular at Biwon and I always highly recommend them to everyone. Service is always great *im pretty much family at this point*. The sushi is always fresh. The price is really reasonable. 
Also came back recently with my man to do the AYCE Korean bbq and it was as great as I remembered. 
If you're looking for a solid sushi place or kbbq restaurant Biwon is the place :)

Enjoyyy!!!

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE!!!!! Although my sister told me that they were in dirty dining I wanted to give it a try anyways.... FIRST time we went nobody acknowledge to sit us, we waited 20mins(thinking they were just busy) but after nobody even tried to help us we just left.... SECOND time trying to give this spot a shot, we got here 10 mins before they open at 11 they opened the door a party of 3 people was ahead of us it took them 10 mins to sit them with no one  else eating there yet after waiting 20mins I said the hell with this place... up the street is a Korean restaurant GEN also all you can eat they better service can't review food since We was never given a chance.

i love ayce kbbq and coming from Cali I've had a lot. this place is priced well 23 for just bbq or 30 for sushi and bbq. they will charge you for left overs so order knowing your limit. Food was fresh and service was fast we did have to wait 15 minutes for our last sushi role but there was a large party in front of us. 

overall they had great variety get the ribeye it was huge and delicious. good service! minimal wait! plus they have ice cream toooooo! 

ill be back for sure with more people!
Wonderful food for a great price. Joan was a great waiter, and the food was fantastic. The appetizers were tasty, and the beef was tender. Keep it up! I'll definitely return when I'm back in town.

AYCE Korean BBQ and Sushi!! $27 love it!! Great customer service.. awesome quality of food. Most important the variety of food to choose from!! This place is gonna get pack soon once the word is out!! Awesome Job Ryan!!

We went on Sunday, around 12:30pm.  It's not busy at all, maybe 3 tables at the sushi bar (I should have backed out from the live review).  Take couple minutes to get someone's attention to seat us down.  I want the BBQ and sushi AYCE, and my husband just want the BBQ AYCE.  We were told that both of us have to get the exact same thing.  We can either get sushi AYCE or sushi & BBQ AYCE, not one each. Since my husband knows I love sushi, we end up just getting the sushi AYCE only.  This is the second sushi AYCE I have visited in Vegas, the first one was Umiya Sushi.  I would say Umiya Sushi is much better, more rolls that I can choose from and different rolls taste different.  We got the following: porncorn, 2 SG hand roll, 2 shrimp tempura, #69, rainbow, tuna lover, what the heck, bulgogi.  I think I got the shrimp lover instead of tuna lover.  Most of the rolls taste exactly the same, too much mayo on top of the rolls.  The server shows up twice during the visit, has to wait for him to show him or flag him down when he was helping someone else.  Bulgogi was ok (a little bit too sweet for my taste, but it's soft and not chewy), not sure how good is the BBQ AYCE, I know I am not coming back for sushi for sure.  We got $20.95 sushi buffet, everything in red font cannot be ordered.  If you want uni, you have to order dinner ($23.95).

There's no words to describe how utterly perfect this establishment is.  From quality of food to the service= it's all great!
We both did all you can eat Korean Bbq and it's about $20 each. Soo worth it! Great quality and great portion and everything is so delicious. We left happy and stuffed but will definitely be back!!!

This is a really good place to eat meat! The meats are really thicc, octopuses, and all sorts of appetizers! And its a great place to hang out with friends. The service is great- And his name is JOAN!

I heard about this place and decided to try it tonight with my wife.  We arrived about 5:00pm and the Korean grill section was full.  They were also expecting a group of 40 people.  We ended up waiting about 20 min for a booth but it was well worth it.

We had the sushi and grill offer and it was well worth it. The food was very good and the service was excellent.  They staff was zipping around and making sure everyone was taken care of.  They were very patient to explain how everything worked.  We ended up spending $75 for two with tax, tip (20%) and two green ice teas.

They give you 90 minutes to order food and unlimited time to finish it.  We left about two hours after being seated.  The staff was efficient but did not try to rush us out.  I'd eat here again would be sure to make a reservation as they do get very busy now.

This is the best AYCE Korean bbq place. It's location has easy access to the freeway and the strip. The venue was good and the quality of meat is great. All Banchans (side dishes), bean paste soup, steamed egg, and sliced brisket were so delicious!! Don't skip the dessert and order a Korean ice cream bar!

Good Korean bbq.. great menu,  good service,  good food.. the meats are marinated just right and they include a huge slice of rib eye each person! Don't order too many they are huge! Pot stickers and mushroom poppers are good... only complaint is the grills are too small.. and its not well ventilated...

First time in tonight, was excited to possibly get some real korean bbq but was met with the worst service and attitude from the hostess who makes an art out of not caring and delivering possibly the worst 1st impression ever.  She seems more concerned playing with her Apple Watch then she does searing people, there's literally 3 open tables and they will not seat anyone waiting, some who've been here over 30 Minutes.  It's Sunday night at 10p no reason people should be subjected to this kind of service, I'll probably leave after writing this.  Plenty of other choices here in town.  Finally did eat, the meat is average quality, very fatty as compared to K Town, huge disappointment these 5 star reviews must be from people who've never been to K Town as the food is average at best, still looking for good BBQ
I used to be really into Gen Korean if I ever wanted Korean bbq. But visiting this place made me never want to eat there again. Love it ! Awesome sushi & meats.

Was looking for Kbbq in town and this place pop out first in yelp! All I can say is that this is one of the best BBQ I've been to. Price is reasonable, Great food! More than 20 sides to choose from that's unbelievable! Also Great environment with awesome service! I will definitely come back again!
Food was just okay, meat was not fresh and not top quality. Service was good in the beginning and then it seemed like we were forgot about. Been to better, will not return.

Yo dawgz, service here was dope! The ayce sushi and kbbq was da bomb! But for reals 5 stars to this place. Staff was welcoming and responsive, rare for kbbq places. definitely hitting this place up again. Keep it real.
This place is very clean and has a nice environment. The servers take your order and bring you food to you. The food is fresh and taste good! Totally recommend!

Service here was top notch! Wait times during lunch were non existent and ambiance was great. Food was awesome as well. Beef tongue for life :) I highly recommend this korean barbeque place here in Vegas so come on and try them, you won't regret it.

Finally, I have found a korean BBQ restaurant that me and my wife can enjoy dinner together, because my wife doesn't eat meat, only seafood and vegetable, Biwon has good variaty seafood choices for us and also full size sushi menu which is my wife' favorite! 
The price here is $16.95+5 for BBQ+sushi for lunch time only from 11am-3pm; all day $19.95+7 BBQ+sushi also from 11am-3pm

Went for Thanksgiving and it was absolutely a great idea.  Food was great, options were plentiful, atmosphere was comfortable.  The sushi isn't anywhere near the best AYCE in town but it isn't anywhere near the worst either.  The Korean BBQ side is definitely their strong suit, but again not at all unhappy with the sushi.

Service wasn't quite on point, and we got the feeling they were short handed for the first half of our time there.  We did have an appetizer, a side, and one bbq meat that never showed up.  But, they were on top of switching out our grill when the first got gunky and filling our drinks and things came out fast.  

I would be quite happy to go again, and just skip the sushi part.
Excellent choice for when in Las Vegas.   We're from So Cal so we know Korean BBQ.  Fast & friendly  service !  Opens til 3pm.  No long wait like a buffet .

Came here with a big appetite for some AYCE sushi. It was so delicious, and the staff was friendly, quick and polite. My friend and I sat at the bar, and they were happy to take our orders as soon as we finished the previous rolls. Fantastic value for AYCE. I would definitely recommend this place. There are some more traditional options and some creative choices that will be sure to please.

First time here! Service was very inconsistent here but for the price and quality of meat, i'd come back if I come to LV again! So yummy. 

Shout out to the server, Jason whom was very attentive and friendly! So unfortunate that we overheard and witnessed the other server/host talk to him so rudely.

The lady who was our main server (I believe she has red hair and wore dark eyeliner) had a huuuge attitude problem... we didn't like her vibe one bit. She was not happy, friendly or approachable. Upon asking for more banchan she would just say "okay, yeah I know". She mentally took down some of our orders and never remembered to bring us the items we ordered.
Foods great! Delicious! Fresh taste!  Service is great! Frankie, our server was very friendly. Highly recommended!

Honestly with all the AYCE kbbq places here in Vegas... This place was definitely a miss for me.  In other words nothing here impressed me at all. 

The restaurant was cold... Very very cold. I guess they didn't want it too warm because of the burners on the tables but still cold is cold. Besides that it was pretty clean. But it was a little confusing as they had different rooms for different parts of the menu.... They have a sushi area for people that wanted AYCE sushi and a room with burners for people that wanted AYCE kbbq.  Ambiance 3/5

Service was a miss. It wasn't that they were bad it was just that they were very inattentive. We were sat and instead of asking us right away what we wanted... We had to wait and flag down a server and ask for meat to be brought out. One person on our table decided to get sushi as well and she had to flag down a server to place her sushi order as well. And instead of asking what sides we wanted they just brought stuff out and when we told him that we wanted more of the fried zucchini, the server told us that they didn't have zucchini...But... ummmm... It was egg battered zucchini that was pan fried. He kept on trying to say that it was cucumber. Do they not train their servers???? Service 1/5

Food.... Total miss. It wasn't that it was horrible or inedible but just the fact that nothing tasted great. All the meats that we got were tough and/or very very fatty. I love beef tongue and the ones they had their was chewy chewy chewy... Marinated bulgogi was nothing to write home about... Marinated beef chuck was eh... Sirloin was OK...Oh and one of my favorite side dishes... Steamed egg was way way over cooked. Parts of the eggs were burnt on and there was no "soup" at the bottom. It was the dryest steamed egg o have ever had. Food 1/5

Overall, I would not return. Nothing here made it stand out that I would come back here. There are lots of places that are closer to me and cheaper to boot with better quality meats. Definitely a pass.

Worst sushi place ever!! Only fresh fish is salmon and tuna? 
Soup is like hot water with raw onion and dry crabmeat with miso base... I had better soup at home
Why put out good looking sake if you are not selling them...? 

Definitely not high end sushi place please do yourself a favor don't buy sashimi here you would puke

Dinner was great! We had the Bulgogi, spicy chicken, Kalbi and pork back ribs. The gyoza and jalapeno poppers were delicious. Running the bbq was lots of fun and our waiter, Jayden, was the perfect amount of attentive. We finished our meal with the ice cream sandwich! We will definitely be back.

This was my first experience with ayce Korean BBQ . Fun experience. Coworkers went out here!  You cook the meat at your table. They immediately bring out things to snack.. such as potato salad? But it was good! You can also order sushi but we opted for the BBQ . Everything came out really fast. We ate so much..: and we smelled like steak. And it was ok!

This is by far the best Korean all you can eat BBQ in Vegas! The meat and seafood were all of good quality and bean paste soup was spicy (because of jalape√±os) but very tasty! We got the all day deal which is $21.95 per person and includes pork jowls, sirloin, etc. I would definitely come back here!

Came in early Tuesday evening for dinner, just did AYCE korean bbq which is $22. I usually judge a korean restaurant by their banchan. Banchan was meh. We had to ask for kimchi. They give you a dipping sauce to start, but if you want samjang or sesame oil with salt&pepper  they have it upon request. They also have radish wrap and lettuce upon request too.

We had ordered a lot of things during our first go, and our server forgot a few which we reordered and eventually got. Spicy garlic edamame, was meh. Tasted like they were steamed from frozen. Mushroom poppers and green onion salad was good! Steamed egg was weird and strangely "holey," full of air bubbles and was rubbery. Not soft and fluffy, bf said they probably used powdered eggs. Friends ordered the cold buckwheat noodle. Said it was okay. Wasn't exactly cold, more like room temp/cool. Their pork belly is a little weird too. Not your typical strip of "three layered" pork. All the other meats we had were okay at best. Kind of hard coming here with kbbq standards from SoCal/NorCal.

I came here tonight with a group of 7 friends for a reservation at 7:30pm. We were told that we couldn't be seated until everyone arrived, so we all made sure to get there early. After waiting 30 minutes to be seated, we were told that they didn't have a table for us yet as other large parties were seated. Finally, at 8:20pm we were given a table.  Since we had almost an hour to wait for a table, we all knew what we wanted to order and ordered right as we sat down.  It took almost 25 minutes to get our food and several sushi rolls never came out (even after reminding the waiter multiple times). Despite all this, the food was good and we were having a good time... until.... 

Some of us had parked on the street in front of the apartments next to Biwon because Biwon's parking lot is very small and had no open spaces. There were NO signs anywhere that said we couldn't park on the street. After dinner, we walk out and see that 2 of our group's cars got towed. We walked back inside to ask if they knew where the cars got towed to and why they were towed and were told where the cars are and that signs were put up as we were eating... but no manager or worker went around to tell anyone in the restaurant. Who knows how many other patrons' cars were towed tonight.

I will not return, as there are several other places with better food, better service, and a better location.
It wasn't that busy the night we went. But we waited foe almost 30mins. However the servers was nice and the food was good!

I'm not sure if they were having an on night but all the meat we orders was amazing! Best I've had in Las Vegas by far and for only $20 a person I am still shook. Please order the brisket and sirloin, both so tender and juicy. Everyone in my party was just blown away by them both. The marinated meats were too flavored for me but my whole party loved the short ribs. 

Definitely order some kimchi, they don't have it on the table. I personally wouldn't order any of the poppers because they are so full of crab and very tasty but so filling. The squid was a pass for us, shrimp was take it or leave it. Stick to the meats. 

My father and boyfriend got the sushi add on for $27. They said the rolls were very good but their unagi (eel) was the best they ever had. Staff was also very attentive. Any time we picked up the menu our server was there in seconds. Will be here again.

Simple. Fast service, has all the kbbq dish needed for a fantastic meal. We go here every time we are about to head back from Vegas- it's a good closing meal about the whole experience. Ditch the lunch special and get straight to the all day menu: marinated short rib is a must!

Ayce Korean BBQ and sushi. Hooray! The food was good and the service was good. It was only hard to convey a shell fish allergy so we had to keep double checking on if the crab was imitation crab or real crab. Everything was tasty especially the mushroom poppers. Yums.

If i could give 0 stars, i would. If you have nothing to do all day, then this is the perfect place to go.

I was here with my family of 8 when we were told to wait for just a little bit. Over the next 30 mins, we were given no reassurance that our table will be ready. The waiters kept passing by without a word, only to converse with each other. When we confronted the waiters, they just said to wait more and more. After 40 mins we decided to confront them one last time. It seems that no progress was made at all about our tables, even though there were plenty of booths and tables open. They are rude and unfriendly. 

Do not waste your time coming here because you will not be eating, just waiting while the employees ignore and lie to you.
Wow. Best sushi I've had in a very long time. It was perfection, hit all the buttons. Fresh, friendly, and ridiculously tasty. I can't wait to come back.
the worst sushi rice in town. there's no flavor on sushi rice, don't taste anything, never going back here for sushi. udon broth was good tho
Mel is our favorite and this place is awesome!!! Great food, great service!! Thank you Mel
Bomb ass good but the service at night is a bit slow. The food totally makes up for it though. I recommend coming here!

THE MEAT AND BANCHAN HAVE HARMONIC FLAVORS
(Warning: visitors from Central Florida in for a vacation) If you're Korean BBQ pros then you already know the banchan- all those little plates brought out at the beginning of the meal- helps bring life to the BBQ. Half of these items were kimchi varieties. The only big thing missing (that I've seen in other establishments) are little seasonings or sauces beyond the typical soy sauce or srirachi. On the other hand, not really necessary because...

GREAT PROTEIN CHOICES- GOOD ON THEIR OWN
We tried the Beef Brisket, Pork Belly, Marinated Pork, and the Ribeye - everything tasted great. No complaints at all. I enjoyed the flavor of both Porks better (delicious especially with any of the pickled Banchan) however Hubs liked the Beef better because of the softer texture. You don't have to be a grilling pro to enjoy the meat- due to our negligence some pieces stayed on the grill longer than they should have but the servers can also help if you want.

FUN TIME WITH A GREAT PRICE
There's also all you can eat Sushi at this place (but we didn't try it) and a few different levels of Korean BBQ- the cost depends on what group of meat you want. It's totally fine to just try the lowest price option- everything was already tasty. Although the restaurant was slow during our very early lunch, the servers were very prompt and replaced our grill top as the oils got coated. I don't think this is the best Korean BBQ I've experienced, but it's still a great time nonetheless.

Amazing experience at Biwon! My group of 7 did the AYCE KBBQ (no sushi) and were so happy with our dining experience. The food was delicious. My group kept ordering more and more meat despite how full we were because everything tasted so good. Even the ice cream was above average! We were serviced by multiple people (I think one was our server while the other two helped bus/refill waters/change grills). Each person was friendly, attentive, and helpful. My only regret is only eating here once on my trip to Vegas. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town!
Great late night deals, Open late. and Amazing food and sauces!  Will definitely be back here soon! for all u can eat sushi too!

Biwon is both kbbq and sushi AYCE, but we only tried kbbq today. We tried this place out after a friend's recommendation and we weren't disappointed. Walking into the place felt like walking into an old mixed japanese and korean setting. The ambiance was great. Smell of sushi and kbbq is divine. The place is spacious. Food wise, it can be comparable to Hwaro. In my opinion, it can be easily one of the best and affordable AYCE KBBQ restaurants in Vegas.
Amazing food and great service. Highly recommend the spicy bbq pork ribs and bulgogi!! The environment is also great and location is really convenient. Would definitely recommend.

It's really a four-star but my server tonight made it a five-star. Even though it was a busy Monday, and I totally understand. I've waited about 30 to 45 mins before being  sat and then what made it a four-star is that after I was sat at my table, I was left sitting there for about maybe 5-10 minutes before I was served. A server name Derrick had noticed that I was sitting there without being helped and took took initiative  to take care of me. He did the most amazing job and making sure I was being served. I love his sincerity in taking care of his guess or the guess in general.  Thank you Derrick!
The place is nice and warm. Staff are really friendly and look confident. Cant beat the price as their food is amazing.

Great place! Great food! The sushi is decent but for the price of getting all you can eat sushi and grill  I say it's most definitely worth it! I have had a great experience every time i went! I have a ESA with me the last time i went and i asked if it was ok for him to go in with me and they said as long as he wasn't loud so i really appreciate that they were ok with it! Most recommend place!

My bf and I have been looking for kbbq and sushi combined in one place around vegas. Finally, found this place, tried it on my birthday. It so good. The choices of desserts is the bomb too. Maybe I'm just tired of having mochi icecream to every kbbq and sushi places I've been to. We tried ice cream sandwich and melon bar, to die for!!!
Great Sushi and Korean BBQ. Sushi was fresh and the cut rolls were unique. BBQ was like any full price Korean BBQ Place.  No corners were cut in quantity and quality of meat. Can't wait to go back!

Our second time here and food is still great. We came across this restaurant by chance. It has s unique that they serve both Korean and japanese ayce. So far the hostess is very helpful and the place is clean. The food is great too. Great food

Meat high. Meat head. 

Fresh uni.
Hated it at other places but loved it here. 

Brisket - I had to exclaim how good it was and so did the people I ate with. 

I ate too much. Too full. Also melona bar at end. Full melon bar. All to yourself. 

I wish this place existed in Bay Area Cali...

Thanks for ruining our Christmas!! 
Worst waitress I have ever had. She was mean and tried to overcharge our table. We waited 20 minutes before being served and waited even longer to get the check.
LOVE this place. Sushi and Korean BBQ?! I think I've died and gone to heaven :). Sushi is great quality for all you can eat and service is always good.

I wanted Sushi, and my friend wanted Korean BBQ. So luckily we found this gem, in a good location away from the strip. As soon as we entered they were really welcoming. The waitress always had a smile, and delivered great service. The guys that would bring the sushi rolls to our table were also on point. I totally recommend the "kiss me" roll and the "what's your number".. Of course their "tiger" roll is another to consider..

this was a dream come true!! AYCE sushi & Korean BBQ. I mean what in the world?! This is hands down the BEST restaurant concept. Their BBQ is pretty good as well as their sushi.

Highly recommended! Plus, one of their sushi chefs is from Hawaii too!
Amazing restaurant. All you can eat lunch special is the best deal in town. I recommend the mushroom poppers and the California crunch roll

All you can eat Korean BBQ AND sushi?! Yes, please! 

The food here is mostly quite generously portioned and the options seem endless, which is fabulous. If you can't decide between hot, sizzling pieces of bulgogi and cool, tender slices of fish atop crisp salad, fret not because here you won't have to. That being said, the sushi rice was a little off in texture, but there were a lot of delicious offerings available to make up for that. Scallop, soft shell crab, sea urchin abound. Items that are limited in the AYCE are conveniently colored red so as to be easy to distinguish. The sushi pieces were on the small side, but that's not bad when you want to save room for the mountains of meat they serve. There are rice free rolls and the one we tried, the rock n' roll, was tasty if not a little difficult to grab hold of due to being quite saucy- but let's be real here, you're getting all the grilled meats and most of the sushi you could possibly want at a VERY reasonable price so it's difficult to be too hard on them. The fish was decent, definitely adequate for the variety available (including multiple sashimi options) and freshness/quality. For the BBQ you get lots of banchan, too, as well as the option for rice- so if you're carb conscious you can easily skip it.  Even the dessert is AYCE! After stuffing ourselves silly our server was amused that we only got one scoop of ice cream for dessert...speaking of, the red bean ice cream actually has whole sweet beans in it! 

The interior was cool, quite spacious and reminded me of Korea so that's fun. 

They were really on top of the grill and water with us, offering to swap out the grill for us several times throughout our meal. No complaints there. 

I think they do charge for drinks like soda, but we drank water and our meal (with tip) was really surprisingly low. We'll definitely come back and try more of their offerings because there were too many to try this time through. 

They have reduced prices before 3pm and after 10, and they're open until 3am so there's plenty of time to get your fix!
I will give them 2 stars because of the service (they were very nice) and because it's open until very late but te sushi is not good quality at all!!! A lot and f sauce, too much mayo!!

I wasn't sure whether an ayce Korean bbq and sushi place would have good quality Korean bbq AND sushi, but I was pleasantly surprised. They had a pretty large selection and they weren't too expensive, they had options for one or the other or both. Our waiter was super nice and made some good suggestions on what to get and he was quick to get our orders and correct any mistakes, he went the extra mile. They had green tea ice cream and melon bars for dessert included in the price, always a plus  I'm sad I didn't get to try more things due to the lack of stomach space haha, if I ever find myself in Vegas I'd stop by again!!!
Offers a free soda lol and we experienced las vegas so to cleanse your system, you will want some healthy cuisine
great food and great service! I've never seen a place do both k bbq and sushi, they nail both.

This is my group's first time here and this review is strictly for their sushi side of the restaurant. First of all the parking here is horrendous especially for the weekend. There's barely enough space in the back to turn your car around when their tiny space fills up. The wait was around 35 mins which was not a big deal but they didn't even ask my group if we wanted to eat sushi or do bbq. After inquiring about JUST the sushi menu we were moved to the sushi side of the restaurant. In the beginning the service was ok but slowly deteriorated as the night went on, which is baffling seeing as we were the only table on that side. No one checked on us and orders were missing. It was obvious that they paid more attention to their bbq customers. The first halibut nigiri order came out warm and some pieces shriveled.  Most of their nigiri were on the small side and the temperature was always a little warm and lacked flavor. 

We did love their oysters and the korean ice cream sandwich. They also do half orders on most of their rolls which was great. Overall this place just doesn't cut it with their sushi offering. There are many other places that do such an amazing job overall in comparison. Maybe they ought to stick to korean bbq.

You must eat here. The beef belly alone is worth the trip. Then add on the experience of cooking your own food at your table along with the exceptional staff and you have an amazing dining experience. My only regret is that I didn't turn over the sushi menu and was full by the time I saw all the other delicacies I could have ordered.
I suggest paying the $26 and getting both the sushi and the BBQ, just pace yourself!

Food's ok. Wouldnt recommend because their "policies" arent accommodating to all guests. They separate you from your group if youre all not ordering AYCE and just want to do sushi. Or if one person doesnt want to do all you can eat and just wants Al a carte, they cant order anything. That's terrible service. If that were the case, post the rules somewhere. I read the AYCE rules and it said nothing about having to order what everyone else did. Or if you wanted to order, youd have to go sit at a different table. We came here for a celebration and my boyfriend just wanted teriyaki chicken while everyone else ordered ayce. Again, would not recommend. The service is terrible. :)
The meat was very high quality. Great servers, very nice. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes kbbq and great quality of meats. $20 a person is such a great deal for such great meat.

We were seated 9:37pm. I did both for the sushi and kbbq. My other friends just do kbbq. I love sushi and I was craving for both kbbq and sushi. I thought I found a new place to go to when I want to eat kbbq and sushi. But no it was bad service. Nobody notify us that it was last call for sushi. If someone notified me then I would have ordered more -_- . Then they gave us an order of squid that has an hair on it. I called the manager attention I make a complain about none of the waiters notify me about the sushi last call. And he just charge me for kbbq. When I make a complain about a hair on the squid he just brush it off. I requested for them to just charge us the night special ($20) instead of the all day special  ($25) due to the bad service and the hair on the food. But he said no because we started ordering before 10pm.  I'm definitely going to report them to Nevada health department.  The sushi was good. But I will never be back here because of bad service and bad experience.  The manager does not know how to please a guest who's doing a customer complain. -_-

Best food I've ever had !!!!!!  
The staff is super nice and makes my experience here so much more welcoming. Every dish is amazing the sushi chef Jesse got the hook ups !

We went here based on reviews and while the experience was pretty good, I would say the sushi is more Americanized than I prefer. We got off to a slow start with the service but they turned things around after the first 15 minutes and overall we had a nice time. I just wish they had more authentic sushi options and less cooked/fried sushi rolls.
Our waiter derrick was super fanatic and made eating Korean BBQ enjoyable. Def check this place out!!!
