Drove all the way from summerlin and didn't even get to sit down there.. menu said kids 4and under are free but when I asked she said you can order a la carte for him he can't have anything from the menu...so confusing free but not free. Then when I asked if we can bring my kid food from outside across the street she said the owner is here today and won't alollowed it. Not kid friendly and horrible customer service
One of the best I've been to. Aside from no water refills, the service was great...but we were a huge group. Everything was very flavorful. I'd definitely go back.

KBBQ is kinda my "thing".  I've been to every AYCE place in town.  They all have their advantages/disadvantages.  Biwon ONLY has one negative:  the pork belly.  Pretty bland and flavorless.  BUT the Bulgogi was by far THE best I've encountered in town!  The Kim chi was perfection.  And oh the Shrimp Poppers (double order)!  The service...I do not have enough words to speak of Devi.  Devi was intuitive:  never had to ask for refills on my tea and came before we needed to order more food, had the BEST professional yet personal attitude of any waitstaff I have ever experienced.  When I go back again, I'm sitting in her section.  We love you, Devi!  You are what made the experience fantastic!!!!

All the food was fresh and seasoned to perfection (with the exception of the pork belly).  Maybe it was just an off day.  We went for lunch and sushi.  I cannot speak to how good or bad the sushi was because I'm not a sushi fan, but the salmon on my friend's sushi appeared very fresh and almost was appetizing to even me.  The tempura was extremely tasty and who doesn't love green tea ice cream?  

Honestly, I didn't even need to upgrade to the all day option due to the extensive options available on both menus.  But I will have to one day to try out the spare ribs.  :)  

Good Food and Excellent Service!!!!!
One of the best AYCE Korean BBQ I've had in Las Vegas! Good quality meat! & Yum, finished off with a Melona Bar

They have the most horrible service. Server didn't even check up on us, we had to ask multiple people for help. The server was arguing with my group and accusing us of being short $100 dollars. They ended up checking the camera and the server couldn't even say sorry. Las Vegas is known for their hospitality and biwon doesn't have it. The manager didn't even make it better.

They have AYCE sushi/kbbq or both! Came for the sushi- seating is separate from kbbq.. Food selection was good and depending which AYCE price you chose you could also get 1 premium item per person.  Unfortunately they were short staffed and when ordering food there was lack of communication, but overall I wouldn't mind coming back to try the kbbq!

This is Probably my favorite korean all you can eat place, the food is great! The service was amazing! The price is understandable! But overall, everything was  amazing! The variety of food you can order blows my mind!! Their appetizers was just beyond words! But their desert is extra if you wanted it, and their drinks , like sodas, you need to pay extra also.! 


They dont have the sweet potato anymore! 


This is better than tofu hut, and hwaro for sure!

First time here and I have to say that everything was delicious. I got the all day menu plus the sushi (extra $7) and it was worth it. Sushi was nice and fresh and the meats were marinated nicely. I also got the garlic butter squid and that was amazing...also the corn cheese.... Yes corn cheese was different for me but I actually enjoyed it!!

This place is amazing and the price is right for a quality all you can eat meal.  The staff is amazing and always helpful.  You'll be even luckier if Ann is your waitresses and the guy she was training (Jay) will probably be the next best thing since she was training him.  The food is just as good as any Korean BBQ I've eaten at to include my numerous trips to Korea.  They just started late night service and closing at 3 am, I can see this place becoming a go to place for the late night meals in the city that never sleeps.  This will become a new must go place when I go to Vegas.

Feeling adventurous tonight so I'm trying Korean BBQ for the 1st time! Went to Biwon since it's close to my work on Sahara. Very nice! I'm a big fan of sushi burritos which they have here, but I thought I would try something different. Went with the Bulgogi burrito and man is it yummy  really hit the spot. They have both Korean bbq & sushi all you can eat here so I would definitely come back and try those. I've seen other comments that the service here isn't that good. My server Andrew was great! Very helpful and friendly and got me everything I needed.

Amazing experience-- it's always fun when you have the opportunity to cook the food yourself.

I recommend the "all you can eat" option, around $20 and you have unlimited appetizers and meats. For $5 more you can all you can eat sushi - what a deal.

Today was my first time here and it was amazing i would rather go here for food instead of rio buffet haha the service is great and food is amazing ! Id definitely recommend this to new people visiting Vegas!

I wish I was able to try this place because the reviews made it look worth it to try. & if I could give it 0 stars, I would! Customer service here is horrible. My family and I were waiting for almost an hour. About 30 min into our wait, one employee came up to us to tell us that it might be faster if we split our party into two tables which we didn't mind & there were only 7 of us. There were 2 parties that came after us that got seated before us! We tried to ask one of the managers if our table is ready yet because it seemed like the employee was working on it but they were telling us that it isn't ready yet when we saw that there were 3 tables that were ready. There was also another family in there that looked pissed who were probably waiting around the same time as us. We ended up walking out and taking our business elsewhere. Service sucks a$$!

After a long day of traveling and coming to Las Vegas, my siblings and I skipped lunch and dinner to watch shows on our first day. We barely had anything to eat all day so we were starving and grumpy, we were hangry. We decided to come here to eat since it was an AYCE korean food & sushi. I am a little ashamed to say that we ordered A LOT of food and sat there hangry while waiting for the food to come out.  For the most part, the food was really good and the sushi rolls were so-so, but I can vouch for my party that we did indeed eat our moneys worth. The service was amazing. Derrick was our server and he was very friendly. I am really glad he was able to put up with us because we literally ordered more food every time he came back to our table. Our favorite was the marinated short ribs. We will definitely be back here when we are back in Vegas. BTW, they have Peach Soju! Yummm!

Very disappointed with this place I made reservations for my bday  yesterday  for a 10 top for 5:30p the server show me the tables where we would be sitting are party waited for over 30 min in the lobby to be seated and at the last min they tried to put us in booths that were all split up in a completely different spots they refused to give us the table he showed me the server admitted he messed up they kept saying it was reserved for 7pm  which didn't make any sense then I asked if we could sit in the banquet room they said yes but we had to order  a la carte and couldn't do the all you can eat BBQ and Sushi  so we took are business elsewhere Makino had a table ready for us when we got there and it was super busy.

Service sucks. Came here, restaurant was completely empty. Employees walked past us left and right without accommodating us or seating us. We asked for help, and we were completely ignored. One of the employees even laughed at us when we said "no one is helping us." Last time we were here for a birthday party, they tried to kick us out too. Will never come here again.

Looking for a Korean BBQ joint and pulled this one off Yelp. It just didn't wow me at all. Got here for lunch and chose the smaller $16.99 AYCE. You can order off a list of items they have on the menu - if you're not familiar with the items, no pictures so you're out of luck.

Bulgogi was overly marinated, it killed the meat consistency so it was pretty mushy in your mouth. The server turned the heat too high and the other thin meat was charred in no time. Another guy came by later saying "oh, heat is too high".

Server had a little bit of an attitude and lights went off in the middle of lunch (they still had some lighting but it was pretty dark to see the food). 

I wasn't wowed by the food nor the service.

Ok so I ate her twice in one week, because it was that good. The first time I came here I did both the sushi and Korean bbq. I honestly got stuffed too quickly and felt I didn't make it worth it. So I just come here for the Korean bbq which I think is better than GEN that's up the street. Biwon offers top sirloin and prime rib not once but true AYCE! 

The brisket sauce is great too and everything is fresh and portions are large. So you're not feeling like a meat monster ordering 10 orders of brisket you just need 4 orders lol. Anyway the sushi part is really good as well, all the offerings of an AYCE sushi restaurant. 

Overall this is a really great place with a very reasonable price range. To avoid long waits go before 7p or after 830p.

Pretty decent off the strip Korean BBQ option, the sirloin and baby back ribs are really good! 
The don't oil the grill plate so sticking and burning can be a problem here. Many of them meats don't come pre-marinaded so the tastes are quite lacking compared to places I have been before, though the prices are quite good and their lunch special with a smaller selection is only $13, which is totally worth it. 
All in all a pretty decent Korean BBQ place with a mediocre selection at a affordable price

Coming from LA, I didn't think I could find many kbbq restaurants in Vegas, let alone any good ones. However, I was more than pleasantly surprised to find this restaurant. The service was quick and excellent and all of the meats were marinated flavorfully and extremely tender. The price is a little higher than average but you certainly get what you pay for!

We skipped the BBQ this round and went straight for sushi only (although you can have the best of both worlds with both). We recommend the following: Shrimp Poppers, Popcorn Lobster, Rainbow Roll, Washington Roll  if you can make the late night special $18.95 between 10pm-3am you can save some  otherwise lunch $21.95, dinner $25.95

All you can eat Korean BBQ and sushi?!?!  Sign me up.  Like others have said its $20 for BBQ and only $7 to add on AYCE sushi.  They had a lot more options than I am used to at a KBBQ spot.  Meats and sushi were fresh.  It wasn't the best sushi I have ever had but it was $7!! and still pretty good.  Service was ok.  We could have used a little more assistance.  We went late on a Tuesday night and they had quite a few tables.  Get a Korean popsicle for dessert!

At the suggestion of  friends, we tried Korean BBQ for the first time. Biwon was their choice. We could smell the food from outside and it was wonderful.We were greeted  and seated immediately by a very pleasant hostess.No sooner had we sat down and we were being served the salad and ample sides by a very friendly server.We ordered the garlic pork belly, Bulgogi, spicy chicken, spicy pork, spicy calamari. The calamari was the only disappointment. It was very tough.The jalapeno poppers were the best I've ever had.Cucumber kimchi was excellent and I am not a kimchi fan.The gyoza was excellent. We did not try the sushi which I regret. I'll order that next time. It is reasonably priced considering how much food one gets. Definitely worth it. The service was spot on. We were not kept waiting for anything. We had a full table from the moment we sat down.I will not hesitate to  try new items next time.
Haven't eaten yet seems ok. Free sake review. Environment is good good music.  All you can eat.

Okay so who would have thought that you could find a place that does AYCE Sushi AND Korean BBQ?!! This place is amaaaaaaazing! Great food, fun atmosphere, and tremendous staff! 

My boyfriend and I ate here for the first time a few nights ago and we had the best experience. Our waiters name was Derek and he was probably the best waiter you could imagine. So polite and friendly, explained the entire menu to us, gave us his own personal suggestions, and constantly came over to see if everything was okay or if we needed anything else. He was a huge part of the reason we had such a great experience!

The meat is well seasoned, and they throw it right on the grill for you! Sushi was fantastic, my boyfriends a sushi lover and he LOVED it. 

Seriously great and friendly staff :)
They do get busy, but hey, what can you expect for a place this great?

After several more visits, I think this is my go to KBBQ place. The service is great, nothing to really complain about since I leave with a smile on my face. The selection is great and has all the essential meats any KBBQ offers. I really enjoy the appetizers especially the calamari tempura, which is a must try and possibly one of the best calamari tempura ever. It's cooked perfectly with a nice crunch on the outside while the calamari is still tender. Meats are good but I always usually go to a KBBQ place for the brisket, which is great but order a lot of it since there isn't that much in one order. I can go on with the food, but the quality is great for an AYCE place. Pricing is affordable.

Only drawback is your orders may not arrive all at once and the wait sometimes is grueling but worth it.
This is a really cute restaurant! Very friendly staff andy really fast(: Derrick was a great service!!

We're regulars here.  After tying I find THE best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas, I have to say this is one of the top 5, and I've eaten at a lot of Korean BBQ in Las Vegas.  The price is reasonable for the amount of variety you get.  You also can do the "anytime special which is under 20 buck" or the dinner menu which is a little more.   Over all fast service good food and a lot of selection.

Good pricing for certain times and the servers are professional. They have an area with tatami mats! If ur group wants only BBQ or only sushi, u'd have to separate tho unless ur down to pay an extra 7 dollars under sushi/kbbq aye combo. Clean too

Maybe I've died and gone to heaven but all you can eat Korean BBQ  AND Sushi??!  No way.  And All for $27 for dinner?   Deal of a life time.   

Biwon's actual building itself is quite large.  A separate sushi bar exists but head towards the back and a large room filled with all grill-ready tables await you.    There are booths and there are tables that can hold even 10+ parties.  

During dinner, $19.99 gets you AYCE Korean BBQ; add $7 and now you have endless selection off their sushi menu including appetizers.

Biwon's meats were delicious.  My buddy and I especially liked their marinated short rib and their beef brisket and pork belly were satisfactorily good.  The brisket is always a good choice to start as it cooks fast and gives you something to eat while you wait for the thicker short ribs to cook.  Two dipping sauces (sesame oil and 'meat sauce') along with white rice compliments your carnivorous meal.  Side dishes included kim chee which was fresh, potato salad, spicy cucumber, and steamed egg.

(Just to note:  For a few additional dollars you can add Filet Mignon or Ribeye to your meal.)

I definitely ate at least quintuple the worth of my $7 sushi add-on on the appetizers alone.  Appetizers included a one-time selection of fresh oysters from Korea, crab miso soup, seaweed salad, shrimp tempura, baked mussels, edamame, tuna poke, and even chicken wings.

As far as sushi goes, off the nigiri list:  Garlic Tuna, Salmon, and Yuzu Yellowtail were all good.  
Rolls: Ocean Roll (lobster mix, cooked shrimp, avocado, cucumber, and screaming O sauce) was refreshing and delicious and my soft shell crab roll was large enough to fill the rest of my stomach to the brim.  Of course, I've had better sushi at places that specialize in just sushi, but not at this price.  Best $7 I've ever spent.

Desserts include your standard green tea or red bean ice cream, a red bean ice cream sandwich, or our favorite choice, Korean popsicle.  More like a crunch ice cream bar than a popsicle, an outer layer of crunchy chocolate, once bitten, reveals an inner layer filled with vanilla ice cream and strawberry sauce.  Tasty!

Definitely a place to come back to soon.  Service was exceptional with friendly and attentive staff.  Food arrived quickly and was devoured just as quick.  It's still shocking to me days later to think about how a restaurant can offer both sushi and korean bbq.  I think about how crazy that is and then I thank my lucky stars that this actually exists and in my city.  Lucky me!

so, i went in by myself on a sunday night & i just wanted to eat sushi & this resturant closes at 3am spefically but apparently, the guy said they were doing last call in 5 minutes at 1:30 am..
so- they reject a asian woman who was judged on appearance. Thought that I would help out my Korean people for once & it was first time going. 

NEVER GOING HERE.. 
never got to try there food & refused me right away "gently".

Great service and the menu has plenty to choose from. The AYCE menu even includes corn cheese, wings, jalape√±o poppers and other items I have not seen as a part of a KBBQ AYCE menu. Definitely want to come back here for the night special.

This my second time in a row yesterday I did KBBQ AND today we back for AYCE SUSHI!!! Highly recommend ... but maybe not since it's not busy as if It would be if we were on the strip! Good quality beef and meat!
The food was great. Service was wonderful. I would recommend the Bulgogi. The wings here were also great. This is one of my favorite Korean restaurants now.

Great place for AYCE kbbq and sushi. Plenty of choices of sushi and meat for a great price! Came here on a Sunday morning and the place was neat and clean. Friendly staff and quick service. Just wished we had a place like this back in LA. Would definitely come back here again. Although there was a rule of no left over meat, we were still able to finish everything we ordered. Highly recommend!

The concept of this restaurant is pretty cool. They have a Korean BBQ side and a "sushi only" side. If you sit in the Korean BBQ side you have to get the AYCE BBQ and sushi. But the great thing is to add AYCE sushi, it's only $7 extra. That's a pretty great deal! The sushi menu is pretty extensive too. 

The Korean BBQ I can't really comment much just because I am  NOT a big Korean BBQ fan. I don't crave it, I don't really like it. I just go when my friends who love it go for their birthday, just like the time I came here. I did enjoy the side dishes like the salad and the tofu. 

The sushi did have a great menu but I was not all too impressed with the fish freshness. Nothing on the menu really stood out to me as far as selection not found else where. Everything looked like every other sushi place on town, and there's a lot! 

I really loved they had melon Ice cream. It was like an ice cream bar, so good. And the Korean ice cream sandwich was very delicious as well. 

For the price of the meal we had, it was pretty decent. Defiantly a great place to go with friends due to the variety. Won't be my go to place but not crossed out completely
This place is freaking amazing meat is very well seasoned great would recommend! Great service and not that busy on a friday night which is a plus

The food here was alright, I like the idea of being able to eat Korean BBQ and sushi at th same table. But meat felt like it needed to be a little more seasoned. But it's was still pretty good. The grill cooked things fast so I loved that. The service great too, they were all really nice. 
The parking situation is terrible at this place. So park a bit far away if you can. 
But over all I do see my self coming here again.  


TLDR; service is 9/10 food is a 7.5/10, parking is terrible. 2/10

One of the only all you cat eat Korean bbq and sushi restaurants I know! The Korean bbq better than sushi. But sushi is also pretty decent! 

I would give four stars just because of the wait and the parking! Wait for dinner on a Saturday night for a party of 7 was almost an hour and a half! The smaller parties of 2 were able to be seated without that long of a wait. So I wouldn't recommend going with a large party unless you go later at night around 10 pm. Late night all you can eat after 10 pm is also cheaper! There is limited parking area and it's very tight space! So this gives you anxiety, like me, I would carpool!

The Korean bbq is so good! My fave is the garlic beef belly! And I don't even usually eat that. The brisket sauce is so good as well! For dessert you can also get a melon bar or a chocolate crunch bar or ice cream. Service is also great! 

This was my 2nd time. I would come back! Maybe before or after the dinner time rush, and with a smaller party

This place is awesome because it offers Korean and sushi. My bf and I went for his birthday and we got the option to have both. I love sushi but wouldn't do both again here just because I felt it was too much food lol. We will be back again for the Korean BBQ though.
A fun all you can eat that's on top of their service. It's a tiny parking lot, but I came late night and still found parking. Would come again!

My husband and I have been looking for a really good Korean BBQ since we moved back from Daejeon a year and a half ago. We live out of state, but after reading a review of this restaurant, we decided to make the trip to Vegas to try it out! The menu is quite well-represented in person-- we both got the $19.95 All Day All-You-Can-Eat BBQ without sushi and it was phenomenal! I do not say that lightly, as we've tried several different BBQ restaurants throughout California and this one is definitely above the rest, especially for the price. The meat was surprisingly high quality (sometimes AYCE isn't) and the side dishes were the most authentic I've had outside of Korea. The kimchi was well-seasoned and strong enough to pair with the meat, and the  (soybean paste soup) was exactly right. Will definitely make the trip back! !~^^
I Junel and charles is doing this for the free ice cream and the steamed egg is good (: thank you

New favorite place. I recommend NOT doing sushi AND BBQ. Do one or the other. Doing both is too much and it's not worth it (to me). Their BBQ is the reason I go 1-3 times a week. Their sushi is decent, at best.

Eh, I did a review on my last visit without expecting anything in return, and I didn't receive anything in return. Today, I saw the "free soda" for a review thing, and I thought, "Nice, I've got a review up already. I'll use that." NOPE. 

You need a new review for a new soda. I can understand this. I really can. I just didn't like how it was communicated. So instead of actually writing a review, I'm just going to vent about how annoying I found this, show my new "review" to the waitress and see what happens.

Update: it worked. Also the short ribs here kinda sucked. They're the worst I've had at an ayce kbbq spot.

Realy juicy good meat, the bulgogi especially. Great price for both Sushi and KBBQ-two things i love in one! Other places have the same price for just the bbq OR sushi.  The place looks really cool too, Like a resort! Great and quick servers. Yummy green tea ice cream!
This is our favorite place to eat. It's perfect for when you are craving both sushi and Korean bbq. They have a great selection of food. We have been here 3 times in the last week.

It's my first time coming here and I was please on what I see. The ambience was pretty good. The service was amazing always check on us if we need anything. Food is bomb.com I feel in love there salads and their bulgogi. I would come again to this place.

Fantastic atmosphere, great pricing, and quality food.  If you go, hopefully you get ANDY as your server.  He was by far the most friendly, good conversation, fun personality.  The parking is a bit tight.  Limited spaces and very tight.  DON'T PARK AT SIEGAL SUITES.  They have signs to make that clear!  Wait to get seated was about 30 minutes for late night AYCE BBQ & Sushi.  Great deal and options for $23.95.

When ordering, BBQ items come out almost instantly, and sushi items about 5-10 minutes later.  Everything was fresh and was great quality.  Be careful, if you order "Burn Your Bum Bum" make sure you can handle spicy!

The inside is quite noisy but that's expected with such close tables and lots of seating.  If you go for the sushi only, you are seated in a separate area to not interfere with the grills on tables.

If you like Korean BBQ and Sushi this is a great place to experience both.  Quality is above average and extremely fresh.

It's good our bill last night was about 170 it was 2 adults and 3 i wished my boyfriend did all u can eat meat/sushi and we just did ala cart but i don't even think it's allowed u have to sit in separate rooms or something anyways it was 11.95  for kids lunch or dinner and my kids only wanted to eat sushi and not meat so i had to pay the 7+ dollars anyways..i think dinner time should be for adults that can eat a lot because it's not cheap for a family's

This place is such a hidden gem! We have lived in Vegas for over 5 years and drove by the place countless of times! Now we have come back twice in one week! Come see Derek he is the best server and he knows his stuff!!! Amazing food and customer service is exactly why I give this place a 5 star rating
Really slow service and the food quality is one of the most terrible barbecue I have tried. Can't believe they average 4 stars. Won't ever be back

I went here on Christmas day Because Gen BBQ was closed. First time here. The wait was long but I know this place is fairly new and still hiring employees. But the food was so worth it. Especially for the price. $20 for AYCE KBBQ and add another $7 for AYCE Sushi. The BBQ was absolutely delicious. Our waitress was a little slow and forgot a few orders but one gentleman made up for it all. He was a young tall Korean guy and he was so friendly to us and gave us tips on cooking our beef and greeted us Merry Christmas. Overall I was very happy with my visit. A few tweaks in service and this will be a 5 star from me.
Our second time here, and i can say they never disappoint. Joann was very kind and helpful making sure everything was great.
I loved this restaurant! I was helped by a man named Joan and received great service and great food, what more would you ask for!

This is the best Korean BBQ I have ever been to. It's all about the ambiance for me and this place takes the cake. Every time I have been here I have experienced exceptional service. This servers are very cohesive and on top of everything. Our waitress Anne was the BEST. She joked with us and even sang along with the music while we celebrated my sisters b day. She definitely set the tone for a great night.If I could be completely honest you need to try the chicken wings. I know I know, but trust me the batter is amazing. The marinated short ribs are a must, at least three orders needed. Pork belly and rib eye is also a must, but utilize the brisket dipping sauce they provide for anything that isn't labeled marinated because it just sets off the flavor. Shrimp poppers are soooooo goooood. The dessert is not included on AYCE BBQ so that's a bummer but you should still try the Korean ice cream sandwich cause it's fire. I live in southern highlands and travel here quite often just to have fun here. Give them a try please!

Biwon is the spot! Best of both worlds, ayce kbbq for $24.95 and $7 more for ayce sushi! Knowing me I love both so I come here all the time. The quality of the meet is really good! I recommend their kalbi and their beef tongue! They're both cut perfectly. Comes with many sides(bonchon). The service is good, very quick and all of them are very nice. Frankie always recommends the best foods and he's really good with bringing the food really fast. He's been my server 3 of the 4 times I've been here! On a really big note, they offer FRESH LETTUCE! Not a lot of kbbq places offer that!!
This restaurant in Biwon is awesome give you so many selection so much food I recommended if you like Koren food.

They really have good bbq and sushi! Great price and the ambiance is really nice. This is now our to go to place for sushi and bbq! I love their shrimp tempura so far one of the best i had here in las vegas. I recommend this place and its not that crowded to unlike other sushi and bbq places. Service is great
Probably my favorite restaurant because they have AYCE kbbq and sushi coupled together!
Great food, we had sushi and KBBQ. Food came quickly and service was awesome. Personally, we enjoyed the KBBQ more than the sushi. Highly recommended. Thank you

So last night a few friends and I came here for a birthday dinner, and I can say I truly enjoyed this place. First of all we came on a night that they were short a sushi chef and there was a 45 minute wait. Luckily we thought ahead to make a reservation. So we had the AYCE BBQ/Sushi (everyone at the table has to agree to get the same thing). We didn't mind that it would take time for the sushi because we were too busy enjoying our pork belly,bulgogi and sirloin! The meat was amazing! Very flavorful and tender. The side dishes were good they had a large variety. We ordered mussels,(would have liked more cheese on these) calamari, and seaweed salad for appetizers. They were okay. I ordered the red rock roll and the B2 roll. I will say that the B2 roll was very different it had coconut flakes and was kind of sweet but it really worked well! The fish on my red rock roll wasn't as cold as I would have like it. Mind you the heat from the grill didn't help. We then ordered dessert and I ordered the Korean chocolate crunch bar. OMG IT WAS SOOO GOOD!!! I want to buy a box. The service was great minus the fact that they were short handed on sushi chefs but hey I'm understanding and I was glad they told us and they were really doing a great job regardless of the fact. I want to come back again and again.

We came here for lunch for a party of 7 and were told there would be a 45 minute wait to be seated!

Except, there was no one in the restaurant and didn't understand why we had to wait to be seated in an empty restaurant?!?

We gladly made our way over to Gen BBQ up the street where we were seated right away and enjoyed our meal!

When my boyfriend and I have the "where do you want to eat" conversation on weekends it usually always ends up being Asian and AYCE sushi and Korean BBQ usually among the choices. A place that does both is going to get at least one visit from us. Biwon was recommended to us from a Lyft driver so we checked it out. 

It's right off the 15 on Sahara in a large building that's divided into a BBQ area, sushi area, and another offshoot dining room. We chose the BBQ area and it was decently occupied at around 6pm. We chose to do the BBQ and sushi AYCE for $28 or so (it's $7 to add on the sushi option). We ordered the bulgogi, brisket, and marinated short ribs from the BBQ side and the Boo roll, 1/2 of the Something Wrong roll and the Easy roll for sushi. Right off the bat they bring you 6 ban chan, ranging from fish cakes to pickled vegetables to noodles. They also bring a giant salad to share. I actually liked the salad a lot, the dressing was peanut-y and the lettuce was thick and hearty. 

We started off grilling the brisket, which is super thin and doesn't take long to cook. It's seasoned with salt and pepper but it was probably the blandest meat I've ever tasted. Luckily they give you a sauce to dip it in but that wasn't very memorable either. Unfortunately since it was just the two of us we had a lot of brisket to eat. They probably give you 20 pieces. We found that the crispier we cooked them the easiest it was to consume. Next up was the bulgogi which was probably the best thing we had. The marinade makes all the difference. The kalbi was two very thick pieces that you can cut up with scissors when it's done. It was somewhat fatty but decent if not a little too thick. 

I definitely would not recommend adding on the sushi option. If you want AYCE sushi do it somewhere else. The Something Wrong Roll had shrimp tempura and crab yet it was the fishiest roll I've ever eaten. The Boo was better but their cucumber outer wrapping is thin and falls apart easily. The Easy roll was the best one once we scraped off all the mayonnaise. These aren't top quality sushi rolls and it's nice to have option if you want to pig out but I would have been fine with just the meats and appetizers from the BBQ side, especially when they already give you a side of rice. 

Overall it's a good concept but not executed well. It's not the best AYCE sushi I've ever had and it's not the best Korean BBQ I've ever had. I've actually stopped going to AYCE Korean BBQ places in favor of the a la carte, higher quality places. Fortunately we didn't over do it here but you easily could and I would only recommend coming here with a large group that is looking for variety at a cheap price.

I'm completely in love with this place... best of both worlds in one place AYCE korean bbq and sushi at the same time for such an amazing price. The quality of meat beats any place in town, definitely hands down a must try... The only thing that would make this place even better is if they had my rice paper lol. The staff we're very attentive, good job guys on excellent costumer service. Thank you Derek for all of your suggestions and for cooking our meal. We will definitely be back very soon!
I'm visiting from Hawaii! This place is awesome! Appetizers,, Food,, Drinks & Service is off the hook! Make this a place to visit if you're ever in Vegas on Sahara!!
Great place with great customer service! I recommend the WANGZZZZZ I definitely have to try the sushi next time

If having good service is a big deal for you.. please don't come here! I had the absolute worst service from beginning to end.

The restaurant did not allow us to choose to only have sushi or only have kbbq. Which was kind of strange. My boyfriend and I only wanted sushi instead of the kbbq. But because people sitting at the same table as us were ordering kbbq, we had to pay that price even though we didn't order any. 

The food was good, but it took about 30-45 minutes each order.. and all we got was sushi.
 
Also- when I ordered food I requested Juan our waiter, that my boyfriend and I are going to have our own separate check from the rest of the guests. 
When it came down to paying, they were trying to charge me for someone else's beer! They said someone in my party didn't pay... (I was with a party of 28) That is supposed to be the server's responsibility.

This place is over priced and a horrible, unorganized, mess! 

Please do yourself a favor and just go to Sushi Kaya for sushi and Gen for kbbq...

Yum this was an excellent late night choice for fighting off drunkenness lol.  We stopped here our first night in Vegas and we loved it. Babe was a little thrown off by the K-BBQ style of cooking our own food, but I believe that he was just hungry.  We ordered the al you can eat beef and crunchy rolls.  It wasn't crowded, there wasn't a massive wait.  The ambiance was nice, and I would honestly love to go here again and try some of the other options. Great place that's inexpensive if you want to stretch your dollar!

This is my all time favorite place. I'm from Las Vegas and moved to Charlotte! All I can think about when I visit home is going here. I've been to at least 3/4 of the restaurants in Vegas and this stands as my favorite. Fresh meat that I can char at my hearts desire. The marinated meats are delectable, the service is good and the establishment has always been clean. Love it!
Great food and great service. Our waitress was very good and helpful. Be mindful of you get the all you can eat bbq that if you don't eat all the meat you have to pay for it but you can take it home.

Price is very good for an all you can eat Korean BBQ. Add a few bucks for the all you can eat sushi.

Their sides are delicious but slightly on the salty side. Went in for dinner on Wednesday. Although it's a Korean BBQ restaurant, it doesn't have the Korean feel because all the workers are non-Korean. The floor manager or supervisor is Korean and can speak Korean but that's about it. It was definitely weird ordering food in English because I'm so used to ordering in Korean at Korean restaurants in LA (And no I'm not a fob.. born in the US and just bilingual). 

I like how they serve small portions of each meat order because in LA their portions for each order is huge and is overwhelming to finish it. However their quality & may taste is 5/10. But I do have to realize I've been spoiled with great quality Korean BBQ coming from Los Angeles.

All the workers are super nice tho.

This place was just ok, not sure about all the other reviews. We tried to AYCE Sushi & bbq combo. Definitely not worth it. The servers did had no clue about anything & the quality of food (both bbq & sushi) was mediocre. The sushi is only till 10pm, and they're open till 3am??? Thats not cool!!! We won't come back here again

This place is amazing! AYCE Sushi and BBQ! My server, Eric, was awesome and extremely helpful as this was my semi-new BBQ. I say semi because I tried BBQ before and was not a fan, but this changed my mind! I love the Korean BBQ. Best for first timer in BBQ. 
The sushi! Every single sushi that was brought was just as delicious or even more delicious than the last! 
Its truly the best of both worlds! 
I can usually stop eating in restaurants but I kept wanting to eat here! I wanted to burst with delicious flavor! 
The sauce was great! They gave two flavors and Eric was great recommending which item to which sauce. Everything was delicious. I know this place will be packed one day and Im glad to experience it before it got big. 
Thank you Eric and the owner of the place. Its truly an experience and its a place I can't wait to recommend. 
I write this review as I finish my last bites which makes me sad. 
P.S. I would sell my left kidney to eat here everyday.

Sushi rice was hard.
The lady comes every 10 min to turn the stove off.
Nobody seems to be present in the restaurant.
Sushi and steamed egg seemed to be sitting out in the open for awhile before they were served to us.

I have been wanting to come to this place and finally got a chance.  But my excitement turned to be an annoying experience. When i walked in, there's many people waiting to be signed in and pretty much hearing them complaining about their wait. I was standing in the unattended front desk for a good 10 mins and nobody acknowledged my presence. I decided to put my self in display just to get the attention of the staff who was going back and forth looking at me and the rest of the customers waiting BUT not even one came in the front desk nor at least communicated to the host. Not even a manager showed up. I left after 25 mins of standing and was never acknowledged. Food business should not be all about the taste of food, it starts at the door. I did not see a good customer service. Im pretty disappointed. Im afraid to come back after that experience.

Did the all you can eat BBQ and sushi and omg, we needed to be rolled home! Great variety and so good. Short ribs yum, spicy chicken yum, beef brisket was aiight, nothing superb, but the bacon roll...yummmmm, baked lobster roll yum and some shrimp appetizer, egg rolls. Man, writing this review is making me hungry. Will definitely come back when we're in town again.

I thought the overall quality of the Korean BBQ was really good and the price was reasonable too. I will definitely return to this place every time I am in Vegas.

While I was here I was doing the all you can eat Korean BBQ. I had several of the BBQ meats including pork belly, beef belly (also called beef deckle I think?), the beef bulgolgi.
I didn't find anything about this place to be off. I will definitely be returning and the sooner the better!

I try for this All you can eat Korean BBQ and Sushi today. It's so good when you walk-in just should what you want. That's mean BBQ or Sushi Coz difference table area. But I'm try Sushi (you can order some BBQ they're cooking in the kitchen for you. Everything is so good. 

Price is different lunch or Dinner. And when you order you should done it all. If you're can not they'll charge you. 

They're have parking area for free inside restaurant.

Came here for dinner with a couple friends, and it was our first time trying AYCE Korean BBQ and sushi simultaneously. After this experience, I'm not sure if I would do it again. The AYCE Korean BBQ is $23 for dinner plus another $7 if you wanna add on the AYCE sushi. They also have a late night special (after 10 pm) where they only charge you for the lunch price. 

The KBBQ portion was pretty good. They have a wide variety of meats and banchan. My favorite meats included the rib-eye (limited to one per person), beef sashimi, marinated short-ribs, shrimp, brisket, and pork belly. On the other hand, the sushi was meh. I didn't expect the sushi to be that great, but it was actually worse than I expected. The uni and sweet shrimp were some of the worst I've ever had. The rolls were actually ok. I  enjoy those baked California rolls smothered in mayo so we had a few of those.

I would have given this place 3-3.5 stars (4 stars for KBBQ and 2 stars for sushi), but the service was outstanding which is why I'm bumping them up to four. Despite how busy it was, our server was quick with our drink and banchan refills as well as bringing out the meats and sushi. 

It was odd mixing raw fish and meat, and I couldn't fully appreciate each one for what it's worth. Maybe if I tried just the sushi, it would have been better? I'm not sure. I would skip the sushi for now (unless you absolutely need/want it) and go with just the AYCE KBBQ.
excellent customer service.. great food especially appetizers and side dishes. i love everything about this place. . its also spacious. And it is near where i live.
It was my first time trying Korean BBQ. It was really good. We had a really good time and enjoyed the food.
Good food excellent service very efficient waiters Derek and co .Thanks so much for getting all our orders
Thanks for the free ice cream your food is delicious, I enjoyed the yummy bulgogi and the brisket!  definitely coming back soon!
So far so good. You get alot for a cheap price and the food is great. We got excellent service from the moment we walked in the door. Will def be back when we're in town
Fabulous food and nice environment! Staff are all so nice and welcoming! Will defo visit again!!!!!
Really good place  to eat sushi very nice place ,people  are so nice and very friendly probably were gonna come back here
The most delicious restaurant I've been to in YEARS.  Amazing service and a FANTASTIC deal. A complete pleasure to eat there. Everything was perfect.

My partner wanted Korean BBQ and my sister doesn't eat meat but loves fish and sushi. I yelped this place and this was the only restaurant in Vegas that catered to both! I could be wrong but I searched a few times and nothing else but Biwon came up. So for the people that aren't into fish and are into meats can come here and the same for non-meat eaters. Why I gotta be in the middle and figure out stuff? :/ But in the end we all satisfied our hungry bellies. Everybody is happy! 

We didn't make a reservation and there's parking in the back area. This restaurant is huge and is in two parts, the sushi area on the left when you first walk in and the Korean BBQ grills and tables in the back area. My sister lives here and had no clue about this place so I am glad she now knows and she loves to support new businesses! 

Prices are very reasonable for lunch on Sunday, Aug. 20th and includes so many items, from meats to appetizers and Korean ice cream sandwiches! Yummmm!

When we sat down they already had all the fixins' ready on the table and big bowl of salad. The bbq grills were nice and hot (even more so than the Gen BBQ in Torrance) the server was very attentive and he even changed out the grill when we ordered more meats. Even other servers walking by would take our empty plates. 

It cost extra if you want the better meats but still worth it and definitely cheaper than LA/LB Korean BBQ restaurants. We were happy with our brisket, bulgogi, marinated pork and chicken. Sushi was also very good, they have a huge selection of rolls you can choose from AND if you ask nicely, you can order half rolls so you can try as many as you life! 

Some items were marked in red on and that wasn't included with the sushi/BBQ price but it's not a big deal. The corn cheese appetizer is interesting, I never had that before. It comes out on a sizzling platter.  

This place wasn't that busy when we got here but it did fill up shortly after. I will definitely come here as many times as I can whenever I visit my sister. 

No need to dress fancy, come as you are and bring your appetite!
Great place. Great idea. Great times. Open late. Korean barbecue is bomb. Wonderful times. Beautiful times. Lovely times. Great food. Recommend to the whole world.

I'm giving 3 stars cause food was good but the way we were served was not! We go with previous reservation for a party of 7. We automatically get charged tip, no problem. But why would we be getting the same size portions to cook as the party of 2 next to us? We requested double potions various times, again we are a party of 7. They never did bring us the double portion. Honestly, that's horrible to get served the same amount as a party of 2!!!! We won't be back

We had AYCE lunch KBBQ on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn't busy.  Service was ok - they're around when you don't need them but not around when you need them kind of thing.  Potato salad was dry.  If you're used to a soy sauce type of brisket sauce - you'll be disappointed here.  Their brisket sauce was creamy like and was egh...we were better off without it.  The appetizer gyoza tasted better than the grape sized shumai - but both didn't taste very fresh.  The soy bean paste soup was delicious and you can't really mess up the steamed egg.  The fish cake was heavily drenched in sesame oil.  Otherwise, bulgogi beef, marinated beef belly, pork belly, and brisket were delicious with the salad and the rest of the condiments.  It's in a very old building and cleanliness is okay as far as we can see.

I jump at just about any opportunity I get to eat KBBQ.  When I saw that this new establishment opened I was excited. What I was looking forward to was the concept of being able to have sushi and KBBQ as an option for AYCE.  

When we walked in we weren't greeted by anyone right away.  A guy finally approached us and asked if we wanted sushi or BBQ... I thought it was both so I was confused. So I asked him if we could have both and he said "ok" and was looking for menus. He seemed a little confused and continued on by saying he was "just a bus boy" and doesn't normally seat guests. First of, in a team effort to build a successful establishment, you are not entitled to just your "job title" and at the very least, don't let it show or be known to your guest. 

We got seated and the menu seemed overwhelming but in a good way.  There were a lot of options to choose from. We ordered from both the sushi and bbq menu, and I'd list them but its too much to name.

In the grand scheme of things, the quality of this place is NOT there at all.  The meat and sushi quality did not do it for me to the point where after my first order was placed, I did not order anymore. I just paid my bill and left without an appetite.

Love the AYCE options and price!
Derek and wait staff were helpful and friendly.
We love our Korean veggies and the poke was da best !
Will be going back when we are up that way again ...thankful open late

Great place for ayce for you carnivores and sushi lover $24 (+$7 for sushi). 
Meats were marinated to taste. Variety of selection for appetizers and sushi roles makes it appealing. 
However, my rant is about their parking limitations but they won't seat us until everyone has arrived. They have about 10 parking spaces for the whole restaurant. Half of my party had to park at the McDonald's or palace station and walk there. Not exactly easy access. 
Parking situation should be improved.

Have to say I was pretty skeptical as we were pulling in as the surrounding area looked somewhat sketchy. But when you walk in, it's much bigger than you'd think and the service was all Vegas (meaning, excellent). The food, my first with cooking it Korean BBQ style, was excellent. Sushi was great too. Service was prompt and never let the drink run empty. I would have given it 5 stars except for the area where it's located was pretty lacking. I'm going to go back and take more friends.

great offering. appetizers included in any of the all-you-can-eat options. I recommend to pick either the BBQ OR sushi options (don't do both, too much food).

Tommy, our waiter, was the best! being super helpful guiding us in our first Korean BBQ experience.

we'll be back for sure!

I eat at this place at least once a month to treat my self. And I got to say. This is one of my best places to eat. Great place to bring family and friends. Price is decent for the food they have. Customer service is awesome. They even help you cook your food. 
I just love the style of there culture and friendliness.

I am always craving Korean BBQ or sushi, and I love that this restaurant serves both! I have come here with my family multiple times and we always leave satisfied. The manager, Grace, is always so helpful to have our table set up when I come with my whole family including a toddler and a baby. Grace checks up on us regularly to make sure everything is going well. We always get great service when we are there! 
You can't go wrong with Korean BBQ and sushi. The meat comes out fresh and the sushi is good too. Mmmm
First time here! It was great it gets a little loud and hot but very worth it!!! I will definitely be coming back!!!!

Biwon Korean BBQ and sushi is by far the best all you can eat sushi spot we have found in Las Vegas. Biwon Korean BBQ and sushi is our new sushi find and i dont think we will be going anywhere else for sushi. The staff is very friendly and Sushi chef Jay is awesome.
 
They have two sides the sushi bar side and the Korean BBQ side. They have all you can eat sushi for $21.95 for lunch and $24.95 for dinner and all you can eat Korean BBQ for $18.95 for lunch $22.95 for dinner. And if you're really hungry  you could do all-you-can-eat both Korean BBQ and sushi for $23.95 for lunch $29.95 for dinner.

The BBQ side is very busy and there is always a wait. We always eat on the sushi bar side because we come here for sushi, so we get seated fast. 
The corn cheese is out of this world.  my family loves the garlic tuna. and the Teriyaki side is delicious. The Japanese lasagna is delicious. The crunch roll is delicious. My nine-year-old son loves the Hulk roll it's delicious so far everything we have had here has been fresh and delicious
Servers are on point!! Food is amazing!!!!! Will definitely come back over and over!! One of the best Korean BBQ in Vegas!!!!

The food is good and tasty! They serve both all you can war kbbq and sushi. The sushi is not as good as other places, but for only $7 more you can get both AYCE Kbbq and sushi. The meat is seasoned well and tasty. Our server was new so some stuff came out slow, other than that it was a good experience. The free icecream with a yelp review was good plus too.

This place is my top 5 places to eat in Vegas. So glad it's by the strip but not on the strip. Great place to experience AYCE Korean BBQ and sushi!! Yes!! Both at the same time!! You must try their mushroom and shrimp poppers!!
Went to their sushi bar, I wasn't impressed. Order was way slow especially when there's only 2 couples in the bar but what brought the stars down is when the roach came to view. I have a photo of it

great place if you can't make up your mind between Korean BBQ or Sushi. Weekend are busy, but my family typically go at open on Sundays after church (never had to wait). Took my aunt here this weekend which was my first time being there when it was so busy. Got our food quickly out to us.

all you can eat sushi? YES
all you can eat KBBQ? YES
but together? like OMFGWTFKBBQSAUCE

beef shank is only 1 per person and I can see why; that melted in my mouth like omfg

for the love of every god from alibaba to the flying spaghetti, DO NOT PARK in the front otherwise each bite you taste will have the full amount salt you'll have to pay to get your car back. if you're going to have a foodbaby after, park at the hotel and walk that food off for christ sakes!
Excellent sushi and korean. Chef and service paid great attention to me and my buddy. Love the place!!!

Went here with 4 friends, we did the AYCE sushi and Korean BBQ which for the price is a great great deal if you're starving for both.
The service was odd, one woman came to take our drink order then quickly walked away without a word a new waitress came, then some guy came to ask how we were doing and it just seemed jumbled.
That's not why I'm giving this place 3 stars, the sushi was decent, the Korean BBQ was pretty good it was a 4-5 star experience until I ate a piece of chicken from the Korean BBQ and there was a giant bone in it and it hurt my tooth chomping into what I would think is boneless chicken. 
So double check your chicken before biting into it, considering I had no knife I'm guessing this was a mistake. 

I'll come back but won't be ordering the chicken ever again. 
Hats off to this place for doing two awesome menus, I'll change my review when I come back and hopefully don't hurt my teeth with bones.

It is definitely unique that Biwon offers both unlimited sushi as well as unlimited Korean barbecue, and that you can get one or both. The restaurant is fairly big as well.

I was feeling sushi when I went, so opted for just AYCE sushi. There were only two sushi chefs initially, and they seemed a bit overwhelmed between the sushi-only patrons and making all of the sushi orders for people having Korean barbecue. Even though I sat at the bar, it took quite some time for all of my various sushi orders to be made. They eventually added a third sushi chef, but this is definitely still an area for improvement.

As for the sushi itself, it was not bad, pretty standard for AYCE sushi. I don't remember anything wow-ing me, or anything really standing out as unique. The price was typical for AYCE sushi, and I enjoyed my meal.

Service again was good and I was checked on appropriately, but it could be hard to flag down a waitress for non-sushi orders (appetizers, water) and again, the sushi itself was made slowly, not exactly ideal when there is a 90-minute time limit.

I think I should come back to try the Korean barbecue side!

itting here right now and still haven't received any offers for drink orders,water,enough to seats for everyone. Never coming back here again. I would not recommend this place strictly because of customer service issues

Remember coming this place for sushi a few years back. Now they have Korean BBQ as well for an ayce price of 26.95
Fire highly recommended!

Came here on a sat night and it was busy but our party of 6 was seated quickly, soon as we were seated they started bringing out food and taking our orders

The food was great will def be coming back, only ate the bbq so can't comment on the sushi

Great service and great food! While this is Korean BBQ, the sweet lobster rolls were my favorite  It was a very fun experience that I definitely want to try again. The servers were kind, cheerful, and they were very willing to help with the grilling. Now I'm about ready to try the ice cream!
Love this place. We go a few times a month. Usually there's no wait. Good food. Attentive host. Fair pricing. I would definitely recommend.

I'm not going to lie the food is alright. I sat for an hour and my first roll came out, it's been almost 2 hours and my second roll finally came out. Keep in mind I ate with a larger party so I was forced to pay for the all you can eat and extra for sushi. I do not eat meat (but I eat fish), and all I can say is I ate 2 rolls in 2 hours and paid $30 plus gratuity. Do not recommend. :(

I live in Cali, and decided to treat my family to our favorite (Korean BBQ) while in Vegas... maybe it didn't compare because we are regulars at our favorite spot in KTown in Los Angeles, but that's besides the point. The food was pretty good... a nice selection and great cuts of meat. Steamed eggs, and miso were pretty good... also nice that other people in my party could add ayce sushi for $7.00 more, and we all didn't have to also... we just couldn't "share" - which was fine. The only thing that really bugged me was our waitress. She was super rude, and lacked in the customer service skills department. There was another younger woman who was really nice, and kept our glasses of water full... if they work on their waiting staff, I'm sure I'd give them a better rating, but I just cant because of that. I don't think we are the only table that complained about it... although I didn't mention anything to management while we were there, my nosy self did hear another table complaining about her. So in short, the food is good, and if you don't mind having the waitress give you some dirty looks or be bothered to bring you some more meat, then give them a try!

Updated: 9-6-16

My family and I returned to Biwon last week & the food was delicious yet again. The only thing I like to point out is Francisco is an awesome waiter! To me he holds that whole place together! All the other staff there is ok, not outstanding... But if Francisco is your waiter, tip him well cuz that man works hard 



Almost 5 stars! Hit most of the marks for me

1. Not hot! Hate eating when it feels like a sauna. 

2. Good selection!

3. The staff was awesome & very attentive!

Only thing that wasn't the best was the nigiri. It wasn't as cold as I like. Kind of warm?

I will definitely be back! Can't beat the price!

Great wait staff, everyone that came by were really nice. The food was great, loved the brisket, we were a party of 16 and did the all you can eat kbbq. Totally coming back next time for the all you can eat sushi

Very very good, fast service. Very little to no wait time when when arrived! The bulgogi and the marinated beef chuck were absolutely amazing!
Sake was gooood too(;

Joan was great, really nice guy! Love this place but there's no rice paper and they ran out of sirloin... The beef tongue was excellent especially not sticking to the grill. Would order the corn and cheese one at a time for freshness and without pepper and onion.

Totally loved this place, its always scary to try a new sushi place. But i must say this place was not only delicious, clean, but it had great service. Sushi was fresh, portions are perfect . Waitress was very friendly and made us feel at home. I believe her name was Demi . If your looking for a good sushi spot this is the place to go to

16.95 for all you can eat KBBQ and 21.95 for all you can eat KBBQ AND SUSHI! That's a good deal compared to many AYCE places! Their KBBQ is very yummy! The sushi is ok, but it's good to slightly satisfy cravings for cheap. You can always just go for the kbbq though (which is what I do whenever I come here). Their salad and edamame are also very good !!! The service was also great! Everyone is friendly and they always check up on you. They usually cook it for you so you can just sit back and relax!

Another perk is that they have melona popsicles for dessert ! How can you go wrong with thatttt :)!

I went because of the high ratings, my favorite thing to eat is brisket and when I ordered from here, it was nothing but fat. They tried charging me $11 for my 4 year old daughter because she ate rice. Also the server was rude.  Overall, the place isn't soo bad but they do watch exactly everything you eat and what you leave. They'll point it out and say it's an extra charge.

New owners! Great food and service!! The fish was fresh and everyone was friendly. There is another side to the restaurant for you meat lovers. Korean BBQ!!! You can have both; you can order tasty rolls while your meat grills in front of you. Great local joint for all of us!

Amazing BBQ place... all u can eat with very good service, delicious especially the octopus, very nice servers, clean and cozy. We kept coming back this is d best kbbq place for us! 

Update: we love this place. It's our 8th time here and we never get disappointed. We love it here, the place, cleanliness, service, and of course dishes!

New all you can eat sushi and Korean BBQ spot! They replaced shilla sushi on Sahara. Please take a look at the photos I posted for pricing info.

Ambiance- nothing out of the ordinary. Clean place and you can definitely tell they just opened. Very friendly. We were greeted as soon as we walked in as well as the minute we walked out.

Service- our server was very attentive. No point in our experience that we have to look for him just to order. He cleans up our table quickly to make more room for food. He made small conversations with us as well.

Food- we did the all you can eat kbbq and sushi lunch. For sushi, fish was fresh! I definitely love their nigiris. We had a couple of garlic tuna and that was my favorite. I also ordered what the heck roll which was really good. Appetizers from the sushi menu is different from the kbbq even though they have the same name on each menu. for example, the jalape√±o popper from the sushi menu is different from the kbbq menu so keep that in mind. For kbbq, the marinated sliced rib eye was my favorite meat! We got the brisket but it was okay nothing special. We also got delicious marinated pork. What lost their 5 star review for me was the steamed egg. It was not cooked thoroughly and there were parts of my egg that was grey. Why grey? Idk, I didn't really want to ask. I don't want 1 bad egg ruin how much I like their food. I just set it aside.

They are new so they can use some more employees. There were 2 servers who are bussers while the guy that seemed to be their sushi chef helps on the floor as well. They definitely have room for improvement but they are on the right path.
The meat frozen to table not that best quality they try to save every dollar they do not get your appetizer right away they wait for awhile please be patient when coming or you will not enjoy

We were eager to try this spot however we were there only 3 minutes and walked out. They have a rather large foyer reception area. A posted sign read, PLEASE WAIT TO BE SEATED. When we walked in nobody was at the register/hostess counter. As we stood waiting, a server walked by and never acknowledged us or made an attempt to assist us. We stood there. Another employee in plain clothes; she didn't have the red/ black attire like the server did, ignored us and came around to the counter. My husband was friendly and asked her, How are you?. She never made eye contact with us, just to the computer screen and NEVER SAID ANYTHING TO US while we stood at the counter RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER! She looked at the computer screen, picked up her pitcher of yellow beverage and walked away into the adjacent Sushi Room. My husband and I looked at each other in utter amazement. My husband said, I'm ready to walk out. How can  two employees have seen us standing clearly in the right spot where patrons are to wait to be seated and never acknowledged us? We didn't even eat the food here. Based on their customer service, their first impression was a failure. BTW, we walked in a little after 5pm, we were the only ones waiting and the restaurant was not busy so an excuse of its prime dinner time and everyone was too busy to acknowledge waiting customers won't fly with us! YELP needs a NO STAR rating. Because some restaurants deserve a NO STAR rating. Being Korean, I frequent several local Korean establishments and have never experienced anything but cordial, friendly service AND delicious food.

First off the sushi here is mistake do not eat the sushi here your better off with just the bbq portion. The meat here is really cheap as well we came here cause it had very good reviews.

Pros: the pork jowl is not bad! The place is clean! The servers are attentive which is good.

Cons: beside the jowl all other meat here taste like cardboard. The sushi portion is crap not fresh at all and made with no artistic talent. 


Overall 2/5: the reason why it got a 2 is because 1 the place is clean and 2 the servers here did a good job. The food here is not worth the money. Will not be coming here again until meat quality improves.

Wow. Spicy garlic edamame, shrimp poppers (SO GOOD!) for appetizers. Didn't want to get too full with appetizers. Then We tried the brisket, short ribs, bulgogi, pork shoulder, everything was delicious. We aren't over eaters but boy did we eat. Good food! Thanks for filling our appetites!

The quality of the bbq is not that great mostly just pieces of fat and no meat and the sushi was worse... I actually worried I might get food poison from the sushi... but luckily I did not. Do not order anything you will not eat or you will get charged extra for it... two items I sent back because I was not going to eat it and definitely didn't want to get charged for it. The green tea ice cream was good. Still looking for a good ayce Korean BBQ but this was not the place for me.

This is my second time here , when we  came in no one stand at the host station then we saw a server pass by saw us but didn't want to say hi(!) okay. Then we wait for a bit someone said they will set up the table . Anyway we sat down , I have my daughter and my son with me . The lady server , don't know her name but she has a loud voice I had noticed her from my last visit. We took order with her and she asked me " how old is she ?" My daughter showed her 3 fingers but she said "4" the server :" so you are 4 , your mamma is a liar huh, yeah she is a liar she said you are 3 ? But because of your server attitude I just can't give u more then 2 stars !
All you can eat Korean BBQ and Sushi...best of both worlds. Food was amazing....will definitely come back!
Great food, portions are amazing. Really enjoyed the atmosphere, seemed to cater to the community.

Found this place on Yelp after craving ayce Korean bbq. Saw they were new with 4 1/2 stars so they must be good. Service was excellent! Always made sure our water glass was filled. Their short ribs and beef brisket was my favorite. Side dishes were very tasty. Definitely our go to when in Vegas!  Very affordable, we had 4 adults and one child for $120! We all left their super full and satisfied.

This place is amazing! Has to be the best sushi | Korean BBQ spot in VEGAS! Been to a few joints like this, but this place is the TRUTH! Dinner is the best. Their sushi bombs are the BOMB! Love their meats! You won't be disappointed!

I don't understand why this place has 4.5 stars.  There are many better Korean BBQ and sushi places in Vegas (and some within a mile).  When we arrived the place was half empty but we waited 20 minutes to be seated.  We did all you can eat BBQ + sushi.  The BBQ was pretty good but nothing special.  The sushi was below average.  The service was horrible.  It took 40 minutes for us to get our sushi. Very slow and they forgot multiple items and tried to bring us the wrong items a few times. We lost our appetite so we didn't bother asking for those items. It took someone a long time to collect our credit card for payment so I had to walk over and dropped it off. On the way out, saw our server talking to someone in the kitchen and 2 sushi chefs standing by sushi bar not doing anything so I don't get why it took forever for our sushi to be made. Other server tried to apologized but our own server never came to even ask us how we were doing. It seemed that she's letting other people do her job. I don't usually write bad review but this experience is just awful not to write. We left feeling not full, frustrated and felt that we wasted good part of our Saturday waiting to be served.  Never returning to this place again!!!
Thought we were in the wrong area while looking for this place but found it tucked in between a housing area. Great all you can eat Korean bbq and sushi!
Awesome Korean BBQ...Grace and her staff are very attentive and the food is amazing! This is a must go to when ever in Vegas!

This place is Awesome! Referred by a friend and didn't disappoint. We had a choice a All You Can Eat (AYCE) sushi or AYCE Korean BBQ, I said both, which was $30 per person. Normal AYCE sushi places average $25-$30 so price is excellent comparison. We ordered the same time Mel took our drink orders, they are so fast that our 4 food orders came out before we had silverware and small platters. The Nigiri portion was better than average, meaning the rice ball was smaller cause we all know that the more rice we eat, the faster we get full. The Nigiri slice were above average so overall the fish to rice ratio was better than most places. Didn't try much specialty rolls but sure took advantage of the bbq options. The reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because no loyalty stamp card, no communication between staff as each time they didn't know if we were AYCE sushi/ AYCE BBQ/Both or/Ala cart, and we had to ask when the grille will be on the fire to put the food on it and once they got that, we had to ask for the silver ware to cook and eat our food after the grille was on the fire. Grace thanked us for eating at their establishment and called me out that I didn't eat much, very funny and a challenge I'm willing to take her on.

The good quality was good, and it's great that you can choose to do AYCE sushi & Korean bbq, at the same table, which a lot of other places don't offer. 

The staff seems all very young and new to service industry. 

The real issue that we experienced was that we were unable to finish all of the meat that we ordered (we ordered too much!). So we understood that we are expected to pay for what we could not finish. 

We had to ask the staff for the check 4 times!!! The same server asked us if we needed something twice when we had already asked for the check. 

When it came to determining how much extra they were charging for the unfinished meat, they were totally frazzled! They were all conversing and calling someone in the phone with confused expressions, as if no one ever had food leftover. I guess that's why they were unable to present a check all those times we asked for it. 

It was an uncomfortable situation where we felt we were being punished for not being able to finish our meats.
Love the food here great variety. Friendly service nice atmosphere for a date or a a time out with friends.

This place was legit.  The price is set good for an all you can eat ($30), and the time limit is good 1.5 hours.  The spice blend is ver complemental to what you'd want and desire.  Finally the service was pretty good.

So we came here because we wanted to try something other than Gen or Hwaro. Parking can be a hassle but youll just have to wait for a spot. 

Walking in it seemed to be very busy as there was a large crowd of people waiting to be seated. But looking into the dining room there were plenty of empty tables. Maybe they were short staffed that night and didnt want to overwhelm the servers? 

We put our name down and waited for about 30 minutes. Again, still saw empty tables. 

We didnt choose the sushi option, we came for kbbq not sushi. 

The meat selection is OK. They have 2 price options, the lunch option for $18 or the dinner option which includes the lunch meats for $22. 

Our server was friendly but the atmosphere in general was pretty hectic in the dining room. We had to ask for things more than once and a lot of servers looked stressed or just over it lol. 

Over all i was satisfied because i was hungry. Would i come back? Most likely No.
I'm visiting from Los Angeles and Biwon is by far The best Korean BBQ I ever had. Great service and great food!

Haven't tried the korean bbq side as me and my girlfriend were in a sushi mood. We sat at the sushi bar and were served by Jesse. Dude was amazing. Super personable, and friendly and makes a mean piece of sushi. He was being slammed and was great the entire time. The sushi menu is huge for all-you-can-eat. You can order right with the sushi maker if he isn't slammed but there also is a server you can pass your requests too and he will write it down on a slip for the maker. We definitely got our money worth of the roughly $26 cost of all you can eat.
I look forward to trying the bbq side but I will definitely go there again for the sushi. Probably nearing 40 sushi options if I can remember right. Maybe I was too excited and I inflated the number but it seemed like a lot of options. I def recommend going there.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d10546171-r406360829-Biwon_Korean_BBQ_and_Sushi_Restaurant-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

Read the review , decided to have thanksgiving dinner with my family here.  Based on the 4.5 out of 5 rating , and  the price is  reasonable  for all you can eat Koreans BBQ & Sushi.   Best decision ever !!!! The people here  are very pleasant, and the Service are supper  & fast . The restaurant was busy due the holiday, however our foods arrived some like in 5 minutes right after we order it .  Our server name is Demi ,  .  I would come back again!!!!   Facebook LIKE LIKE LIKE LIKE LIKE !

I so badly wanted to like this place because it combines two of my favorites, sushi and kbbq! The service was good but the food quality wasn't the best. I'm starting to think that a lot of these 5 star reviews have to do with the fact that you get a free soda or sake if you leave a review on here...hmmmmm.

The place itself is actually very spacious and it's hard to miss when driving. When you come in a person will ask if you will be having kbbq, sushi or both. Of course we said both! Like come on kbbq and sushi AT THE SAME TIME!? Can't get that anywhere else here that I know of lol. We were seated immediately and our waiter took our orders.

For kbbq we started with two orders of brisket. There was a couple behind us who was seated after us and received their kbbq meats before us (different waiter). I was trying to keep my cool because I was getting hungry haha. 5 mins pass, still no meat. I think our waiter finally realized that our table was still pretty empty aside from the kbbq sides so he came back and asked if we wanted anything from the kbbq -____- I told him that we were waiting on our brisket and he acted like we were just ordering it now so I guess they just completely forgot about our brisket to begin with :( Well when the brisket finally came, all was good. I would give it a 2/5 for quality and taste. It was very bland and nothing like the briskets I had at other kbbq restaurants. I ended up just drowning it in this sweet dipping sauce our waiter gave us. It was season with a black pepper which I guess is their thing here because I noticed the other meats we ordered later was also seasoned with black pepper. Eh I don't even know how to really describe other than it just tasted odd so I was very disappointed because I usually order 4 plates minimum!

Later on we ordered the beef chuck, bulgogi, beef tongue and pork belly. Again, the taste was just not there for me. Just very bland. The bulgogi was probably my favorite out of all the meats we ordered. I didn't really like the pepper all over my pork belly either because it was so coarse. 

For our sushi portion we ordered a bunch of nigiri: uni, unagi, garlic tuna, sweet shrimp, scallop and salmon. Uni and garlic tuna was good, they give you a small piece of roasted garlic on the tuna. Everything else was ok, not the best but not terrible. We also had some oysters, and my friends had a few rolls which was also ok.

I did like how dessert was also included! I tried the melon bar and it was delicious.

Overall service was 4/5. Our waiter was attentive and changed out our grill whenever it was burning. The other tables waiter also came to us a few times to help cook some meat and also gave us scissors to cut the pork belly since our waiter forgot. Food was 3/5 for me which I really hate leaving that kind of rating because the service was good but I just didn't like the taste as much. I still think I would come back though to try other stuff on the menu and who knows, maybe the brisket will be better the second time around :)

Excellent customer service. We were greeted by every worker in the restaurant. Mostly everything I ate was good. Love the home made ice creaM sandwich! I will defiantly go back because of this menu item.  Only bad things were , 1- I noticed the menu wouldn't state that the item was spicy but I had to eat it all because I didn't want no waste charge. And 2- they could clean a little bit more. The place was a little too dusty. Overall I give a 4 star. Will be in again.

This is my new to go to and the only KBBQ place i go to in Las Vegas!  I come here at least ONCE a month either alone or with friend(s).  

After Hwaro rejected serving me for being a "solo diner" a few years back, I went on a quest, a very serious quest, to find a decent, affordable and less discriminating AYCE KBBQ.  Biwon was relatively new and stumbling upon them after Hwaro refused my business was a fortunate stroke of serendipity.

Biwon offers AYCE sushi and KBBQ but I only come here for their Korean BBQ (as I have a different and favorite sushi place).   Their appetizers/banchans are tops!  Staff are generally attentive, friendly and courteous (though I've had few occasions when I was waited by not so attentive and friendly).  Nonetheless, look no further/farther if you are down for KBBQ.  Drive to Sahara Ave (not too far from Palace Station and right next to Spiegel Suites) and pig out!
This is one of the best eat all you can we found in Las Vegas!!! From the greeter at the front to the choices in the menu. The waiter were attentive to our needs.

I was so excited when I heard there was a restaurant that has acye sushi and kbbq. This place was hype up so much that I had to try it out. The is parking in the back past the front doors. The restaurant is huge and they have separate rooms for sushi and kbbq. But you can order sushi in the kbbq side. Their menu has a good amount of stuff for both kbbq and sushi. Their sides were pretty good, but I felt like the sushi and meat wasn't. The sushi wasn't fresh and the meat quality is poor. Also our server was not nice. He did come over and ask if wanted to order more food, but the way he spoke to us it was rude. He acted like he didn't want to be there to take our order. But when he talked to his other coworkers he was smiling and laughing. There was another server lady, she was more welcoming and was extremely helpful to her table. The only thing we really liked was their dessert.
So excited to try out this place! Saw so many great reviews and they did not disappoint. Food came out fast and the prices are great for Ayce!
