Tried this place twice. Worst service and food. Walked in both times and servers standing at the podium didn't even bother looking up or greeting us....we walked up and stood in front of the podium and waited. This was both times. Food is salty and all the sushi rolls we ordered were all sitting in pools of sauce....and i mean a pool. Even the manager agreed it was a bit much when we sent it back. Servers lack experience or passion for their job. When we asked to send back the overly sauced sushi our server simply said "i cant send it back because its already been made".....I sat for a split second after hearing his response in disbelief....but i politely asked him if there was a manager on duty. Anyhow, long story short, we will never be back nor recommend.

Let me start by saying SO MUCH FOOOOOOOD!!!! Lol. All you can eat kbbq AND sushi?! Great idea! Came for my boyfriends bday with some friends and left with a very happy tummy! Pricing is very reasonable as well... $28 for dinner ayce kbbq AND sushi.. not bad at all. 

The one thing that kind of threw me off is if you're going with a group you all need to be on the same page whether you want to do the ayce kbbq or ayce sushi (if your intentions aren't to do both). Some of my group wanted to do both and some of my group just wanted just the sushi but unfortunately then we would be split up for seating because the ayce sushi is on the left side and the ayce kbbq is on the right side. Everyone sitting in the kbbq side MUST pay the ayce kbbq price and then it's just an additional $7.00 to add the ayce sushi (as I mentioned earlier.. it's $28 for both). I personally think it's just worth it to do both.

The kbbq salad that you start off with could be a little better since thats one of the things I look forward to eating when we eat kbbq. But aside from the salad, everything was just sooooo good. Food was bomb! And the variety of desserts they have.... BOMB!! I do recommend you save room for the desserts because that was like the best part to top off dinner.. that waffle ice cream sandwich they have is LIFE.

Looks like I've found my new kbbq spot! I'll definitely be back.

Their service is quick. I didn't have to wait long for my food. The Korean BBQ was better than their sushi. Their sushi was okay. I would come back for the Korean BBQ but not the sushi. The Korean BBQ was so good I accidentally over ate. My family thinks the bulgogi and the beef belly was really good.

This place is OK. Definitely not Japanese...lol. A large stand alone restaurant with a combination of Korean BBQ & Sushi...

To me, nothing really stood out... They don't give you any of the good stuff for lunch; Sweet Shrimp (Ama ebi), Sea Urchin (Uni) or Scallops (Hotategai) even though the menu actually says Limit one per order instead of only available for dinner. 

While the sushi was fairly good, I can't think of anything that was outstanding. A couple things I ordered were a big let down. The Steamed egg was very disappointing...one of the worst I had. I usually love this dish, here it lacked flavor; was bland and lacking other ingredients like mushrooms that usually complement this dish. The other let down was an order or Popcorn shrimp; the shrimp itself was OK, but they came on 4 California Rolls. Um...what?! Nowhere does it say the shrimp came on California Rolls. I didn't want those...a waste of space, like Biwon wanted me to finish those so I can't order more? A bit shady I thought. IMHO there are several better places for AYCE sushi in Sin City. 

I probably won't return here for the AYCE sushi, but I will try the Korean AYCE BBQ next time I'm in town...that seems to be the bigger hit.

Stood around in the front waiting FOREVER for a table. It was not well staffed in the front at all. The waitstaff had to check us in and there was not a lot of confusion. Not a lot of people: just us and another party. Not sure why they didn't seat us, since there were plenty of tables available. Service was better once seated. Food was good.

Great experience over All!

Upon arriving my large family notice a big sign in the from saying all you can eat Korean bar b q and Sushi.  We had a large party and we got sat quickly. Looking at the menu is a bit confusing and a lot of choices. Our server Deloris was very patient with us being that we had 9 adults and 3 children she took our order quickly and within 5-10 minutes our order started coming. Service thought the dinning was on par. Our drinks was full and our need was satisfied. Our family had a great time and would definitely return. People come for the food and stay for the service
Yummy all you can eat. I'd recommend my friends to stick with the BBQ over the sushi offerings. Staff was very accommodating, and the atmosphere was great for a double date.

I love to eat all you can Sushi and I love to eat all you can eat Korean BBQ. Can you believe I can eat both at the same time here! OMG brilliant!!!! I believe I paid $27.99. The good thing is they give you an option, you can do AYCE sushi or AYCE Korean BBQ. 

The meat for the Korean BBQ was delicious. We got the brisket, short ribs, mignon, rebeye & shrimp. The great thing is you can order Sushi so while you wait for your meat to cook, you have something to munch on. It's always a must "steamed egg" when you do Korean BBQ but for some reason this was more on the dry side. I really didn't enjoy it. They only had 2 types of dipping sauce.   

I order a couple of nigiri; Salmon, Garlic Tuna, shrimp & yellowtail. They were really yummy!!! I order some sushi rolls as well but I can't remember the name of them. They were alright. Nothing to die for. 

Desert was yummy. I was looking forward in trying out their crunchy bar but they were out  I ended up just have a Korean popsicle and I liked it. 

Heads up, good luck in finding parking.... It's a pretty big restaurant but  the parking area is really small. It not in the best part of Las Vegas but hey, all you can eat BBQ & Sushi "why not try it yourself"

Really excites about this place!
Highly recommended!
26.95 for ayce sushi and korean bbq

Yummy all you can eat.
There are a lot of things you can choose from the menu. The food came fast which was really nice.

Their sushi isn't the best I have had, but the Korean BBQ is good. Subtract one star if you want five star sushi, but the combo of the two makes it five star for me.

All You Can Eat Sushi AND Korean BBQ for a decent price is what will bring me back.

This was just as promised, all you can eat Korean bbq and sushi.  The menu has many options, with two different price points. The bbq meat is delicious and comes with many fun traditional sides. We came in determined to do both, but could not eat sushi after all of the bbq options. We chose the less expensive cuts which have more fat than meat, but that's not their fault.  Friendly and fast service .

Fantastic. 
Went for the all you can eat sushi for dinner. $23.95.
Perfect choice. Our waitress was always there when my water got low, immediate service, delicious sushi. Looking for sushi? Come here.
This places is suck the service keep asking if I'm sure the my order is correct like if they are the one going to pay for me I'm never coming back here
Kim was our server and man was she good she took care of us and it was father's day and she made my dad happy! Better get you a Kim The food was exquisite too

Was on vacation wanted to try this K BBQ place, we only ate the K BBQ and not the sushi.  I got to say it was not very good, overall, you are better off with other places in Vegas. The meats were not of any quality, and the sides were very underwhelming. They don't even give you kimchi unless you requested it, no joking. We are from Cali so we are K BBQ fanatics.

This place is great for all you can eat and the shrimp and the beef brisket is fantastic to have all the time. I wouldn't mind spending an entire day here and have the atmosphere take me in to a good home felt place.

No one likes reading long reviews, so here it is:
1. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
2. food is ok...low quality, but tastes ok
3. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE - had to say that twice.
With all the all you can eat sushi places and buffets and vegas, I would highly suggest going somewhere else.
Had a very nice meal on vacation away from the strip. Service was great food was tasty and you can't beat the price.  It was very clean this time we had bbq next time we will be going for sushi.

I would not go back here even if someone paid me. Got here around 12am in the morning after reading several good reviews and stood in the waiting area for a good 10 minutes before a server came to us to ask how many people and what were we having and was told that the sushi option wasn't available because there would be too long of a wait for it so we opted for the KBBQ only. After we were seated, we flagged down our waiter and he told him our order. We ordered the sirloin and they came back with the weirdest shape around the size of a hand and fattest piece of "sirloin" to our table and along with ONE piece of marinated short ribs (galbi) when a usual KBBQ place you'd get like 3 slabs of ribs. We grill the sirloin and once it was cooked, the meat was chewy and tasted horribly like freezer burn or like it had gone bad. We held off on telling our server till later 
but she "checked and tasted" the sirloin and said that the sirloin had no problem. 

Service here is so bad that you literally have to watch forna sever to appear and wave your hands up straight and flag down your server (they avoided eye contact with customers) for more food. The rest of the meat portions were small and the only meat that was decent was the pork belly. The guy who refilled my friend's water cup held the pitcher so high that he splash water drops of water on my friend was walked away. Definitely won't be coming back.
Best KBBQ in town! The meats are flavored, variety of appetizers, and great service! You won't be disappointed!
First time getting Korean BBQ, ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT! Great service and great food. Can't beat the price either. Definitely a must visit! Our waitress
The Korean bbq is a fun experience. The meats are tender and deliciously marinated. The service is great and the food is even better!

It was my first time here and I thought the food was pretty descent. The fact that  
it gave you the option to eat both all you can eat Korean BBQ and sushi was so cool to me!!! However, the meat was okay and not all that flavorful. Also the sushi wasn't so fresh, but there was this roll with lobster and that had to be the best one!! At last, for dessert they had this Korean ice cream which was so good that we had to search up where to buy them! (Which we did buy right after we ate LOL). If the food quality was just a little bit better I would give it more stars, but I still thinks it's a place to try out!

This place IS NOT for Asian. 

Meat quality is so poor. This is the type of restaurant uses heavy marinated sauce to cover bad meat quality. This is the worse BBQ we have ever had. Try the non marinated meat, you will discover the meat has powdery texture. 

Poppers are good and fillers. 
But poppers are NOT Korean food.

Marinated meat, ribs etc are soooo sweet and salty. 

Non marinated still marinated with pepper, sugar and hopefully not msg 

You pay what you get. We learned our lesson. 

Service is good. However The meat quality is even worse than any buffet we have been to. 
Will not recommend and
Will not come back
This is our go-to place everytime we're in town. Best of both worlds...KBBQ and Sushi. Both service and quality of the food are fantastic. I definitely recommend it.
Great late night ayce Korean bbq and if you really hungry you can add on ayce sushi too.
Definitely a one of the best kbbq spots in Vegas. Open late, sushi and kbbq, super great price for all you can eat. Awesome service. 5 stars hands down.

Ok, the first time my friend's and I went to this place, I didn't necessarily liked it because they throttled down our orders. And I mean, slowed it way down. But, on subsequent visits, they did still throttle down our orders, but not as much as the first time. My friend's and I can put down some briskets and bulgogi, so that's probably why they throttled us. Either way, I like this place because it's competitively priced, and to add AYCE sushi is only about $7 on top of the KBBQ AYCE. The briskets are spiced well, and bulgogi tastes amazing. They also have shrimp poppers and takoyaki. I love takoyaki so I eat lots of those, too. Biwon is located on Sahara near Palace Station, specifically right by Teddy Lane. Would I recommend this place? Yes and no. Yes because it's an awesome place to eat KBBQ and sushi for a steal. No because I don't want anyone else making the place too busy like what happened to our other KBBQ spot, hwaro's. Hahaha! Overall, I have recommended Biwon to friends and family. And they, too, had a great time. Service is good, I just don't like it when they throttle our food down.

When I saw AYCE sushi and AYCE KBBQ in one location, I knew that I had to try this place out right away. My biggest fear going into this was the sacrifice of quality because I imagined only one out of the two options being good as that is what typically happens when you pair up two "AYCE" giants. After my visit, I can definitely say I was surprised. 

To start things off, I really thought both the quality of the meats and the sushi were pretty high up there. I wouldn't go as far to say that either was amazing, but it was definitely good for a restaurant that offers both in an AYCE setting. Not only that, but the price for both to be included was more than affordable ($21.00 for the basic menu). I do have to say that the highlight for the KBBQ was the brisket, while the highlight for the sushi was the garlic tuna (which featured a garlic chip on top of the tuna; very unique in comparison to other AYCE sushi allocations). With the meal you are also give the traditional small Korean dishes and the house salad that you would receive at any other AYCE KBBQ location, which was a nice touch. 

The only word of critique that I would really offer is to have more staff on duty. We were sat in a separate room, which seemed to hold everyone else who decided to dine in that day (the restaurant had several different rooms for seating). While all of the tables were concentrated into this one room, I would have imagined at least a few servers (minimum 2) to be attending to all of these tables. Instead, there was only one server attempting to tend to everyone's needs. Another word of advice that falls into this same category is for the lone server to at least carry a notebook to write her orders on. There was actually a point during our meal where the server forgot our items twice and on the third try, she brought out the wrong item. Honestly at that point, I didn't feel the need to ask for the correct order because I was already too full. 

All in all, this place is very nice if you have a craving for both KBBQ and sushi. Be aware that you will probably get full though before you can truly enjoy everything that you want, but that is also a testament to how tasty everything was. 

We will be back!

Wow. I live in Southern California where there are krbbq spots all over and I was absolutely blown away by Biwon. Skip the all the buffets on the strip and head here for the best meal of your trip. 

KRBBQ: Best Galbi I've had period. Beautiful on the bone/ uncut/ heavily marbled/ well marinated short rib. Other stand out cuts were the marinated rib eye / thick slabs of pork belly. 

Sushi: Woah! no rice rolls were delicious (only 1 per person, but there are 4 different kinds)

Etc: Along with KRBBQ/Sushi they also have appetizers from poki / tataki / chicken wings / yakatori / and fresh Oysters! Everything we ordered was exceptional, the menu was huge and a little overwhelming. We wanted to try soo much more food, but got stuffed from everything listed above. 

Service: Really solid, prompt, took on our crazy orders with no issue. Did a really good job of spacing out the food orders so that the table wouldn't get too crazy. KRBBQ+Appetizers+Sushi takes up a lot of table space but they made it worked. 

Relatively new place, so I hope the quality/ service/ and especially the price remains excellent next time in vegas.. ($26.99 for krbbq+sushi ayce).

I got the AYCE kbbq (around $23) and added on the AYCE sushi (+$7.00).  I thought the food was pretty good. The meat was well seasoned and tasty. However, the food came out to the table incredible slow.  I got there around 6:30pm and didn't end up leaving until 8:30-9:00 pm.  But majority of the time, I would say for maybe 1 hour to 1.5 hours, I was waiting for food to come out.  I think that the AYCE kbbq alone is pretty worth it but I highly don't recommend adding on the sushi unless I have hours of time to waste.

I come here all the time now. I love the sushi and I love the kbbq. I especially love the price of getting ayce sushi and kbbq at the same time. The sweet lobster roll is the best here. The staff is also very friendly and professional. I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas as well as all the locals
Best service Korean bbq in town staff is super nice and friendly.  Bbq is best in town and the price in unbeatable all their meat has great marbling and is buttery.

First time and LAST time eating here. The only reason we chose to eat at this place was because of the all you can eat korean bbq AND sushi. Unfortunately, when we arrived they had told us they stopped serving sushi. We weren't too disappointed so we still chose to dine in. Too many negatives about this place. They weren't even busy at the time but it still took them forever to get us seated due to one employee explaining something over a tablet to another. Whilst making us wait for their fumbling over the tablet we were finally seated. Food was good and the servers were awkward but somewhat friendly (disregarding their multiple bad/awkward attempts to start a conversation) Worst thing about our poor experience was when we proceeded to order more rice since the first servings were extremely skimpy. THEY WERE OUT OF RICE. Someone please explain to me how a SUSHI/KOREAN BBQ restaurant runs out of rice?! After the meal we wanted to order some dessert in hopes of saving this disastrous meal. but nope. Half of the dessert menu was apparently "run out". Never coming back again. What a waste of time and money.

Decent place for late-night ACYE KBBQ and sushi.

Location: Interior looks like most other KBBQ joints and is very spacious, with a sushi bar separate from the rest of the restaurant. Be wary about parking. The lot is very small. Parking can be quite a hassle so be prepared if it gets busy.

Food: Lunch (11AM-3PM) and late night (10PM-3AM) prices are $16.95 for ACYE KBBQ. It is an additional $5 for ACYE sushi, but only for lunch. "All Day" prices are $19.95 and $7 extra for ACYE sushi. If you just want sushi, lunch is $21.95 and the rest of the day is $26.95. 

There are a ton of options to choose from, with a great variety. Quality of the food is decent, but nothing to be amazed about. However, I think the freshness of the sushi was lacking. Do note that a portion of the menu - everything in red - is not available for lunch and sushi is not available at all in their late night prices.

Service: Nothing outstanding, but nothing to complain about. Every time I had gone, the servers were rarely available if you were not ordering or getting delivered food. However, they were more than accommodating when flagged down.

Overall, this place is a decent option if you can't choose between KBBQ and sushi. It is definitely worth the price. This isn't my go-to place, but I wouldn't mind dining here once in a while.

Well I'd like to say anything good - but we were turned away for Korean BBQ an hour and a half before closing - which is garbage. Seriously - uber'ed across town for nothing. Makes you never want to try again. Make it clear what the situation is - please - it's not cool to spend hard earned money to go somewhere we can't even be accommodated.

The sushi is just okay.  Nothing special by any means.  I took my family of 4 here for lunch on 01/01/18 and we were literally the only people in the sushi restaurant.  Two of us wanted to have all you can eat and two of us wanted a la carte.  They refused to allow us, again being the only people in the restaurant and we were sitting at the sushi bar, to split our orders.  They said that too many people cheat and eat from the all you can eat customers.  I eat a decent amount of sushi and I have never been refused this request.  
I will not be a repeat customer to this establishment, so they do not have to worry about me or my family stealing any sushi from them in the future.
Awesome food good environment top five in my list of restaurants in Vegas. Love the "POKE"

Whenever I go to Vegas, there eventually comes a point where you no longer want to eat hotel buffets for $30+ per meal, because it's not very economical, I don't want to gain 40 lbs., and frankly they all eventually begin to taste the same.  So what do my friends and I decide to try out?  A buffet.

To it's credit, Biwon is a Korean BBQ, which means you pay money and then get as much meat as you can eat.  But it's not the same bland prime rib, four types of potatoes, chicken wings and piles of browning leaves called salads slathered in ranch dressing hidden behind a sneeze guard at a hotel packed to the brim of people determined to stuff their faces silly to soak up thirteen yards of margaritas.

I can't really speak for the location since I'm not local, but it was fairly easy to get to off of the Strip utilizing an Uber to get my party there.  The one drawback to going off Strip for tourists is that if you run into a wait, like was the case with my friends and I, there's not always a convenient plan B to fall back onto, or immediately walk away towards.  Despite the size of Biwon, they're kind of a segmented establishment; upon entering, immediately to the left is the sushi restaurant, immediately to the right is kind of a bar/lounge type, and the back room is the BBQ restaurant.  Needless to say, neither of these segments are particularly large, so despite the fact that it looked like a large restaurant when we arrived, we still had to deal with a 45 minute wait for a table in the BBQ restaurant to open up.

Regardless, after we were seated, service was fairly decent.  One important thing groups should be aware of is that Biwon has a policy that everyone at the table gets the same dining plan.  So everyone in your group needs to be on the same page to what everyone's getting, otherwise, there might be some salty vegan who's not happy about having to pay $25 for meat they're not going to eat.

Meats are ordered, and portions are brought to your table, where you cook them yourself over a tabletop grill.  I will say that Biwon is the first KBBQ joint where the servers don't try and take over the cooking at the table, meaning you are entirely on your own when everything starts coming out.  I'm not sure if I liked this hands off approach, but I also wondered what I was paying for, if not a little bit of service.  Banchan (sides) were never refilled throughout the meal, and everything extra was kind of nickel and dime-y for my tastes.

Oh, and despite the advertised all you can eat, Biwon supposedly has this policy where such is the case - for 90 minutes.  It wasn't entirely clarified, but I interpret it as I can eat as much as I want, but for only 90 minutes, and if for chance that I go over that, even with my group of six, our meals are over.  This is definitely the first time I've ever encountered that kind of policy.

Fortunately, all of the meat is well seasoned and tasted good; after all, we cook it ourselves, and I've got plenty of experience cooking my own KBBQ, and ultimately my party and I ended up pleasantly stuffed, and not full of crappy Total Rewards hotel buffet quality food.

Overall, Biwon is definition 3-stars: A-OK.  The price is OK, the service is OK, and the food is OK.  All of them _could_ be better, but here we stand.  I will say it was a good experience getting off the Strip for a change, but I know Vegas has a ton of dining options away from the tourist areas, and I can't say that Biwon is high on my opinion for a second chance any time soon.

First of all I just wanted to congratulate this business; first for having the best quality of meat in town, and second for efficiency of service! 

This is a huge restaurant! They have separate section for sushi vs Korean BBQ. So if you are there just for sushi you won't get smoked out! Lol. 

So my husband often complaint when I want to eat Korean BBQ because sometimes the meat is not what we are expected or the pricing can be super expensive at times! But Biwon have changed all of that! The price for lunch is $18 and some change and dinner is $22 and some change. And if you want to do AYCE sushi on top of AYCE Korean bbq is only $5 more! Talk about a lot of food though!! 

Meat quality is pretty amazing! And just tons of it! They are not stingy at all with their portion for sure!! We took one picture not sure why lol. But this is my husbands favorite which is the beef brisket! And he ordered 3 portion of this! And the meat next to it is the pork belly which we can do without! But it's also a very good quality! And huge green tea ice cream for desert too! 

Service is pretty on point! You never have to look around for them! They come to your table to make sure that the grill is hot enough and that you have enough food!! they are very attentive! 

Will be back for sure!
If you are hungry, I wouldn't recommend this place because they took a long time to sit you and serve you the food. Food is so so but the waiters are pretty good.

Great food ,good service, plenty to eat
Sushi is to die for
Best bbq i ever had
Say hi to Debve
Excellent service excellent food, come check this place out you wont regret it. Forgot to mention great environment design

One of my favorite AYCE KBBQ places! Price is unbeatable if you want both KBBQ and SUSHI to eat! Andrew, our server, was very attentive to our needs. Loved the experience I had here with my boyfriend and his parents. The service may be slow, but it was great overall! Can't wait to come back and enjoy my KBBQ dinner cravings again!

all you can eat lunch for $16.95 (ordering time of 1 hour)

good selections of side dishes and meat items. 

for the price, this is a good deal for lunch. 

had better and much better. 

for me and my baby, this place is average or slightly below average to other korean bbq we frequented previously.

Amazing dinner at the sushi bar! I regret to say we did come in Christmas night, however, the staff was still awesome and welcoming. Our server was Simba...Asian Simba (his words, not mine). He was great! He was getting slammed all over the place but made sure to keep coming by us to see if we were doing good. You can tell he really cares about the people, we appreciate that! Food was incredible!!! Will definitely be coming back. Well worth the price, only $23.95 AYCE...seriously they could charge $35 and I'd still come...
Place is infested with rats I live next door see them coming from there a lot I would not recommend this place to anyone
Food was amazing server was very helpful and the place was very comfortable had a nice relaxing mood to it!

We were referred by a friend, also in the industry. We loved the fact that they do both K BBQ and sushi. The sushi isn't the best (rice was falling apart) but all the meats were delicious. We will definitely be back, just not for the $5 sushi add ons. Great service as well- almost "too good"! We loved our server!

From the moment my wife and I walked in hostess was very friendly and our server derrick was a great help suggested items on menu since we were first timers great quality of meat and sushi was fresh to order we recommend this place to everyone who is craving korean bbq and sushi at the same time!!!!
Very clean and great service! Food is fresh and keeps coming. Do me a favor and don't waste food!! Not cool. Only order what you will eat!

Kbbq that has a lot of variety options! They have unlimited sushi roll for $2o+. The prices it's included in the photo that I took below. The place not so bad, the food as well too. The thing that I don't like that We have to wait at the line without noticing us.

** Solid ayce kbbq place off of the strip with an extensive menu and good and attentive service. Would definitely come back if I'm in the area.

If you love meat and are feeling hungry but don't want to spend too much, this is the place for you. Biwon has basically all the things you would expect at an AYCE kbbq (pork belly, bulgogi, kalbi, brisket, etc.) with also more unique selections like cow tongue. They also have a menu to order off of with a lot of different side dishes (rice paper, kimchi, pickled veggies) and even options like ice cream and gyoza. 

At first, the service was slow in getting us our meat and rice paper (apparently they had to make a new batch?) but sure enough we were able to eat until we were full without being kicked out for exceeding any sort of time limit. The meat quality seemed to be fine as well and the servers stopped by and checked in every once in a while. 

Felt full af afterwards.

Service was excellent, food was great. My family loves kbbq but I'm all about sushi so we got all you can eat on both & we are all very pleased. THEIR SUSHI IS AMAZING. & my family says the kbbq was great too. 

ALSO, my little brother had an allergic reaction to something & our server ( Derek ) called his manager over and they sent someone to a nearby store to buy benadryl. 

I can't say enough good things about this restaurant & experience.

Do you like Korean BBQ? Do you like Sushi? At Biwon, you have the option of ordering either menu or both! The menu and price depend on the time of day. They have a large selection in each BBQ and Sushi menu. 

The cheapest prices are the Late Night Special and Lunch KBBQ menu being $18.95. My friend and I ordered from the Lunch KBBQ menu. 

We first ordered Pork Belly, Pork Brisket, Pork Shoulder, and Miso Pork. They have various appetizers you can order, I ordered Takoyaki and Steamed Egg. Usually the inside of the Takoyaki is really hot since all the heat is inside, but Biwon's Takoyaki wasn't burning hot like I'm use to when eating Takoyaki.

They also offer Corn Cheese, which is like the name, stretchy cheese and corn. It goes well to mix your meat with the cheese. They actually have lettuce where you can wrap your meat in. The only AYCA KBBQ place I know that has lettuce also is Sura. I was really happy when I saw the option in the side dishes. The food was delicious and the staff were helpful.

Meat: 4/5
Steamed Egg: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Prices: 3/5
Overall Experience: 4/5

I know it sucks to work on a national holiday, been there done that and I do truly appreciate all those who do. Walked in the restaurant on a Christmas day and decided to have sushi instead of korean bbq. (They have separated sections for bbq & sushi) A sushiman was the only one in the small sushi room and no servers were present. Then few minutes later this waitress called Devi walked in and asked us for drinks. When she came back with our drinks, she was taking the calls for reservation with irritation on her face. She's already gave me an impression that she does not want to be there. Anyways she took our order and we ordered udons for appetizer and some rolls. Sushiman has prepared the order right away and ringed the bell to call the server to bring the dishes to us but no waiter/waitress came in for more than 10 minutes and my friend just grabbed the dishes. Even after we finished the rolls, no servers walked into the room and the 'appetizers' were still not served. As the face of the restaurant, the servers might also be on the receiving end of complaints about things outside their control; however,  if at least ONE server came to check in with us and if Devi did not give an attitude, I wouldnt be writing my first complaint review on a Christmas day.

We come here every time we come to Vegas! Great place! Great times! Great Korean barbecue! Lovely times! Wonderful place! Biwon for life! Best place on the block! Open late! Beautiful times! Free soda after yelp review! Yay yay! Recommend everybody! Come on!

Literally THE WORST KBBQ EVER. Lee was the rudest server I've never ever encountered. She didn't ask all the patrons at the table what they wanted to drink and was just really cold and treated us as if we were prisoners. She constantly watched over us as if we were going to steal something and was literally standing behind us watching us eat. 

She only came by twice to ask if we were ok, never offered refills, and if we asked for anything she made is seem as though we were asking for the world. 

On the menu it says free ice cream or soda with Yelp check in. When I advised Lee about this she stated it's only if I leave a positive "good" review. I was a little bothered by that because that's not how Yelp works. I advised I would go ahead and leave a review and she wanted to see it. So I firstly wrote the other review, because I promised the little guy we were with some ice cream. Though truly this place deserves less than 1 star. 

The WORST part, besides being treated like trash, is that they charged us for INFANTS because she saw "the baby eat a leaf of lettuce and a few pieces of rice" Our party was 4 adults, 2 infants, and a 2 year old (who we had to pay $11 for even though they don't charge for 2 year olds) they put an auto grateful of $17 because there were more than 6 PEOPLE. They stated the infants counted because of said lettuce eating. When we asked about this, the servers LOUDLY argued with us and wouldn't take the grat off. Lee did not deserve $17. She barely deserved anything maybe the cockroach we saw on the floor. 

DO NOT COME HERE. IT'S JUST PUTRID AND THE PEOPLE ARE RUDE AF.

I had such high hopes for this place but was very disappointed. Most of us got the AYCE kbbq and sushi. Unfortunately, service was really slow. Many of our orders were late or forgotten. We had to remind the waiter a couple of times. Portions were really small, but there were lots of choices for sushi. Two stars for the friendly staff and the interior design.

Sushi was yummy! Had all you can eat for lunch time. I'm just not sure how the prices work for lunch all you can eat I thought it was 16.95, ended up paying $23. Also, this place was understaff we had to wait a little while to each roll. However, staff was super nice and friendly. I would go back to try their all you can eat Korean barbecue.

Great AYCE BBQ & Sushi in Las Vegas!! They just started late night! It's ONLY $16.95. All day special is $19.95!! They serves Certified Angus Beef. What a great meat and services. Can't compare with any other Korean BBQ restaurant.
This place is always amazing! I never liked BBQ until coming here... the best part is sushi and BBQ all for a reasonable price.

I'm usually weary of AYCE BBQ and Sushi combo restaurants but this one wasn't that bad. Came here so we could accommodate one of our friends whose favorite food is sushi and they had a really nice chirashi bowl that was huge! The Korean BBQ meats were standard quality and did the job. The staff were very attentive and brought out our meat orders quickly. The final dessert was green tea ice cream which was the perfect end to a nice lunch with friends. The rice paper was kind of warm, but I still ate it anyway. I ordered my favorite meats: beef belly, beef brisket, bulgolgi and a steamed egg pot and it was all good. I'd probably come back since they're open late.

Great food! I came here with 3 of my friends for lunch and all of us got the AYCE kbbq and sushi. It was $17.95 for the BBQ and $5 more for the sushi (which is SO worth it) They maintain a clean atmosphere/ are nicely ventilated and had very quick service. The food came out fast and they were quick to refill the items we needed.

All in all, we will definitely come back when we are in town! If you are looking for a place to hit the spot, this is it! YUM
Our server kim was really attentive and friendly! The food was pretty good but the tables really should be bigger, our dishes were very crowded.

The food was good it was my first time trying this kind and type of food as in Korean BBQ . Didn't know what to expect but in all honesty I felt like it could have tasted better . Also shout out to the short Mexican dude that works there he's the only one that actually gave us some good service compared to the other people that worked there . Left a good tip for him cause he deserved it . But this place was good and price was right .

The parking at this restaurant can be inconvenient and limited. We got lucky and parked in the back and came at a perfect time because when we left it was busy and long wait with a bunch of people looking hungry. My friend and I chose to do the all you can eat Korean bbq and sushi for $30. When we first got sat down we didn't get greeted right away. It took a few minutes for our server to come bring us water and take our order. He was friendly though and we got our food out pretty quick. The ribeye  was huge and yummy. We thought it would be a smaller piece of meat but it was big. I would say one ribeye feeds 2 people. We ordered the beef tongue, short ribs, and baby spicy octopus as well. The beef tongue was really good. The quality of the meats here was good. We also ordered a bunch of nigiri  and for rolls we ordered orange blossom and spring mountain. I wanted to try the volcano roll here too but I was pretty stuff from all the yummy food. We ordered quite a bit and for $30 a person it was a great deal. They have so many options and variety of choices for you to order. I really love how wide of side dishes as well they have for the Korean bbq side. I definitely enjoyed my experience here. The sushi could be a little more fresh but it was still good. We got the melon bar popsicle for dessert and it was awesome. Will be back for sure.

Come check out this restaurant they have ayce Korean BBQ and sushi.  YUP!!! "BBQ & SUSHI"!!! AT THE SAME TIME! Serious Food coma!  Food quality was good and The sushi was fresh. The BBQ was a little oily probably because they oil the grill but other than that everything was good. If you ever come out here ask for Derek he's an awesome server and very attentive.

Came here for dinner with friends.  We all opted for the ayce kbbq and the sushi add on, except one just wanted kbbq and they were ok with it. Good times.

It was a great idea at first, but then the combination to me felt kinda strange as I normally like to keep these two separate.  The great news is that all the meat and sushi we ordered were excellent.  However, I would not do both again.

Next visit would be either kbbq or sushi, but not both.

$17.99 late night special is always a plus. The amount of food on their appetizer menu has me drooling and wanting more. Their staff is absolutely incredible when it comes to service and speed. They always come promptly when we need something and is on the dot with our food. Definitely coming back!

Very good, but not quite as good as it gets.

We stumbled on this place when we were trying to get back to our hotel just off the strip.  For some reason, the navigation system kept taking us off the freeway and then putting us back on the freeway.  My wife just happened to see Korean BBQ, and we said "hell yeah!"

The area and the building are kind of run down.  When you enter, you can go to the sushi bar or into the restaurant.  We chose to go to the restaurant because we definitely wanted KBBQ.

AYCE was $24 for KBBQ and $29 for KBBQ and sushi.

Service was a bit slow.  I ordered sake and had to remind the servers twice.  They changed the grill, but not frequently.

The food was very good overall.  The portions on the meat and sushi were pretty generous.  I liked all of the meats we tried.  The brisket was the family's favorite.  I also like the marinated short ribs.  The sushi was all good quality.  We had some oysters too, but they were not good.

If I lived in the area, this would be a regular stop for me.  Good quality at a reasonable price.  Recommended.

Went during lunch time. It made sense to get the "all day" BBQ option and added the ayce sushi for another $7.00. I live in Phoenix, Arizona and as far as I know, there's no ayce korean BBQ restaurants. So I was happy I found this place PLUS an ayce sushi in one restaurant. Food was REALLY good. Service was quick and friendly. Enjoyed the sushi. My boyfriend liked the B2 roll which had coconut, and mind you he does not like anything coconut. So I was surprised he ate it all. If you like lobster, get the baked sweet lobster roll. Will definitely go back if we go back to Vegas.
This is our favorite place! Great sushi and Korean BBQ. Jayden was our server this past time he was awesome!
I love how they have the choice to have both sushi and BBQ choice ! This place is really good and we have been going here for a while now ! Helps suppress late night cravings !
Came here for Korean BBQ. Fast service, good food, will come back next time I'm in Vegas!
Sushi is delicious and orders come quick, price is great for what you get, love AYCE SUSHI, service was slow
Went in and got seated quickly for the sushi. Got all you can eat and it was great. Friendly people and amazing food. Our server was very funny and friendly . one of the beat places to go in vegas.

Great place to go to for Korean BBQ.  It's all you can eat for $21.95.  Our waiter, Jayden, was very helpful  and friendly.  We started with salad and side dishes of pickled radish, cucumber, peppers, tofu and noodles.  We also ordered gyoza, spicy edame, calamari and steamed egg.  I was very surprised at how delish the steamed egg was.  We ordered brisket, short ribs and shrimp to start and then we got really adventurous and ordered intestines and octopus .  The octopus was really chewy and the intestines were very fatty. The sauces we had were very tasty.  The place is very clean. There is a separate sushi bar from the BBQ area.  I was a little disappointed that they didn't have the bean sprout and  kim chi side dishes.
Korean bbq and sushi in the same place! Can't beat that! Customer service was awesome and fast, prices are great!
I can't say enough great things about the sushi chef Jesse. My husband and I are his biggest fans. Biwon needs him.

This place is amazing ! 
After a long day of moving me and my friends decided to try the combination of KBBQ and sushi . 
Biwon's service was great especially since we came at a later time around 11:30pm .
The manager Grace came by and struck up conversations with each of us about her background and what standards she has implemented into this restaurant. One main focus being customer service which shows from each passing server who would check on us .
We will definitely be back and recommend to everyone who loves either KBBQ or sushi.


Thanks again ! 

- Simply Social Team

First time here with friends and the staff was AWESOME!!  Staff was very friendly, efficient and full of good laughs! Being able to do both all you can eat sushi and KBBQ is a PLUS!! Not once did we have to waive a server over, they made sure we were doing good all night. With service and delicious options from sushi to KBBQ we definitely will be back!

I barely ever review anything . But decided to this time cause this place had really good food with several options on both the Korean menu and sushi menu at a cheap price . In addition to that the service was impeccable. A lot of Asian restaurants fail to fill your water accordingly or just check on your table. This place made sure I needed everything .
This place is so amazing!!! Food is so good kalbi and pork belly is my favorite and the service is excellent . Our server Derek is really nice and he's so attentive.
Amazing place with great pricing and open late. Seriously what's not to like. I come here when I'm sober and it's great, when I'm hungover it's even better.

The idea of having AYCE sushi and KBBQ was enticing but once we got there, my friend and I realized that our eyes were hungrier than our stomachs. We opted just for AYCE KBBQ, which was okay. I've definitely had better. They don't offer as many sides or appetizers like other places do and the service was okay. 

Their brisket was good. That was the main thing we ordered. I did order some of their spicy pork and I wasn't crazy about it. Their kimchi wasn't great at all. I've definitely had better. The place was clean, spacious, and nicely decorated but overall I wasn't too impressed by the food. The staff was accommodating but other than that they didn't really interact with us much. 

I don't believe this would be some place I would return to. Just because there so many other places that have better quality meats and larger variety in sides to choose from. If I do come back, it'll probably be to try the sushi but I don't know how likely that would be.

AYCE sushi or kbbq? Why not both?! For approximately $27 (dinner pricing) you can do the both of both worlds with their AYCE kbbq and sushi.

The location is a little bit sketch, but the food makes it worth it. I'd also recommend dressing in light clothing since it tends to stay pretty warm in the dining room during the summer.

On our most recent visit, the boo and I shared the bulgogi (5/5), marinated pork (5/5), brisket (3/5), your name roll (3/5), shrimp poppers (4/5), and the B2 roll (4/5). My favorite out of everything was the bulgogi. It was so perfectly seasoned and delicious. The sushi definitely wasn't the best I ever had compared to other AYCE sushi places around town, but for the $7 add on pricing you can't beat it. 

I definitely would come back here again to try some more deliciousness. The service was very quick, friendly and attentive too.
Great place to eat! Especially if your craving for sushi and Korean bbq. The only down fall is parking. Servers were very pleasant and accommodating.

First time I come to this place and definitely not my last one. Food and service is great top notch I love the fact you can order sushi and Korean BBQ. 
And I'm doing this review for my soda

Great service! Very friendly. Yummy food with a lot of options. I've never been to a place that has AYCE sushi and Korean BBQ. The ambience is an added bonus. Glad my friends took me here. Would definitely recommend to others!
So full as I type. Kim was spectacular and made sure we had the right buffet experience.

Finally found a decent place for Korean BBQ Ayce in Las Vegas.  Highly recommended to get their Korean BBQ buffet for $20 per person its totally worth it. It's comparable to Korean BBQ in California. The best part is you can get Rib Eye Steak 1pc per person when you go there.

****UPDATE: They changed their menu and now have a lunch/late night special or nightly special. 

We choose the nightly special that included all options. 

THEY NOW OFFER RICE PAPER, which made my heart so happy!!!!!!! 

My new favorite meat is the garlic beef belly. So good and flavorful!!!! 

You also get a free scoop of ice cream at the end, which they also added to the menu!!

However, this time around... the service was lacking. Worse than the past few times I've visited. The food took forever to come out. We ordered various meats at random times and our grill still remained empty more than 3 times. Our server blamed it on their tablets and told us it was lagging, but he didn't think to tell us until I asked for an update on the food. Some of our appetizers never came either. The service should be a lot better, but overall this is still my go-to kbbq spot in Vegas.

Solid addition to Vegas. How convenient that they offer both Korean BBQ and sushi -- my two favorite. Not something I can find back home in SF. For dinner, they offer AYCE Korean BBQ for $20 +$7 if you also want AYCE sushi. If you only want sushi, then you'll have to order a la carte.

The service was great. Our server was very attentive and kept coming back to change our grill. The meats weren't the best quality, but good enough. My favorites were the beef chuck and short ribs. The sushi and banchan were great as well. 

If they continue to keep up their good work, then we'll definitely be back!

Great Korean BBQ!!  Excellent Friendly Service!  
Amazing price of $19.99 Eat All You Can ~ Korean BBQ!
Our Server ~ Anne provided excellent customer service.
The Korean deserts are so good!  I love the Melon Bars & Korean Ice Cream Sandwich.

This is our new favorite Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas!!
Conveniently located near 15 Freeway; on Sahara exit.
I highly recommend this restaurant!
Great bang for your buck here and the mix is always nice. I do wish they changed grills out more frequently like some of the other places but that's not a big deal.

I had been wanting to take my step sister out to sushi for a while, and yesterday decided to just find a place. This is extremely close to us and so we went. BEST. When we got there, the place was empty and we were sat down at a large table. By the time we left that place was packed!! 

Prices; it is $28 each for all you can eat sushi and BBQ. It is $10 for each child. We had a party of four adults, three children, and one infant. The total came to $150. About the price I expected! 

At the end of the sitting, we all got a Korean ice cream sandwich. We literally thought we'd have to unwrap the ice cream sandwich like we always do. Nope! The ice cream sandwiches were hand made there and DELICIOUS!

Will definitely be coming back.

I came here with a few coworkers one night and they decided to go with the AYCE kbbq & sushi. Meanwhile, I only chose to have the kbbq. It was my first time at the restaurant and it was located in an odd place, near a motel - quite interesting.

The meat selection was not so bad but I've had better at other AYCE kbbq restaurants in town. My friends said the sushi tasted pretty good as well but one said he probably would not try both combinations of kbbq and sushi together again. 

Our waiter did great at keeping our orders on track, with it being so many guys, we sure ordered a lot and he did great at staying attentive to our needs. Although I probably wouldn't try this place again, I would say it is definitely worth the money if you are looking for a mixture of both kbbq & sushi!

The staff was amazing, always helpful, very attentive! As soon as I looked up to ask a question, someone was already right there. Very clean environment, great vibes and even better food! Our family got the "All you can Eat" and they never stopped coming with the items. Excellent! We will be back from WA State next month. Guess where I'm going? Yup! Biwon....

I can honestly say that tonight is the worst experiences I ever had at a restaurant. What's makes this worse is that this restaurant actually had good reviews on yelp. The waiter never introduced himself. No one cleared the table once. When they dropped off food instead of clearing the trash they just moved it over and placed the food on the table. I actually had to grab trash and ask where a garbage can was because I had 6 empty cans of soda in front of me plus dirty napkins. My brother ordered rice twice and never received it. Every time we asked a server for something it seemed as though we were bothering him. One time I asked the waiter over to the table and the waiter looked right at me and ignored me. To top it all of the overhead hood fan didn't even work so my brother and I were sitting in a smokescreen the whole night. I definitely do not recommend coming here with a group of 6 or more or at all. It seemed as though because they add 18% auto gratuity to big parties they paid less attention to us because they had a tip no matter what. I my self work in the service industry and have not seen anything like this before. This experience ruined my brothers birthday. People may read this and say oh they were just busy but the sad truth was that it wasn't. I had every intention to speak with a manager but I was to upset and didn't want to make a scene or say something I would regret. My hope is that the management of this restaurant read this and train there staff on customer service and cleanliness of the tables they are serving.

Brought here to pop my kbbq cherry on thanksgiving
Really chill place loved it
Waiter was very good at being slow :) ... im here rn tho .. n seems like waiter forgot bout the gang gang gang ... smh 30 min later they come tell us bitch clocked out n left

I'm never one to write a bad review but I would pass and find something better. Came in for dinner while it wasn't busy and service was slow. Once more people started coming, service went down the drain completely. We had to keep reminding the staff of the things we ordered. Waited. Reminded. Waited. Reminded. Waited. Reminded. Our check got to the table faster than our food. 

As far as the food, it was just alright. Overall I won't be coming back
Fav spot to dine!! I love how they have both my favorite foods here and it's all you can eat! Prices are cheap as well. Would totally recommend!

So the 4 of us decided to come here because we were hungry! The reviews pulled us in no lie, we had one of the best waiters ever! He was very friendly, and recommended items that were super delicious for me and my kids. His name is Derek the gentleman. But get this, it's unlimited korean and sushi son much you pick from! Next time I'm in Vegas I will return. Thanks

Two of hit this place around 3:30 PM on a Wednesday. We ordered the ayce Korean bbq and sushi.  Meat came out quickly along with 8 or so side dishes. I have eaten a lot of Korean bbq at a number of different restaurants, the assorted meats were all excellent and marinades delicious, as good as any I have had. Sides were all good, fish cakes were absolutely awesome.  

Took probably 20 minutes for our sushi to come out and every piece was good.  Second order of sushi came out faster.

Beer was cold and reasonably priced, service friendly.

It was my buddies first exposure to Korean bbq and he loved it.

I have nothing at all to say negative about the experience.  I am somewhat relieved that the place is 2000 miles away, otherwise I'd likely be there way more then I should.

You could easily have a great dinning experience here doing either bbq or sushi seperate but given how inexpensive it is to combine both and seeing how I love both, the bbq /sushi combo was clutch.

If your in vegas and looking for Korean bbq and or sushi in a very non-touristy/ non-vegas strip sort of restaurant, Biwon is the place.

No worry about having a LATE meal, sign said open till 3AM.

I will for sure hit Biwon next time I am in town....

Good food at good price. Service a little slow especially at busy time. Wheelchair users need early reservations as the only accessible tables are reserved mostly for regulars, thus no tables available. There is limited parking and no legal handicap parking spaces, or van space. Management does not seem to care about this law. Could be a much better situation if adequate access were available. Generally fairly busy in early evenings.
Been here a few times now, great kbbq selection and solid sushi menu. Would eat too much again.

Everytime I come to the West coast, I have to get kbbq and in n out. If you have a craving for kbbq, then this place hits the spot. I didn't get the sushi, but it is probably pretty good. The sirloin steak is really good, and juicy. Pretty good selection of meats and sidr dishes. They could be a little faster with the meats, but maybe it is fresher?

I really wish I could have given this place a better rating. The sushi was good as was the service. However the cockroach running across the sushi bar at the end of the meal ruined everything. if it hadn't been for that I would have given 4 stars.

If you have a big appetite, this place is definitely worth a visit. Don't be fooled by All You Can Eat, since you actually order off of an a la carte menu. 

We came in for the KBBQ and Sushi, but the KBBQ side had an hour wait, and the sushi bar was wide open. 

For $24.95ea, it was the most bang for the buck in any restaurant in Vegas. The sushi chefs were on point, personable, and definitely earned an extra tip, especially Jesse.

The food was not as good but the BBQ meat was very tough almost not chewable so we had 50% of the ordered amount left over and called for the check.  One of the ladies came and told us " you have to finish them " well, we were paying for the orders even through we could not half of them because they were too tough,why did she command us to finish the food? Ok, she said " the universal rules state that you need to finish your food when you order " all you can eat " style.  Remember, she was commanding with an attitude of a teacher, a principal, or a teenager's parent... not thinking she was actually a waitress serving customers there at this restaurant.  Well, we replied her peacefully, that we ordered the dishes with prices listed of what we are committing to pay for not " all you can eat " which has never been mentioned by the 1st server lady who took our orders.  You know what? She turned around with no apology, not even a word saying something like ok, I see... the the bill came, with the amount as we wish to pay.  We paid in full with $1 tips and a one star review. Hope she learns a lesson and realizes she is working in a service industry.  Sorry for the owners who hired her.  If she was the owner, who thinks she can have the power and the attitude, good for her.

All you can eat BBQ. ASK for KIM! Her customer service is amazing. She checks on you often, your water is never empty and she is super nice and friendly and has good recommendations. The sides are good. I got the corn cheese and the creamy eel roll as well has garlic butter squid and bulgogi. 17.95 plus 5.00 for sushi too. And it includes dessert!
I like the place. The place is spacious. Service was fast. 19.95$ all you can eat lunch till 3 and dinner after 10. Very good price :D

The all you can eat sushi was awesome. The spicy  just right. The bacon sushi was really good we ordered it twice. But all the sushi was great. The shrimp lover was really good. I think we found a new sushi place. They staff is really pleasant and efficient. Plate cleared fast and glasses refilled fast. We found a new sushi place.

I like the idea of AYCE Sushi and KBBQ, but the quality was okay to me. Nothing really stood out to me, not enough to make me want to keep coming back. The environment is pretty spacious, clean, & nicely decorated! The staff were helpful as well! 

The salmon nigiri was okay, some of my pieces were sliced pretty thin with lots of rice (a way for me to get full fast!) I ordered brisket, garlic beef belly, top sirloin, and bulgogi. The garlic beef belly was pretty tasty, my boyfriend and I ordered multiple of that and the brisket! Everything else was just okay, but definitely worth a try if you've never been there before!

How did this place got 4.5 stars ratings? This is when i doubt about yelps rating. The food was average and the two girls hosting are very polite, but the owner (old korean lady) is extremely rude and unfriendly.  She serve with an attitude.  Man, if you don't feel good, just don't come to work. My friends was hesitate to ask anything from her. And at the end she slapped a 20% service charge for our group.  Needless to say, if I tipped 30 dollars, i want a smile at least.   She was awfully rude.

Worst parking ever! However, aside from that the sushi!.....so amazing! The salmon was probably the most delicious I've had in awhile! Very happy about that. The other rolls were also pretty great! I recommend the Your Name roll if you like a bit of spicy bit not too overwhelming! Overall i definitely enjoyed the food here the ice cream sandwich was also great!. Not the bigger fan of red bean but it definitely didn't overpower the ice cream which is another plus! Will be back to try the AYCE kbbq next time :D

I've had this placed bookmarked for a long time, a friend suggested it to me. Last night I got off work late and wanted sushi so I decided to finally come. The restaurant is hidden right off of Sahara next to the palace station. I like that it closes at 2:00 am. I loved how spacious it was inside and the decor was really nice and authentic looking. They have 2 sides one for the sushi and one for the BBQ. I was hungry so I went with the ayce. For my appetizer I ordered the spicy garlic edemame, I didn't care for the flavor and it was too greasy. Skip that. The baked mussels were delicious! I loved the shrimp poppers, they were very flavorful and filled with crab inside. I had trouble deciding on which roll I wanted so my friend told me to try the panic roll which is her absolute favorite. I liked them but wasn't in love. I also got the Japanese lasagna and those rolls were good. The chef was very friendly and super fast with all of my orders. It's $21 for the lunch ayce and $26 for the dinner.  Overall I was satisfied and I'll come back to try the BBQ.

We came here for my husband's birthday. He was not quite sure whether he wanted sushi or Korean barbecue and ended up getting both. When they told us it was going to be around $30 each for the all-you-can-eat of both, we almost wept for joy. (Have I mentioned before that we're foodies?) This is insanely reasonable.

Our server, Linda, admitted she was new, but she was attentive and amazing. I think she's going to do very well here. Hubby got Soju for the first time since he actually was in Korea with military. It was divine; they went out of their way to get a really good brand and the price was very reasonable.

Food kept coming. And we kept eating. I wish I had 5 stomachs. There was not a bad bite in the bunch. From the Washington roll to their homemade cucumber kimchi, everything was absolutely incredible. We tried at least one type of each meat: chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, even squid. The squid was bloody amazing!

They gave us a generous portion of salad that started us off right. The dressing is inspired by God.

We will definitely be back. Possibly every payday, lol.
Awesome service, Derek was super friendly and the value for both k bbq and sushi is well worth it.. I would recommend here of u can't decide what to have, best of both world.

I love KBBQ and sushi, and when I say love them, I mean I could eat both every day if I could afford it. Also getting fat would be a bummer. When I found this gem on Yelp while passing on the Heart Attack Grill (fast food cooked in lard? no thanks), I lightweight freaked out and knew what had to happen.

***Location/Wait***

The place is located off-strip. We took an uber from DTLV, and it took about 10 minutes. I want to say the place is also about 10-15 minutes of strip by car also, but you will probably want to google it. We got there around 5:30 pm for dinner, since we had a flight to catch around 8pm. There was basically no wait, since we came before the dinner rush. But it did seem as it got closer to 7pm-8pm people were waiting at least 10-15 minutes.

***Service***

The service was definitely fast. I would hope so since we were only one of 3 groups eat at the time. We were constantly checked up on for either water or for more orders of food. Orders came out relatively quick as the servers got into the zone. That may sound a little weird, but our first plates came out a little slower. The more we ordered, the faster they came out. Overall service was excellent. I can't speak for when they're really busy.

***Menu/Price***

The menu. THE MENU. Well we decided to go with both AYCE sushi and kbbq because it was only $7. I personally justified it as if I ate the oysters and uni, it basically paid for itself. Oh quick note, it was only one order of uni and oyster per person unfortunately. There were so many options on the sushi menu that included poke, various fried and baked rolls, basic sushi with all the fishes that you would typically order (salmon, tuna, yellowtail, etc.). The whole sushi menu is massive, and it would take me forever to explain it. You will have to look at pictures of the menu to see.

On the kbbq side, the menu isn't as expansive as let's say Gen in California. The menu has all the essentials such as brisket, bulgogi, pork belly, and spicy pork. They also served kalbi and pork jowl which is rare at least for me. Again, you will want to look at a picture of the menu to see it fully, but the types of meats definitely satisfied me. The side dishes were also typical, but what surprised me was they had no rice paper (yo like wtf that's essential).

***Food***

Honestly, I'll be the first to admit that I'm not the best judge of meat and fish quality, but I thought Biwon's was decent. It was definitely the best I ever had, but it was still pretty damn delicious. The brisket never got too dry and was tender overall. My favorite was definitely the kalbi. It was tender and the marinade was awesome. It was my first time having pork jowl, and I definitely enjoyed the texture and taste of it. It was a pretty standard kbbq taste. It wasn't anything mind blowing, but definitely worth the $20 for all you can eat. I would give the sushi a 4/5.

The sushi was also above average. The fish was not the freshest, but definitely still tasty. I really enjoyed the uni and oysters. I always order them since I know they're the most expensive, but as I said only one order per person. I do not remember the rolls we ordered since my friends ordered them, but I enjoyed them too. I would give the sushi a 4/5.

***Overall/TLDR***

Overall this place does not have the best food, but since we have the option for both it definitely made the experience more enjoyable. Atmosphere was nice. Definitely a great hidden gem in Vegas if you're ever sick of eat on the strip. It might be a little pricey, but for the options you get, it's definitely worth it. I mean you're in Vegas, so you should expect to spend.

First time eating Biwon and I have to say it was very very tasty.  The service was great.  We sat on the sushi side and interacted with the sushi chefs both were really cool guys.   The manager Grace was very sweet.  def will be back again
been here 3 times so far! love this place! great food great service. always my first check point coming from Arizona!
Nice place, friendly staffs, quick service, highly recommended. Lunch & night with 17.95$ and all day ayce with 21.95$, not a bad deal at all.

Come on a Friday and decide to try their ayce bbq lunch menu, we ordered the beef brisket, slice rib eye, spicy chicken, pork belly, spicy pork, for the side, we have the shrimp, mushroom, jalapeno poppers, which all are pretty good, and the sides like kimchi, radish are all come with the meal....but all the meats are just average, kind of bland after you put in the grill, need more marinate on the beef brisket and pork belly, only the spicy pork and chicken have some taste to it... but if you're a meat lover, for $16.95, this place will surely get you filled.

Overall, the Korean BBQ and banchan were all delicious, not too sure about the sushi tho, we had assorted nigiri and the sweet lobster roll, it really wasn't that great.  The mushroom poppers and tempura were good and service was on point.  Would come back for the BBQ, not so much the sushi.

The all you eat bbq plus shushi was about $30. The meat was pretty good. I liked the short ribs, ribeye, and kalbi. The shushi was okay. We were there for about 2.5 hours because we were waiting for them to bring out the shushi. We did not eat that much.

This place is whatever. 
I thought it was a cool idea, having both kbbq and sushi in one place, but I think a place is better off specializing in one thing or another. 
The only thing we really liked was the short rib. 
Brisket was ok, but I never had any dipping sauce for it. 
The ribeye wasn't too good or seasoned well either. 
Onto the sushi side, it was alright. Nothing really stood out, and the rice for the sushi felt a little tough. 
Service, man. They need to hire more people. 
My meat came out later than the sushi my girl ordered. 
Our server came in and checked on us once during our meal. But had a little bit of an attitude. 
Cool place, but deng the bbq room is so cold, as soon as I got the meat off the grill, my girlfriend complained that it was cold. 
I probably wouldn't come back. 
This place is alright.
This place is super delicious and the price is just right!! All you can eat Korean BBQ AND sushi, can't beat that. If you're thinking about eating here JUST DO ITTT!

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile. This place is by far my favorite koren bbq place. We went at night and did just the bbq all you can eat and man was it good! I almost did the sushi as well but honestly just doing the bbq is the best! All in all this is my top choice for k bbq

Really great place to eat.
The meats n seafoods are very fresh.
You grill your own meats and seafoods so delicious

Tried for the first time tonight. Took the kids out for late dinner. Place was clean and spacious, food was good and price affordable. The servers and hostess were all courteous, accommodating and quick. 
AYCE KBBQ -- the meats were marinated well, the banchan refills came often and as requested. Didn't get to try the AYCE Sushi as we came after the last call but their menu has many selections to choose from. We will definitely be coming by here again when we are back in Vegas.

Great all you can eat barbecue!!! And the option of getting sushi too is awesome 

The service is excellent, everyone is very friendly 
Great for big party's

We found this place a couple trips ago while here in Vegas looking for some Korean barbecue. Easy to find, and parking is ample. 

They have lots of lunch and dinner AYCE specials, for either Korean barbecue or sushi. We have always opted for Korean barbecue. It costs $17.95 per person for the lunch AYCE, which includes about 10 (give or take) different meats, and a bunch more side dishes. We haven't tried dinner here yet. 

This last visit we ordered bulgogi, marinated pork, and brisket. For sides we got gyoza, and chicken wings. They also bring all of their standard kimchee sides, rice, and salad. For two people, it's a good amount of food and will fill you up.(If you over order, they charge you a la carte prices for leftover food). Everything was delicious! Meat was fresh, and sides were hot. 

Two reasons why they lost a star: service is sometimes a little off (but of course it depends on how busy they are), and they charge you for each individual drink - no refills, even on soda/lemonade. These can really add up at $1.50 each so we usually get a drink each, then water after we finish. 

We'll definitely be back, and will update when we have the chance to try dinner.

A lot of options for meat and sides. They also serve sushi which makes for a really good combination. The staff is very attentive. The brisket sauce is delicious! They have a nice variety of tempura. Best Kbbq place in town in my opnion. Would recommend this place for anyone looking for sushi or kbbq.

Amazing service and great sushi! Joan was really helpful on explaining how the menu works because it was our first time, he also gave us really good service and I wouldn't hesitate to come back here because of that.

10/10 would recommend!
One of the secret discovery in town. The food is great and the servers are very patient. I would definitely recommend this to my friend.

Great place. They have spot on service. The food was delicious. It's $20 for just Korean BBQ and $7 extra for AYCE sushi. You get 1.5 hours to order. I'm a fan, really enjoyed this place. Definitely will be back!

I chose to come here with my family since it has a good rating.  Over Gangnam, we decided we wanted really good korean bbq while we were away from Seattle. The place is not bad.  We were specifically briefed that if we had left overs we were going to get charged a la carte for those.  Price was not cheap already.  I was very happy to see that they steamed egg and i could order it on the side so i did.  There was 5 of us in our group.  They brought the meat we order and it was ok. The server didn't make our grill as hot so our meat cooked longer.  When we divided the meat bergen us, i asked for tell so will he while we ate, it would have time to cook. But it took so long for them to bring out the refill. On top of that, they still haven't brought out my steamed egg.  So i asked for it again.  When we got our refill, to the point of finishing off coming it..my steamed egg still didn't come out. So i told them id rather cancel it. We found out they burnt the first one. They didn't even apologize for it.  The Quality of meat is mediocre. Not even as tasty.  The variety you can choose from is limited..rib eye is extra... for the price it is so not worth it. A place i would not return to. I don't know how they got their high rating..but definitely not from me.

I've never been so excited to get ayce kbbq in LV. Would recommend, Jayden was our service and was so quick to assist us with any questions and got us what we need right away. Try the marinated beef chuck!

Even in Vegas a world of buffets nothing comes close to the quality! DEVI IS AMAZING! High quality, clean and superb staff! A little off the beaten path but perfect. Also open till 3 am. Love this place.

Very interesting pricing structure for the Korean/Sushi combination.  If want only Korean BBQ Buffet, it's $22.95 for dinner, for sushi only, it's $24.95.  If you want both, it's $29.95.

We all choose the Korean BBQ Buffet and the first comment is that the meat is of decent quality.  Even the top sirloin is marbled and tender, my best guess is that it's at least USDA choice grade.  Wished the rib eye was not limited to one per person, I would order it all night long.  The beef brisket is sliced very thin and leaving it in the grill till it's cooked to the point of being burnt is our favorite way to eat this.

The sides are standard, the kim chee is pretty good.  Service is excellent, with the servers constantly stopping by if you want to order more.

One note, it's a sketchy neighborhood and you may have to park on the street because their parking lot is full.  Carpooling is definitely recommended.
First visit here. We had a big group with us that night. Very accommodating. I def would come back. $22.95 ayce bbq if you wanted ayce sushi add $7.
This place was very nice and the staff was very welcoming. We had Kim and she was very helpful as it was our first time here. Definitely would come back.
Excellent sushi  fresh really great fish and the best sushi chef ever!!!!   Jay rocks. Just ask him to surprise you

This is one of the best Korean BBQ restaurants we have ever visited. The all-you-can-eat prices are an awesome deal regardless of the time of day you visit. The meat portions are fair and well prepared, the side dishes very tasty, and the service is excellent. The place is clean and spacious. This is now a must-visit stop for us whenever we're in Vegas.

This was our first stop when we got into town and it met expectations. For appetizers the gyoza was a favorite. For meats the bulgogi was super flavorful, and brisket was delicious as well. Also, our server Kim was amazing. Eat here!

Came in as a party of five yesterday to celebrate two July birthdays. One person wanted sushi, the other wanted KBBQ so we decided to try Biwon since they have both!

Immediately the hostess was kind and attentive. She wanted to seat our group once everyone arrived, one girl was missing, so she had us sit at the sushi bar to order drinks. Very kind of her. 

The food was okay. Some of the dishes just weren't appetizing. 

We mainly ordered from the sushi side which most of the food came to the table very very slowly. Some dishes didn't reach the table at all and somehow the chef still had time to prepare a roll "on the house". It was very kind of him, but we didn't really want it by the time it arrived. Most of the sushi prepared were just okay in taste. 

We ordered brisket, beef and pork belly along with some sides for KBBQ. Meat wise we only got the brisket and all else were forgotten, except somehow they tried to give us marinated chicken, marinated pork, and other marinated meats. Which none of us enjoy eating marinated meats at a KBBQ so that was not our order. 

The wait staff were kind to us, but weren't very attentive. When we asked for certain side dishes or even a mug for beer, we would have to flag them down a second time to remind them we ordered or asked for "x" thing. I think the staff may of been overwhelmed. Maybe they were extremely short staffed. Maybe there was a huge flux of people, which is doubtful since we saw maybe two or three tables occupied other than us. I can't really say since the wait staff, although kind, weren't very communicative. 

Overall, Biwon lacked in flavor of its dishes and their customer service. Hopefully it was just a bad night and they're usually a lot better.
Great service, amazing food the meat super soft and all the food pretty much melts in your mouth

So I've come here before and I've had a good experience that I had to come here again! I'm here for my 21st birthday so it totally fit my large group. I think the reason why I enjoy Biwon is the two options they have, AYCE SUSHI OR KBBQ. Best of both worlds! And for $27?! Can't beat that. :) Oh and it's CLEAN.... so definitely a place to check out!
Small portions, great variety, friendly staff and great sushi chefs.   You come out full and satisfied.  We've stopped coming to other ayce korean places once we found this place.

Great food great service. I like that there was a large selection of meats to chose from. It was well season and I liked that the grill was set up so everyone can easily reach it. 

I liked that the waitress was very precise in what we asked for. 

Green tea ice-cream was so good.
Joan is the best server. He explained the menu very great. I would recommend him. Thanks for my experience very good!! I'll be back!!!

This AYCE Korean BBQ is a good place to eat. Their meat selection is pretty good. The sushi selection is not bad either. If comparing their Korean BBQ meat over their sushi selection, I would opt for the meat section. However, never rule out their sushi menu. They have a good selection but seems like their fish cuts are thinner than normal. 

As for the restaurant, parking is limited. Make sure you are prepared for a backup plan and all your party are present or you will not be seated. Overall, I would recommend giving this establishment a try if you are opting for a Korean BBQ AYCE and not wanting to eat at the stip.

My husband took me out for my birthday, and as we had never tried Korean BBQ before, he chose this spot.  
I couldn't be happier. 

First and foremost, lets talk price.  
All you can eat sushi AND Korean BBQ...$30 a piece at dinner.  You cannot beat that price.  

The spot is clean, and let me tell you...it smells amazing, even outside.  

We had great service.  I think our server's name was Demi?  She was awesome, and explained everything that we had questions about. 

We had all of the normal sides:  dikon salad, noodles, fish cake, cucumber kimchi (omg amazing), bean paste, and some kind of meat dipping sauce that I wanted to drink.  

Korean BBQ items:
