brisket:  thin, delicious.
green tea pork belly:  really nice!  Good flavor
Butter and garlic squid:  mmmm.  I love calamari, and this was great.
garlic beef belly:  pretty yummy.  We crisped mine up like bacon.  It was great.
shrimp:  perfect
bulgogi:  favorite BBQ item of the night.  So rich and flavorful.
pork jowls: not our favorite, but we had to try it, since we'd never had it before.
spicy baby octopus:  really good.  We accidentally overcooked the head, but the tentacles were perfect.  

Sushi items: 
Scallop:  perfection
Cajun albacore: excellent:  perfect amount of spice
Unagi:  good! Not as well done as we asked for, but still good.
Garlic tuna:  amazing.
Tako:  excellent
Yuzu Yellowtail: favorite of the night.  This was perfection.  

We also had the gyoza, which are the best gyoza I've had out to date.  

Super happy with the service and the food. I could do with items being brought out just a tiny bit faster, but it wasn't a huge deal.  

Excellent.  We will most definitely be back, and soon.
Amazing service and food. The fact that you cook the food on your table is a really cool concept.
LOVE IT. They change the grill regularly Food was yummy Very friendly servers but will make sure we don't come starving cos there's a wait!!!

Definitely the best Korean BBQ i've had since i got back from overseas. Price for the dinner is not too shabby for the wide selection you get. Servers are on the ball and the meat is high quality for the price.
service was very kind. the staff are beautiful people. the view from the window was a brick wall so I wasn't impressed. the prices are very reasonable.

Love this place. Our second time here. It's a combination of sushi and Korean BBQ. Firstly Korean BBQ but u can add all u can eat sushi if u like for $5 more a person. We like the variety and the quality. We have come back because we like it so much. Would def recommend. Open till 3 am. Prices 17.95 for lunch and 21.95 for dinner. Add 5 for lunch and 7 for dinner

Came here when it first opened and really disliked the management and how things were done, so I haven't been back here in years. Was in the neighborhood and admittedly forgot which place this was when coming in, took all of 5 minutes to remember. The wait staff are incredibly rude, when turning on the stove and changing the grate I really felt how badly I was inconveniencing them. How dare I ask people to do their job....taking them away from their rousing conversation in the back room. Who cares about the paying customer..... won't be back for sure this time.
Great price for curing both cravings of kbbq and sushi. Sushi chef really friendly and great sense of humor

I had such great service here, for my first time the staff was so helpful. The food was delicious and you can tell the meat is fresh. I think it took maybe 5 minutes to get what we ordered. I recommend getting the sirloin and the spicy pork(sooo good). Im definitely coming back.

Honestly, great prices ($22) for unlimited meats for dinner and you can even order off the lunch meats. A large selection sides (the corn cheese was delicious!). The banchan provided were also up to par. Service was impeccable, such kind and attentive servers like Kim! Really recommend this place!

I love KBBQ and this was my first time at this place. The location is definitely a bit sketchy because it's kinda in a alley way. I invited my friend to come with my boyfriend and I and she said "Where the heck are you taking me."

The food is good. Shrimp popper was good even though there was barely any shrimp. It was more imitation  crab meat. The chicken wings were really tiny, it was kinda weird. The sauce a bit spicy and was overall okay (I'll probably skip that next time)

The service was good. The servers were attentive. 
You have the option to do AYCE KBBQ/ Sushi or both. I don't like sushi, but in my opinion if you do Sushi  and KBBQ- that's a whole lot of food. 

I love KBBQ potato salad, but this one is my least favorite one... I love steamed egg and this one was just okay. 
Overall, I'll probably come back.
Amazing all you can eat sushi. Very fresh and all made to order. Great price and very friendly staff!

Came here for the first time. All you can eat sushi & kbbq. Perfect combo! Great prices, food, & customer service. Derek was awesome & took really good care of us. Other employees frequently came around & made sure we were okay as well. I like how you can order different sides like vegetable tempura, gyoza, etc. as part as the kbbq all you can eat. Most kbbq places don't offer those types of sides. Very happy with this experience. Definitely our new go to!

The best place for kkbbq, Linda our server also the best! 

Yum cant wait to go back !
Bomb AF!!!!  Y'all need to try this little hole in the wall, it's sooooo goooood, I can't believe it's that good.  I mean.... wow
Amazing staff they were all good. They work in unison and that's very important with Korean BBQ. Loved the experience and the good was good just like I was back in garden grove, CA
Love eating here service and food is always great! The no rice rolls are delicious too!

I came here with two of my friends for the all you can eat BBQ. It was our first time coming here. Overall the service was great the only down side was that we were very hungry and we felt like the meat was cooking slow on the grill not sure if the fire was too low but the meat still did cook on it's own. We will definitely come back and try the all you can eat sushi.

Came to Las Vegas for a conference and was referred to Biwon by a local friend.
The food tastes really good and their meat is high quality. They had AYCE option that included a large sushi menu for no additional charge. First time finding an authentic Korean BBQ All You Can Eat + All You Can Order Sushi.  They also had udon on the AYCE if you're in the mood for soup and noodles. Steamed egg, tofu soup, and more! Also get the "Korean Ice Cream Sandwich" which is red bean with vanilla ice cream and mochi...so yummy.... also have ice cream in green tea and sesame flavors. The exterior of the building is an appealing traditional Korean style structure. Interior was spacious looks like would be accommodating for large groups. We went early so there was no wait. The staff from the host to the waitress and buss boys were all extremely friendly, quick, and attentive. We ordered a variety of meats including tongue, galbi, and brisket. The side dishes are plentiful and flavorful. Also order sashimi salad which kind of reminds me of ahi poke and comes in small portions. We also ordered the Ellen roll which is spicy tuna, spicy crab, cucumber, and I think avocado... that was really good. I think I definitely ate my money's worth because of the sushi menu. Also just 10 minutes away from the North Las Vegas Outlet which is where we went to next to walk off all the food. Most importantly, the price was extremely reasonable and I would recommend it to all my friends going to Las Vegas. I really think this beats the hotel buffets ... you get so much value and get to skip the long lines.
Sushi here is amazing! Service and atmosphere is the same. Great deals and even better food

LOVE!  After paying exorbitant prices on the Strip while on vacay, I looked to find something off the Strip and found this place on Yelp.  What did it for us was both sushi and Korean BBQ was AYCE.  The other places I found or looked at were just for the BBQ.  And the price was right so we ventured and we were glad we did.  Korean BBQ + Sushi AYCE for $27!  Food was fresh.  Wait staff were pleasant and responded pretty quickly.  And dessert included.  YAY.  There's a huge selection of meats- some of which we can't get back home on an AYCE menu so it was fun to try new things.  The marinated pork was a pleasant soft surprise- tasty at that too.  Pork Belly was fabulous- little thicker than we get back home, but bigger.  My husband, a former sushi chef, was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the Hamachi and the Ama Ebi.  Some things can only be ordered once per person but that was very few and far between.  Don't get too caught up on eating all the rice because the meat and sides are very good.  We are looking forward to our next visit to Vegas because we will be back!

I really loved this place. The food, quality, and holy moly the selection was almost overwhelming. I only tried the kbbq ayce and I have to say I honestly feel like it was the best meats (beef belly and brisket) I ever had. This is comparison to KOGI and MANNA in San Diego. The waiters were especially great and memorable. Shout out to Grace for being altogether  awesome. I have to go back to try the ayce sushi bc it looked really promising. Happy belly happy lady!
A place if u like to have korean BBQ and sushi all u can eat the same time!!! If you like to eat a lot and this is the place for you.

Every time I come here, the servers are on point and bring everything out to you so quickly. We like going on late nights for the $17.99 special. It can be a bit full on weekend nights, but late into the night it shouldn't be that bad. We absolutely love coming here and will continue to do so.
Wow can't believe I've never tried here before but man am I glad I did, this place is GREAT my new spot for korean bbq

Such a great place for all you can eat Korean BBQ! Definitely was skeptical at first because of the location, but once inside, the staff was friendly and very patient with me as I had never been before! Will be definitely going back very soon!

What?! AYCE kbbq  AND Sushi! It's a match made in heaven! This is a spacious place, you can do AYCE either, both or a la carte! We came on a Monday night and there were only a few cars, but within 15 minutes all the perimeter tables in our section were filled. We had two servers check in on us frequently which was very nice! The ban chan was great! I loved their potato salad! They give you moderate portions of meat, but that's to leave you room to try a variety. There's a house sauce that's yummy, they should sell it in a bottle! I'd buy it! The menu has a vast selection of meat and seafood. The nigiri we had was fresh and melt in your mouth! The AYCE even comes with dessert! Come here hungry! The hubs wants to bring his friends here next time!

My husbands meat was super fatty the marinade from mine wasn't the best. The Potatoes tasted a little old if that makes any sense. The thing that really got me was that if you get all you can eat, they charge you for any food that is left over. What if you don't like it? And the waiter told us if there was food left over, even though you pay extra for it, you can't take it home for leftovers. Just seems weird to me.

Update: no wonder the potatoes tasted old .....

They had a health inspection on 5/4/2017 and they got a C rating! That's bad in case you aren't sure. Curious why that wasn't posted at the front desk. I took a screen shot of it as proof of their rating.
Staff was very friendly! We had Kim and she was super helpful.  The food was really good value for the price.
One of the best BBQ*sushi restaurants I've been to in Las Vegas. All the food is super fresh, the quality of food is great, and the staff is outstanding.

Amazing food at an amazing price! Would recommend the brisket, bulgogi, gyozas, steamed egg, and the cheese corn! Derek was our server and gave us exceptional service! I will defintely be coming back the next time I'm in Vegas!

Today was the third time I've been here. 

I'd say the quality of the meat is good and the appetizers are tasty. Side dishes(especially fish cake) are delicious. I love the variety of appetizers from corn cheese, gyoza, tempura, etc. 

Although the food is good, the service here is terrible. First two times I was here, it was just okay. But today it was horrible. It seemed really slow too. Beside us, there was about only 3 other tables. One of the servers seemed nice since he explained the menu to my friends who has never been here before. However, in our order, we ordered gyoza, steamed egg, and 2 side dippings of bean paste, they never came after 20 minutes of eating. We called one waiter over and asked about it. He said he would go check on it for us, but never came back. 
Another 10 minutes later, we called over another waiter and asked him about it. He brought us the order of gyoza but didn't bring the bean paste or steamed egg. While he was there, we asked him if we can have some more fish cake. Didn't come AGAIN. Later on, we couldn't even find any of the servers to even order more. 

I honestly felt embarrassed with my friends. We were all very disappointed with the service here. I told them that this was a good KBBQ place compared to Tofu Hut or KBBQ garden, but today totally proved them wrong. I don't think I'll be coming back. However, if I do, I hope the service won't be terrible like this again.

Best Korean BBQ in town .. They have a lot of friendly servers. Great options of different dishes.. And many types of banchan (side dishes).. Its not crazy hot inside.. They also have great korean ice creams.. 

Ill recommend for Korean BBQ 

1. Ribeye
2. Bulgogi
3. Pork (Jowl)
4. Porkbelly
5. Beef Brisket

Very Very good service and the food was good.
Try the garlic beef belly. Good stuff.
Peace
Out
JAG

Great food and great service. Our server was Devi, who was efficient and always brought our orders  quickly, offered us constant refills, and was very polite. Definitely made the dinner I had with my family pleasant.

I usually go to tofu hut/house on Spring Mountain road. But this place is much better. You get what you pay for. It cost's more, but holy juices it's awesome. I'm Korean so I feel I can honestly say, this is the best Korean buffet I've been to. First time we got the sushi and AYCE, way too much food, second time I settled for just the Korean AYCE. Get the ribeye and don't overcook it, it's super tender and melts in your mouth. The Kalbi and  Bulgogi plus perfect Banchan!! love this place.
Great Korean BBQ, delicious marinated meats and great service from Lady  . This is our 3rd time and we will be back again. Less crowded means "No waiting time" is a plus! Price is very reasonable.
Tried this place out since was near by and gotta say excellent service and great selection of food. RJ was a great waiter never ran out of drinks or food.

The main reason we chose to eat here was because of the option of ayce for both sushi and Korean BBQ for only $30. The sushi I do have one complaint, the rice was way too sweet for my taste. The server told us the sweet lobster roll was the best but with all the sauce plus the sweetness of the rice, it wasn't my favorite. The Korean bbq was good for ayce. No real difference to me from all the other ayce restaurants though. Best thing was that I didn't have to go into China town.
Delicious! Great spot for bbq love this place can't get enough of it can't wait to come here again

I just don't understand the high ratings for this place. We did the all day AYCE which included the sushi for a total of about $26 / person. Overall, the quality of the food was below par. There are much better quality meats at the many other kbbq places in town. The sushi was not very fresh. We got the uni and it tasted fishy & bitter - very nasty. We had to return it. The oysters were very fishy as well.  The idea of having sushi & kbbq in one restaurant sounded good but after trying, I'll just stick to one cuisine at a time.

Just got back from Biwon and man oh man. This is it, the mother of AYCE. We love sushi, we love Korean BBQ and now we can have both!? It's right off the 15 freeway (Near Palace Station for those that know the area). It wasn't too busy, but they just opened up so I think we got lucky. We had the beef brisket, marinated chuck beef, and several nigiri and special sushi. The place did not disappoint in any way. The staff was super friendly and the food comes out quickly. I'm 100% coming back and I'm bringing my friends to check out this joint.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. We are visiting from out of town, staying on the strip, but we just had to seek out a Korean BBQ while we were here. Being half Korean, I've grown up all my life eating Korean food and this place was really good for what you pay. $22.95 and you get to choose from so many different appetizers, sides and proteins. For sides and apps we had calamari, fried mushrooms,  chicken wings and cheese corn (my personal favorite) and for proteins what didn't we have? Spicy pork, brisket, rib eye, kalbi(x 2), bulogi, spicy chicken, shrimp. It was all so good but the spicy pork, kalbi (marinated short ribs) and rib eye were my favorites. They also have a side of salad with a light sesame dressing that goes great with your proteins and rice, in place of lettuce that would be traditionally used. Last but not least, the best part of the whole thing was our server Ricky! He was so sweet and FUNNY, I was literally LOL'ing at his clever, yet cheesy, sense of humor. Even my boyfriend, who is real stickler when it comes to service, was charmed. Ricky was attentive and everyone else chipped in as well to help make sure we never had to wait long for anything. We will definitely be back.
Went there on a wed night food was good as usual got just the grill part but you can add sushi for 7 dollars more and they are both ayce.  Service is great here definitely would come back again
By far, The best Korean barbecue house in Las Vegas! When we receive the menu I was shocked at how low the prices were thank you for keeping the price low and the food excellent!

So delicious! Great prices and huge selection. Really nice dining and decor, I loved it. The staff was really attentive and friendly. I asked for a Korean ice cream sandwich and they said it is only for dinner and offered green tea ice cream instead, I declined. After they brought the check, she brought me an ice cream sandwich anyway and said my treat. SO SWEET! One of my favorite AYCE sushi places in vegas!
Devi and staffs are amazing! Where else can you find AYCE Korean bbq AND sushi in vegas? Meat quality reminds me of LA. Remember to get your grub on here. Sensational gem in LV! #euphoric
This place is perfect! Everything fresh and tasty. My new spot!! Rolls were great and meat was marinated well...

Tried Biwon because we love all you can eat Korean barbeque.   We upgraded to ayce sushi for 7 bucks as well. 

There is a good selection of meats to choose from.   Hit and miss there.   The kalbi we got were thick and very hard to eat but the pork shoulder we got was great.   The shrimp was also very memorable because it was bland and they weren't cleaned. 

The sushi we will skip that next time we try this place.   Didn't seem the freshest and the rolls were too drowned in sauce.  I know some people like that but I'm not a fan of every roll having cream cheese and or mayo. 

I noticed that this was mentioned in a lot of other reviews as well but they "were out" of the dessert again.   If they don't have the items they should just remove them from the menu. 

All in all we'd go back to try meats we didn't get and to give this place another chance.

had to come and try. and i have to say this is one of the best korean bbq i have had in vegas. plus all u can eat sushi.  TURN DO FOR WHAT.  
IF YA IN THE AREA STOP AND TRY.

First of all, this restaurant is PERFECT!! It's very affordable and you can eat anything you want. My favorite part is the spicy baby octopus cause it moves and swivels around, it was hilarious! Had to take a vid haha. The service is amazing! They're all very attentive and very friendly. We came here TWICE in just 30 hours lol. We came here May 27 noon time and then May 28 around 1:30 lol. My boyfriend and I suggested this to friends and family.  This restaurant is wonderful & the food is soo soo good. I loved the Bulgogi, Calamari, Miso Pork, Spicy Baby Octopus, Vegas Roll, Cucumber Kimchi, Kimchi, Fish Cane, Green Tea ice cream and so much more. We were so full that we maintained full the whole day! I love this place! Makes me wish I live in Vegas! Totally coming back here again! If I could rate and review 1000000 stars I would!

Pretty fun place with grill at the table options. For $25 you got an unlimited stream of meats and sides brought to your table. Most meat was pretty tasty, some were just so-so, but the staff was friendly and the price was right!

It's okay. This location is right next to Palace Station, on Teddy St. Parking was plenty, and was fairly easy to find a spot, however, their a little tight. 
The first thing i noticed when i walked into the restaurant was the space. This place is huge. It felt like some sort of lobby. While waiting for our party to arrive, we sat on the waiting area bench where one of the nails were sticking out and and my girlfriend scraped/cut her ankle from the nail. We notified the restaurant and the manager was nice and quickly provided aid and apologized, also note that they were kind enough to have her entire meal comp'd for that matter.
Food wise, we had the All you can eat KBBQ and some had the sushi and KBBQ. The KBBQ itself was okay, i mean.. nothing too different about it from any other KBBQ place. I didnt try the sushi but my friend had plenty, so i'll assume it was really good. One thing i am big on is cleanliness. I noticed some of the air ducts was really sticky and dusty, some even had webs on them. It made the food less appetizing when you look up and there's a bunch of filth.
Overall, a below-average experience. maybe it was that time of night i came in, but a restaurant should be at 100% from open to close.

My girlfriend and I came here from the Death Valley. 
Love the food here! Definitely try the all you can eat barbecue. The portion for each dish is a little bit too much though. Try not to order a bunch all at once. Take your time.

Worst experience ever! Was there for the fitness expo and went with friends to eat after. Worst experience with one of the female waiters. She was rude and kept leaving our table. She left our table for someone else to handle and missed most of our orders. We waited so long for our food. And when we asked it was never put it. They also had a problem with our payment where our table payed yet was missing a receipt and this waiter that kept on leaving said just pay it and go. Ummm No! It's not our fault you guys can't do your job correctly. And while handling this situation at the counter she kept leaving and come back to just Butt in and leave again. Wow! Have never seen such lack of management and customer handling skills. Definitely not coming back again. Food was not great also. Busser and other guys seem friendlier.

All you can eat Korean bbq and sushi?! Yes please! 
Lunch AYCE BBQ + AYCE sushi addition: $23.99
Dinner AYCE BBQ + AYCE sushi: $29.99
For a combination of Korean bbq and sushi, that's super cheap and meat quality is great. There were some complications with the sever and orders coming out 15-20 minutes later but I understood that everything is made to order but man, I was so hangry. I waited almost 30 minutes for my sushi roll to come out and almost 15 minutes for rice paper (they do make it fresh and it's super soft) 

Aside from food taking too long, the reason why I'm keeping this at a 4 star-review because when my friends and I walked in we were kept waiting at the host stand for almost 6 minutes before someone greeted us. After the greetings we waited an additional 5-6 before we were asked how many was in the party and where we'd like to be sat. Customer service overall could of been better that night, but food was still bomb

If I could give this 0 stars I would. I'll use the 1 star for cleanliness of the restaurant other than that, this place is a sad sad mimic of what could be really good Korean food. We arrived late, like 2am, and didn't know of any other Korean restaurants that were open (until we realized later in our trip). My husband is Korean (South, if any one out there who has been living under a rock for the last 50 years wants to know). We enter, & I presume a Korean female host welcomes us. He automatically speaks Korean and she replies, oh I don't speak Korean, which is fine because she is probably a Korean adoptee like me that just learned English. I asked her if anyone there spoke Korean and she says, no, sorry. Ok cool. That's fine. We chose bbq and sit on the bbq side. We are greeted by what looked to be a Hmong waiter (no offense to Hmong people, most of my friends are Hmong,however I know on the western side of the states most Hmong ppl call themselves Lao or Thai and don't realize they are Hmong...it's a midwestern thing). Anyway, the waiter approaches us and we order chadolbagi and sseumgeupsal. Which is essentially really expensive sliced beef and pork belly. He serves us some kind of lettuce salad, our banchan: fish cake, potato salad, and I think it was radish kimchi with some kind of strange tasting dipping sauce. He lights the grill and throws the meat on right way. Are you flipping kidding me? Anybody that grills knows you have to let it heat up first before applying the food. So of course the meat, which btw is no more than what you would get at your local grocery store, sticks to the pan and burns. And this guy, everytime we turned down the fire he would come and turn it back on high heat. Then, my husband asked for sesame oil with salt and pepper. Because if you go to a real Korean BBQ you get sesame oil as dipping sauce and rice and lettuce to wrap your meat in. Or at least some soybean paste. But here, nope. The guy says "oh I don't speak Korean " and my husband said, no sesame oil. Again the guy says, I don't speak Korean. Didn't even listen. My husband is like, I'm speaking English! You don't have sesame oil?! So then the guy finally gets it and brings us "sesame oil". Um no. It was vegetable oil with salt and pepper. I said, look here this is vegetable oil. And the guy argues, nope it's 100% sesame oil. We don't eat it. 5 minutes later he comes out with a "browner" dipping sauce and says, oh we have 2 kinds of sesame oil. Yup, no.that one basically tasted like watered down hoisin sauce with salt and pepper. We also ordered marinated spicy pork, idk y since the first two sucked, but it was ok. My husband said the marinade was no more than some soy sauce, msg, and brown sugar mixed together. We wasted over $60 eating here and we left the guy a tip, even though he was quite ignorant. You are sadly mistaken if you think you are eating authentic Korean food here. Save your money and go to Chinatown or the other Korean restaurants in Vegas which I will also review.

The first time we came to this place was around 2-3 months after it opened. We don't remember the exact day but we had the sushi + kbbq buffet for around $27.99/person. It was nice to have so many menu options and we did enjoy having both sushi and kbbq at the same time. Service was quite good that night and was overall a pleasant experience. 

Recently we decided to go there again. When we came in we noticed some customers waiting at the door when the restaurant was practically empty. There were three servers standing in their own circle chatting not too far away from us. After around 5 minutes or so the group in front of us were seated. While we were still waiting for anyone to notice our existence we decided to check out the menu. We soon found out they didn't seem to have the combined sushi + kbbq option anymore. Remembering that kbbq was pretty mediocre at this place last time, we decided to leave the place since we weren't seated anyways. Right when we were about to go out the door the servers now stopped chatting and one of them ran to us and was like 'How many?' 
Yeah right a little too late now bye~ 

Later that night we went to the highly rated Gangnam and had horrible experience. Can check out my review for Gangnam if you decide to find out more about the story.

This place was ok. I went around 4pm and it wasn't busy, yet it took awhile for them to seat us and then to take our order. The service after that though was good. There food tasted great. We had bulgogi, spicy pork, tempura, cow tongue, rib eye, spicy squid and other things and they all tasted great. So for food quality I give a five and the portions are awesome. The three stars, is just because they took so long in seating and getting our orders

Where to begin if you have a big group don't even bother calling them to reserve. They say reservation accepted. They should say reservation for small parties only. And might as well just go to any other Korean bbq. Better service better experience.

all jokes aside the  food was great  and the service  was even  better
